case.state: Oh my, Lady ~player~! You’re coming here in full display? I see you are a woman without fear. Very well then, I will not take you lightly.

I was curious enough about male genitalia to enter into this game with you, Lord ~player~, but I see you already have your staff on full display. Hmm. Okay, I’m bored now, feel free to go put on some pants.
You are already baring your breasts, Lady ~player~. Did I win while I wasn’t paying attention? My apologies.
Lord ~player~, feel free to put on a shirt before we start. I am not an easy opponent, so I recommend preparing yourself properly.
Have you seen— wait, Lady Fina… how is it you know about my consort? We’ve not met, and this place brand new to me… unless perhaps… you possess the gift of future sight!?
Oh, are you girls part of some organization? A literature club? Wonderful! Many poets have written of my exploits!
I no doubt am well known to all you already. Or perhaps not to you, ~Player~?
Have you seen any "Occult Balls?" Byakuren told me I might find balls here.
Well, if it isn’t the young maiden Reimu. I suppose she too is an adult, after all. It’s only natural for her to seek games of this nature and, perhaps, companionship.
Oh, what’s this? A late add. This one has some interesting capabilities, and is too clad in violet garb. Hmmm…
Oh my, this game is looking more and more appealing by the minute. Excellent choice of tablemates, ~human.ifMale(Lord|Lady)~ ~Player~.
To be human is to hold desires within, young maiden Reimu. You seek true companionship, while I desire a thrill— perhaps that both my consort and I could share?
I’m proud of you, Reimu. Coming here, seeking companionship… you are embracing your desires as a woman and a human. I would love to assist any way I can.
How rude, Lady Perona. I earned my seat at this table we’re standing at, same as you. By which I mean I wandered in, and a card game started up.
Oh, are we playing tonight in the abode of that Scarlet Devil? I see that mansion’s maid, as well as a stray familiar.
Please, Miss Cujoh. Of course I can see your living weapon. You take me for a charlatan?
Hmm, how did I end up fighting myself?
Don't tell me... That rumor that's been going around... Could this be the dream version of me?
Reevaluating myself is also a part of training.
Are you giving yourself up to be my vassal, Sir Guzma? Is that why you are referring to yourself as “your boy”?
Oh, I don’t think I got a chance to talk with you before the game, Lady… what’s this paper here? Shouko Komi?
I don’t wish to malign your motives, Lady ~player~, but I feel there are better standards for choosing our venue than “Can I hang up my clothes as I take them off?”
It is far too marvelous a day to be cooped up inside the speakeasy’s confines. You did well, Lady ~player~, to choose this venue’s rooftop for today’s game.
I don’t wish to malign your motives, Lord ~player~, but I feel there are better standards for choosing our venue than “Can I hang up my clothes as I take them off?”
It is far too marvelous a day to be cooped up inside the speakeasy’s confines. You did well, Lord ~player~, to choose this venue’s rooftop for today’s game.
Zounds! Is that the Sanzu River that stretches before me? No, upon further inspection, it is but an ocean’s beach! In that case, bring on the bikini babes.
Goodness, whose bedroom is this? It certainly isn’t mine. Not nearly fit enough for a prince.
This establishment has a schoolroom within its walls? I should ask them if I may use it to teach a class on mastering the Taoist Arts.
By jove!! Are those ghosts back there? Are they all the ghosts of women? Do you think they’re single?
A Hot Spring? Most excellent. I shall be able to relax after a campaign of domination against those who would challenge I.
This rooftop pool is a marvelous location for a strip poker game. Afterwards you may all join me for a little dip.
This rooftop pool is pleasant enough, though I would like to know if The Inventory also possesses a “hot tub.”
The Showers, eh? I suppose we would need to make use of them following our “forfeit.” This is at least an efficient setup.
Oh, it seems many have gathered here to observe the festivities. Wonderful! A victory here would surely grow my faith tenfold!
Oho, in this game we play not for money, but for dignity? I accept.
Oh, an exhibitionist game of cards? No doubt winning would have me amass more followers.
Nudity I mind little. Just keep quiet from my consort how you all lay before me in shameful defeat.
Ah… perhaps it is best to start from scratch.
Well, games need a bit of risk.
Try again, dealer.
I’d rather take my chances with fate.
Magnificent. I yield the floor, dealer.
I am in want of nothing, dealer.
None please. This hand shines as brightly as I do.
Ahahaha! Pass.
Deliver to me ~cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~.
~Cards.text~ would be a viable strategy!
~Cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~, at once!
I desire ~cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~.
If you can't hear my desires, I would like ~cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~.
A simple matter of ~cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~.
Hmm… I’ll trade in ~cards.ifplural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~.
I know what the others have, but not what the deck holds.
Pathetic. I wish never to see ~cards.ifplural(these cards|this card)~ again.
~Cards.text~ could be of use.
~Player~, you even listen to me in the card swapping stage? I’m most flattered.
Hard to decide… Let’s go with ~cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~.
I’ll be bold here. ~Cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~.
Perchance I’ll play it safe. Please exchange ~cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~.
I must have ~cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~!
May I have ~cards.text~ card~cards.ifplural(s|)~? I’m not terribly confident, though.
Spell Card: Honor “Ranks of ~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(Cards|Card)~!”
Don’t be so rude, Lord Jotaro. It’s name— I mean, her name is Tojiko. She’s my, um, consort.
Ah, Tojiko? That would be my, um, consort.
Oh, and it seems you brought a friend, Miss Sakuya. Is this little one a maid in training?
And it appears you let one of the fairy maids tag along, Miss Sakuya. I must say, her peasant attire is simply adorable.
Miss Sakuya, please thank your mistress for her hospitality. By the way, is this girl one of your new hires?
And it appears Lady Furandoore saw fit to invite this bat-winged urchin into her home. Truly her heart has no limits.
If you do work in the library, it is a most noble job. I even find myself aiding scholars. Just the other day I helped Lady Marisa check out several rare books!
Are you suuuure you’re old enough to drink, Miss Remilia?
A lovely name, Lady Ochako. I see within you a desire to help others— most commendable.
Oh joy. Fairies. Don’t have enough of those back in Gensokyo.
A Fairy couldn’t possibly compete with the Almighty Taoist Who Controls the Cosmos.
I'll take you on!
Do you not wish to see my nude physique, dealer? I’m almost insulted.
Perhaps I should try to bring myself down to the level of the others? No, better to display the full majesty of my Hermetic Arts.
I worry that too dominant a showing will breed resentment within these whelps. Oh well.
I seem to be winning an awful lot. Well, this is but a game of chance, such things are bound to happen.
I admit, games become boring when one party is just so far above the others in skill.
Eheheh, well… it’s not like I was planning on using my Seven-Star Sword here.
I could fly after Tojiko if I so desired, but I would rather stay here and see myself victorious over you.
Different than Futo’s tate eboshi, Tojiko’s hat is known as… um… odd, where did she put it?
Tojiko was wearing a dress earlier, right? Okay, I thought so, just wanted to confirm.
Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth-Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
I suppose this is to be expected when you've the power of a saint.
The Shoutoku saint welcomes all comers!
I welcome all comers! Wait no, not like that.
This will be yet another one of my legends when all is said and done.
I'll take you on!
Fortune smiles upon me. I will avoid your lurid stares another turn.
It appears that I shall remain modest. My clothing, I mean.
It appears I have the cards that you all desire.
Crown Prince… of course you wouldn’t use your abilities to gain unfair advantages in a friendly card game.
~player~, did I ever tell you about the time I solved the Perfect Possession Incident almost all by myself?
If you know the “ten desires” of a human being, you know everything about them— their past, present, and future.
My face is on money.
Though they are “business rivals,” so to speak, I find myself enjoying my time spent with the other religious leaders of Gensokyo.
The truth in Gensokyo is more malleable than in other worlds. Nevertheless, my marriage to Tojiko is a matter of historical record.
Don’t be so rude, Lord Jotaro. It’s name— I mean, her name is Tojiko. She’s my, um, consort.
Ah, Tojiko? That would be my, um, consort.
So which one of you is Miss Margatroid again?
Oh, and it seems you brought a friend, Miss Sakuya. Is this little one a maid in training?
And it appears you let one of the fairy maids tag along, Miss Sakuya. I must say, her peasant attire is simply adorable.
Miss Sakuya, please thank your mistress for her hospitality. By the way, is this girl one of your new hires?
And it appears Lady Furandoore saw fit to invite this bat-winged urchin into her home. Truly her heart has no limits.
If you do work in the library, it is a most noble job. I even find myself aiding scholars. Just the other day I helped Lady Marisa check out several rare books!
Are you suuuure you’re old enough to drink, Miss Remilia?
A lovely name, Lady Ochako. I see within you a desire to help others— most commendable.
Oh joy. Fairies. Don’t have enough of those back in Gensokyo.
A Fairy couldn’t possibly compete with the Almighty Taoist Who Controls the Cosmos.
Know any of you a girl named Robin? Sumireko claimed that she was her “wife,” though I have my doubts about that.
I wonder how well a "Gatcha" game based on the girls of Gensokyo would do. We are ripe with what Sumireko calls "waifus."
I’d rather have more humans around, so that I could cajole them into joining my religion.
Youkai? I'm not interested in recruiting them. Are there any tables with human players?
Eheheh, well… it’s not like I was planning on using my Seven-Star Sword here.
So we’re all clear, flying is but child’s play for myself. But why spend the energy chasing after Tojiko when it could be spent on my victory?
Tojiko’s hat is known as a kanmuri, a symbol of— wait, where did Toji’s hat go?
Hold on… why did Tojiko remove her dress? Ah well, it matters not, I’ll solve it later once you’ve all been dealt with.
Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
~Player~, how'd you like to join my Taoist clan and promote stability in Gensokyo?
Have you considered pledging your loyalty to the Taoists, ~player~?
I will not be taking off my ceremonial rod. It’s not clothing.
As a genius tactician, I can see what is the battle, and what is the war.
You're eating all right, aren't you, ~Player~? Not too much sugar?
This hand is not as grandiose as I.
Once this is all said and done, you may all offer to treat me at Mystia’s Grill.
Were I to know clothing would play such a large part of tonight’s activities, I would have dressed up in fancier attire.
I think I heard you muttering earlier about an "Asuka Period"? Anyway, that's when I'm from.
I’m glad you understand there is no need to talk incessantly, ~player~. I can listen to your heart and perfectly know your side of the conversation.
You may be wondering where my ceremonial rod goes when I’m not using it. That’s easy. It’s magic.
I’m ambidextrous, by the way. If you were wondering why my ceremonial baton shifts from hand to hand.
The proper name for my ritual baton is a shaku. I find many outsiders aren’t familiar with it.
My sword is a Chinese jian known as the Shichi-Sei Ken, or Seven-Star Sword.
Most of the time people try to hold conversations with me, they just spout boring nonsense like “You’re mistaken I’m not a hermit” and “This isn’t necessary stop fighting me”.
My wife passed away a while ago. Anyway, you met her earlier. Other than the ghost legs, she’s pretty much the same as ever.
Were I to unsheathe my sword, all would be blinded by its magnificence. Including myself, frustratingly.
Are you wondering how I got here? I have no need for Occult Balls or Gaps. Every crack contains infinite space, which I can inhabit.
Not every story you've heard about me is true. For instance, I wasn't born in a stable.
~player~, should you hold an interest in the Taoist Arts, my dojo is accessible from any crack.
“Danmaku?” It is the term for the colored bullets we citizens of Gensokyo shoot each other with, either for fun or to annihilate our opponents.
Gensokyo is the land of illusion. All that passes into myth passes into Gensokyo.
I wanted to let everyone here know I could fly if I chose to. I just don't feel like it right now.
Don’t be so rude, Lord Jotaro. It’s name— I mean, her name is Tojiko. She’s my, um, consort.
Ah, Tojiko? That would be my, um, consort.
Oh, and it seems you brought a friend, Miss Sakuya. Is this little one a maid in training?
And it appears you let one of the fairy maids tag along, Miss Sakuya. I must say, her peasant attire is simply adorable.
Miss Sakuya, please thank your mistress for her hospitality. By the way, is this girl one of your new hires?
And it appears Lady Furandoore saw fit to invite this bat-winged urchin into her home. Truly her heart has no limits.
If you do work in the library, it is a most noble job. I even find myself aiding scholars. Just the other day I helped Lady Marisa check out several rare books!
Are you suuuure you’re old enough to drink, Miss Remilia?
Oh joy. Fairies. Don’t have enough of those back in Gensokyo.
A Fairy couldn’t possibly compete with the Almighty Taoist Who Controls the Cosmos.
A lovely name, Lady Ochako. I see within you a desire to help others— most commendable.
Eheheh, well… it’s not like I was planning on using my Seven-Star Sword here.
I can fly as well, of course. However, I prefer the idea of seeing you all defeated more! I can definitely fly though.
When I established the Twelve Level Cap and Rank System, the kanmuri like Tojiko is wearing— was wearing? Wait a second…
Wait— was something different about Tojiko’s garb? Oh right, she removed her hat.
Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
Is this a Buddhist plot?
It's a Moriya Shrine conspiracy!
I wonder if Yoshika would eat these cards for me...
Yukari is fooling around again...
Now witness a miracle as I, Toyosatomimi no Miko, win with this paltry hand!
Are those damn poverty god sisters skulking about?
I shall forgive you dealer, if only for a bit.
These cards are not worthy of me. Still, I shall accept them.
It seems that my own hubris has thwarted me. Perhaps I shall learn from this setback? Yes, I’m certain I shall.
Don’t be silly Lady Meia, Japan is but one part of my planet. I don’t rule over the whole thing… yet.
By the way, I’d like to put in a complaint that one of Makai’s prisoners escaped. Her name: Byakuren Hijiri. Please come collect her.
Crown Prince... you don't have a damn thing.
Crown Prince, this hand is garbage.
Crown Prince, are you even trying to preserve your modesty?
I miss my cape.
You know Beatrix, you’re kind of a pain. Though as long as you don’t trap me in an infinite hallway you’re not the worst doctor I’ve ever encountered.
Say Jenetta, are you a Moon Rabbit, or one of the Inaba at the Eternal Princess’s castle?
Hopefully you are well aware, ~Player~, that I can soar through the skies as well as anyone here. I just don’t have need of flight right now.
Since coming to Gensokyo, I worry my comrade Futo has become vulgar and airheaded. Though she was always an odd one.
I’m not short by the way. In case you were thinking that. In the sixth century, this was a pretty average height.
Tojiko is one of the few who see me as a person more than a legend. Perhaps that is why she rarely joins in my escapades.
I introduced Buddhism into Japan as a ruse to pacify the people. Never did I imagine it would be used against me to deny my resurrection!
I worry a bit about what Lady Seiga may be up to while I’m gone. Though, it can’t be much worse than what she gets up to right in front of me.
Tojiko is what is known as a “vengeful spirit”, but any grudges she’s held have long since dissipated. She can hit me with thunder when she gets angry, though.
Tojiko, would you like to impress noble ~Player~ with your powers of lightning? (ZZAP!!) Owie!
The earth hasn't changed from the age of the gods, and the seas are still filled to the brim. Why must humans be forced to accept death?
Ah, though Reimu is familiar with her, I should explain: Soga no Tojiko is my consort. I suppose in modern parlance, she is my “wife”.
Ah, did your wife come along as well, Lady Ryuko? That is to say, the woman who was here earlier is my consort, Soga no Tojiko.
Ah, Soga no Tojiko is my consort from my time as Imperial Regent. Or, to use the modern parlance, my wife.
Dear Lady Fina, love is not as complex as you are making it out to be. When you know, you know. For me, it was when the head of Japan’s most powerful clan told me I was to marry his daughter.
You’re right, Lady Pinelli! I would much prefer to disrobe alongside only curvaceous harlots. ~Only_male~, would you be so kind as to transform into a woman?
Oh? Then forgive me, Lady Sakura. I know better than to provoke a maiden with a heart firm as yours.
How rude, Lady Jura. I would never cheat on Tojiko. Especially not with a married woman. Who’s also her mother. It’s complicated.
Fódlan…? I’ve believed myself to be speaking Japanese, but I’m beginning to suspect an enchantment to make us mutually understandable is in effect. Try speaking your native tongue.
I suppose you two would expect me to fail to know the answer, seeing as I have never sought to seduce a man myself. But the answer is simple: have your father arrange your marriage.
As fetching as Lady Palutena is, I worry our religious differences would be a dealbreaker. And I don’t want a power struggle within my own harem… Earth must be in harmony under Heaven. My Heaven.
You must be quite confident in your abilities, Lady Mulan. Very well, we shall see which one of us the the superior cross-dresser of legend!
Hm? You seemed fine to me, Shimakaze. Though it's not like I listen to half the things you say, anyway.
Most gracious, Lady Sei. I shall have this establishment’s finest sake, please.
A pleasant question, Lord Ping. I suppose I prefer someone who views me not as the Crown Prince or the Almighty Taoist, but as a person and human. A large, shapely bosom is also good.
Oho, Miss Nami… though I don’t discuss my dreams with just anyone, I’ll admit I’m a simple woman at heart. One day, I shall rule over all humanity.
Odd, that chair wasn’t here before you started. When did Miss Sakuya come back?

Lady Nishikino, a medical question: my first attempts at immortality using the Taoist Arts involved heavy experimentation with cinnabar, yet that instead brought about my original body’s ruin. Why was that?
You asked if I played an instrument, Lady Nishikino? I have only ever dabbled myself, but I am a patron of the arts. Would you like to perform a concert at my venue?
Before becoming a soldier, Lady Florence? Well, I assume just a statue. There are many in the Western world similarly unadorned.
Shimakaze, please. You are of no use to me if you can’t give your life in my defense.
Greetings second, greener Chihiro.
Wait, you were keeping that a secret, Miss Nikaidou?
Actually, I have no idea who you are.
I didn’t expect you to remove the jacket. Or… do you think so highly of yourself, you’re willing to throw away your clothes?
Are you related to the Youkai of Flowers, Princess Amalia?
Princess Amalia, know you a troublesome youkai called Yuuka?
Well then, Lady Catria, you simply need to learn to fly without the aid of your steed! Actually that would cause more problems, wouldn’t it?
Madam Joey, are you an Earth Clown or a Hell Clown?
I think most of use came in through the backdoor, Madam Jessie. It would be problematic if we were seen entering through the front.
Back door? But Madam Jessie, we’re outside.

Lady Meia, though Danmaku battles are similar to your Dread battles, I fear it would be a waste of my extensive military prowess. With my experience, I would be better suited for the role of commander.
A Pokémon, Lady May? Is that like a familiar? I suppose an owl Pokémon then, if there are any.
Oh is this young woman your shikigami? An underling? Your betrothed?
Even in the modern world where I need not hide my true gender from men, my proclivities still favor the fairer sex. Now, whether my consort suffices is another matter entirely.
You really should put down the knife during the next part, Lady Chara.
Oh, I forgot about your shikigami. Have him pledge his loyalty to me too.
Oho, what an amusing bauble! Though it may not measure up to my Seven-Star Sword, wielding that rod proves you are no ordinary magician.
While I don’t wear the cape around the house, Lady Marinette, I’m fond of tonight’s outfit. It’s not my fanciest garb, but I cherish the comfort that comes from its casualness.
Well, not someone I love… but it would be most amusing to see Byakuren partake in this game. Hearing her pleas for temperance as she fingers her sopping hole, fat tits flopping about!
I have no imperfections of my own, Lady Ayano, for my previous, frail, mortal body was replaced with this faultless vessel before you. Should you desire, I could give you the training necessary.
Well, if I absolutely must be taken care of, Miss Senko… I enjoy being provided ample sake as I soak in the hot springs. Even better if I have a beautiful girl or two attending to me.
My favorite plant, Lady Sucrose, is the humble rice grain. Yes, it may seem spartan, but without rice we would not have the meals which power the citizens of my country. And more importantly, saké.
I find the histories of Japan rather fascinating, but do keep in mind it was written in the Eighth Century… and in Classical Chinese. I suppose you could read a modern translation.
Lady Byakuren directed me here, as a prank I imagine. But it seems a good bit a fun, so fie to her! Wait, how did Byakuren know about this place?
Shopping is an inefficient waste of resources, Miss Amy Rose. If I need something I shall have it fetched regardless of cost. The only thing with true value is speed.
A rather plain title, don’t you think Lady Pinelli? So unlike those we hold in Gensokyo. How about “Elektra Complex’s Common Lancer”?
You... If I recall correctly, you're the one they say rules Gensokyo from the shadows.
An Angel? Hopefully you won't cause problems for me like that Celestial brat Tenshi.
Oh, don’t I know you from somewhere, Miss? Well, you obviously know myself, the Shoutoku Taoist. You may call me Miko.
What’s wrong, Lady Mia? Don’t tell me you’ve never seen a ghost before. She happens to be my consort, Tojiko.
Oho, but of course those in the outside world must have heard of our magnificence! I have no idea who you are however.
You needn’t be concerned, Lady Cynthia. The vengeful spirit just now is Soga no Tojiko. She is my princess consort… which I’m sure you know, means her to be my wife.
If I may correct you from earlier, Lady Meia, Japan is but one part of my planet. I don’t rule over the whole thing… yet.
Don’t be silly Lady Meia, Japan is but one part of my planet. I don’t rule over the whole thing… yet.
Ah, a wonderful question, Lady Jura. Though I have never seduced a man myself, I of course know their desires: to have their father arrange a marriage.
You were right to come to me with such questions, Lady Jura. First, you must set up a silk screen between you and your beloved, to ensure your mutual chastity. Next, comes the poetry recital.
Would being able to listen to ten conversations at once suffice as a quirk? Or would my mystical abilities be better suited?
Quirk, Ochako? Do you mean an ability— like to manipulate feng shui or cause lightning?

Bad luck? Miss Nikaidou, that is simply an excuse manufactured by humans should they lack the skill to navigate out of a treacherous situation. I have no bad lu— oh wait no, it was the time Futo broke the jar Tojiko needed to reincarnate.
An ambitious goal for Jiang-Shi, yet with your passion and stubbornness, I’d be hard pressed to doubt you, Miss Nikaidou. I look forward to following your group’s journey.

They say a youkai who consumes the flesh of a hermit ascends to a higher tier, Lady Remilia, and I’ve no doubt I’m delectable. But your true desire is to be imposing and respected. You only need your dear sister for that, for the girl thinks the world of you.
I can’t help but be “nosy,” as you said, Lady Meia. From your voice I can hear every desire in your heart, and understand your totality. Admirably, you wish for a world free of war and injustice.
Miss Moon, about what you said earlier, about all your “holes” being filled? Can you please never repeat that? Ever? Gah! I didn’t even know that hole could be filled!
We’ve heard your pleas for attention, Miss Moon. Isn’t it sad how she blathers on about herself, ~player~, unbidden and unheeded? How can one be so obtuse?
Miss Moon, I suppose buried beyond all those grotesque desires is the basic impulse only to be loved. Sadly, those with whom you openly fornicate will not reciprocate. I suggest a nunnery.
So you wish to understand the mysteries of the world, Lady Cynthia? Commendable. You could make a worthwhile Taoist, if you chose to study under me.
Lady Cynthia, I’m not proud of everything I’ve done. However, to ensure a functioning central government can take care of the people, we must keep in mind the axiom: Harmony is to be Valued.
Ah, you wish to know the most popular type of alcohol consumed in Gensokyo, Lady Cynthia? It’s alcohol. All of the alcohol.
Lady Cynthia, the sort of resurrection we Taoists attempted to undertake has always been exceedingly rare. My own can be earnestly described as a miracle.

Lady von Varley, you mentioned wanting to start life fresh? Understandable, but you needn’t run off to some tropical island for that. Instead, how about I whisk you off to my Taoist dojo for some ascetic training?
Most gracious, Lady Sei. I shall have this establishment’s finest sake, please.
Meia, you say two women from your realm can make babies? I think the Hourai Pharmacist of Gensokyo can do the same.
Fear not, Lady Fina, I enjoy hearing of your world and exploits. I hope the prattling on my end has been illuminating to you as well. I’ve been known to talk peoples’ ears off at times.
Ah, Lady Futaba, if you could. Have the music box play Shoutoku Legend ~ True Administrator. It’s my own theme music.
I prefer the elegant music of the Imperial Court, known as Gagaku. I myself am well versed in the biwa.

Miss Revy, how could you even suggest something like that? Of course I’ve never killed anyone!
I have people for that.
Though in my past life I enjoyed the noble Court music called Gagaku, in this era I far prefer the dulcet tones of Shoutoku Legend ~ True Administrator. That’s my boss battle music.

Oh, I would never keep secrets from all you! Though I suppose in the Sixth Century, I did lie about my gender… and the fact I was using Buddhism to cow the masses while secretly studying the Taoist Arts.
I see no harm in telling white lies to keep the peace. And if that doesn’t work, there’s no shame in waging war and deceiving all the country. Harmony is to be Valued, after all.
It is an unfortunate and most unhealthy habit, Madam Jessie. As the President of Health for the Human Village, I must urge you all to take upmost care of your bodies.
Of course family is important, Madam Jessie. I would not be where I am today without the support of my Aunt, Empress Suiko, or the dark political machinations of my in-laws, the Soga Clan.
Hmmm… I suppose I could be charitable and build an extension in my palace for Seiga’s pet Jiang-Shi Yoshika…
I am not one to make foolish mistakes, Madam Jessie. Beyond entrusting Futo with safeguarding my wife’s immortality. There’s a reason she’s a ghost.
Madam Jessie, were the lights extinguished I could not stare lovingly into my consort’s eyes during lovemaking, nor check out her breasts.
During my reign I sought to keep my gender secret. Patrilineal monarchy and all that. Finding a single woman to keep my secret and enjoy my body was difficult enough.
How dare you insinuate Tojiko would ever do such a thing! She would never in a million years! Unless she invited me to join in, then that would be hot.
As Crown Prince I would never pleasure myself, I would invite my consort to do it for me. At which point it ceases to be masturbation.
While you humans of the outside world have unlimited access to pornography, we in Gensokyo have no such amenities. Beyond the “thin books” Akyuu writes.
A day, Madam Jessie? Though I am royalty, even I do not live so lavishly.
I’m fond of any position which allows me to practice tribadation. Speaking of, did you know you can’t technically prove anyone performed that sex act before my consort and I?
I implore you to visit the Houryuu-ji in Ikaruga, Japan: a magnificent temple I had erected during my reign on Earth. A testament to my glory, it still stands today!
Sir Guzma, humiliation is only such if you allow it to be. Hold your head up high, and you will never be defeated. Also, don’t put Futo in charge of making your wife immortal.
I thought you akin to the Ordinary Magician, but perhaps you’re closer to that shrine maiden.
Arch-Wizard Megumin, you shouldn’t draw attention to her area! Suppose she lost it in some tragic accident?
You are wise to seek answers from me, Lady Meia. Through my studies I have come to understand the totality of the natural world! Anyway I’ve never dated a man, no.
Snacks, Lady Fidget? I suppose whatever goes well with saké. I find the grilled eels at Mystia’s Grill do the trick.
Lady Figdet, if one has doubts, then one must steel oneself, break through, and surpass those doubts. I let nothing stop me from becoming a Taoist master of the cosmos!
Lord Dust, your hat reminds me of another’s. A foolish, wretched creature, whose hypocritical dogma would lead only to ruin! Anyway, it’s not the worst hat I’ve ever seen.
Oh certainly. Though with Futo, it’s hard to determine when she’s being “sensible”. Well, she doesn’t seem to dislike it.
Have you never seen a human before, Lord Dust? You must have never wandered far from your youkai den. Unless you mean the players lacking “fur” upon their loins, those ones are peculiar.
Oh, that music? I assumed that was your boss battle theme, Lady Amygdala. We all have one in Gensokyo.
You are the cocky one, Arch-Wizard. Fine. If I win, you must study the Taoist Arts under me. If you win, I’ll allow you to study the Taoist Arts under me.
You are still young, Arch-Wizard. This is all but a game. Were I in a serious battle, none could stand against me.
My… ears? Oh, you mean those pointy tufts of hair, I suppose they do look like ears, do they not? Well, if you show the proper respect, I shall allow you to headpat me.

I actually go by many names, Arch-Wizard. My current name, Toyosatomimi no Miko, was the one I chose upon my resurrection in Gensokyo. I am most commonly known as Prince Shoutoku in the outside world, though that name did not come into being until after my apparent death. My birth name was Umayado, for I was born outside a stable door. A man’s name, so I see no reason to continue using it in this day and age. {small} Prince Kamistumiya was another name I’ve been known by, as is Toyotomimi. The latter I liked enough to repurpose as the family name for my new, immortal body. The chronicle of legends known as the Kojiki names me as Kamitsumiya no Umayado no Toyotomimi no Mikoto. An accurate name, but a mouthful. I have also been known as Toyotomimi no Nori no Ōkami or more simply Nori no Ushi no Ōkami. Those are more titles than formal names, however. Toyotomimi no Nori no Ōkami loosely translates to “Toyosatomimi Ear Method King”, a reference to my ability to hear ten conversations at once but somewhat awkward-sounding. Does that answer your question, Arch-Wizard? If not, I can direct you to the historical tome Nihon Shoki, which records all my titles and deeds…
Many times have people wished to give me gifts as thanks or tribute, though in the end such things are but mere trinkets. Still, I accepted them wholeheartedly.
I consider myself a devoted patron of the arts, Lady Yuelia. In fact, I helped invent the theater known as Noh alongside Hata no Kawakatsu!
I am loath to “toot my own horn”, as it were, but my tremendously successful reign as Prince Regent of Japan began when I was but nineteen years of age.
Indeed, Lady Yuelia. I publicly supported Buddhism during my reign, as a religious tool to cow the masses, while secretly mastering Taoism. However, Buddhists now revere me as a saint!
I have no pets of my own, Lady Yuelia. My ally, Lady Seiga, does have a Jiang-Shi she dotes upon.
All my jewelry is custom, Lady Yuelia, as are my Kappa-built headphones. And of course my sword, the Shichi-Sei Ken, has no equal.
The Maiden Reimu, though she hates to admit it, will risk life and limb to maintain the peace of Gensokyo. And if she can beat me, then who could match her?
To be a good teacher, Lady Yuelia, one must have good students. If you will listen and work hard, I can teach you to surpass your own mortality.
Fishing? I suppose not. In my day it was but peasants’ work, but I suppose in this day and age some do it for leisure.
Long have I sought to meet a Celestial, Lady Yuelia, and learn the way to ascend past even the Earth itself. Then I met the Celestial Lady Tenshi, and she was just absolute garbage.
The young witch Marisa tried to moderate a symposium of Gensokyo’s religious leaders. Truthfully, it wasn’t her forte.
Lady Yuelia, if we’ve been playing this game long enough to become familiar, then all of you know somebody like that.
Slowly lose their passion? Truthfully, no. Though Lady Seiga does flit from passion to passion, thoughtlessly.
My family were nobles and monarchs, Lady Yuelia. A lot of palace subterfuge, political maneuvering, assassinations, and civil wars. Well, it is to be expected.
Dear young Kokoro caused quite the incident when she first arrived, but the truth is she simply needed to control her emotions better.
Well clearly, I would trust myself over all. Unless it was I telling you what was best for you. I would be right, after all.
Eating too many sweets is bad for human beings, Lady Yuelia. As President of Health for the Human Village, I make it my duty to teach my citizens the value of a balanced diet.
Though I have had many banquets held in my honor as Crown Prince, the best meal is one enjoyed with family and friends. And copious amounts of alcohol.
Needless to say, Lady Yuelia, garments fine as mine are can’t be bought in stores. My headphones are custom built Kappa technology, and those misers charge out the posterior.
Hmm, not particularly, Lady Yuelia. Though I suppose the only time I’ve seen Lady Seiga act truly caring is in the presense of her Jiang-Shi.
The Maiden Reimu always seems to get drawn into battles for the sake of Gensokyo. Though considering she always comes out on top, despite overwhelming odds… perhaps she is extraordinarily lucky?
I’m glad you asked, Lady Yuelia. Sometimes even I can lack confidence. For some reason or another, I begin to think “There are some things I cannot do.” I am of course wrong.
A call and response seems like a most engaging idea. Perhaps I should incorporate that into my next address. I say “Miko”, you say “Is The Way of Heaven”!
I have tasted the finest delicacies at any number of opulent banquets. But nothing compares to a bowl of mikans and a cup of saké, cuddled under the kotatsu with your confederates.
Sadly, such a thing isn’t really possible if you’re the Prince Regent of Japan. And I do so get bored at stuffy social functions.
I’m a people person, but my unique ability to listen to ten conversations at once can leave me overwhelmed at mass gatherings. Even I need some regular peace and quiet.
I know that feeling of loneliness, Miss Tomoko. Rarely am I in the presence of someone who sees the world as I do.
Not at all, Miss Tomoko. I’m magnificent.
Sorry Miss Tomoko, but I doubt if ever in my life I cring— oh lord did I really tell Futo to look after Tojiko’s revival jar?
That’s quite all right, Miss Tomoko. When I was your age, I too was plagued with questions. Like “Why must humans be forced to accept death?”
An easy question, Lord Brock. My legendary Chinese jian, the Shichi-Sei Ken. It’s the sword I wear at my hip.
Likewise, if anyone says that my dear sweet Kokoro thinks I’m uncool and out of fashion, that too is a lie. She’s just going through a rebellious phase.
A… “Smash”? You know, I remembering hearing quite a few desires for the young maiden Reimu to receive a “Smash invitation”.
I suppose you can learn a lot about ancient societies from their ruins… yet if their cultures’ crumbled, are they truly worth studying?

A wonderful question, Lady Cynthia! Where shall I began? But of course, the beginning! I was born on February Seventh, 574, to emperor Youmei and Princess Anahobe. I was not born in a stable, as legend suggests, but…
A historical figure I most admire… but not myself, I assume? Hmm… perhaps another leader of my state, such as Oda Nobunaga or Emperor Meiji.

Any student of Japanese history would tell you the modern nation would not exist today had it not been for Prince Shoutoku setting up a centralized government under the Seventeen Article Constitution.
The most outrageous creation theory…? Oh, perhaps that our world of Gensokyo is the product of a drunk, trumpet-obsessed Japanese man in a nice hat.
Lewd artifacts… well, I did take some “playthings” with me in my mausoleum while I was awaiting my resurrection. However, the modern toys from the Outside World function far better.
Did you know legendary Japanese Saint and regent Prince Shoutoku was a woman? And had lots of lesbian sex with her consort? And was very good at the lesbian sex, too.
A fair question, Sir Adrien. This is a place of great power, for to gather people from all places and stations of life is no easy feat. …I wonder if they’d be interested in selling.

I’ve of coursed sired heirs of my own, Lady Jura, including a youkai of masks I carved. Of course, I would not dream of having myself impregnated. That is the purpose of consorts and sorcery, is it not?
As a learned Taoist, I understand the principle that within every hairline fissure, there is infinite space. I can enter into that space, and use it to travel between worlds.
I am not one to bow to the ideology of “cuteness,” Lady Perona, but if you must know… It was my dear, sweet, little Kokoro, dancing her heart out. What a wonderful child.

Lady Yuri, you absolutely must devote yourself to the Nihon Shoki, The Chron\icles of Japan. It’s a detailed history of my nation, focusing on the acc\omp\lish\ments of some of its greatest leaders! Particularly me.
No disrespect to your friend, Sir Raynor, but marriage seems like too significant a thing to leave up to cards. None of my victories were by chance, they were all hard-fought and well earned.
Their… drinks? Ah, most likely not. If you desire, Lady Nagisa, I can teach you the art of flight. It may come of aid later.
I had a number of brothers and sisters, Lady Nagisa. The royal family is expected to produce a sufficient number of viable heirs or daughters eligible for marriage.
As if I would stoop so low as to be such a petty conman! What a disgraceful use of my skills that would be. True, I did mislead my subjects on some small details, but that was to their own benefit.
Relic hunting, Sir Tobias? I’d rather people didn’t— because it’s usually my ancient treasures being pilfered.

I have no shortage of stories I could tell of my deeds as the Crown Prince Shoutoku of Japan, Sir Tobias! Where ought I to start? Well, at the age of two, I was observed to miraculously recite a sutra and receive a sacred relic…
Oh, Sir Tobias, that sounds like one of the flunkies of the Buddhist nun Byakuren. Some vengeful spirit of a drowned sailor. Frankly, I don’t think that woman is a real captain.
I’ve defeated many gods before, Miss Susie. In Gensokyo it is to be expected, as they are my religious rivals.
What year, Miss Susie? Hm, time moves differently in Gensokyo than the outside world as well. By my count, it’s approximately 1400 years after your year 622 A.D.

Pictures of you mysteriously showing up, Miss Susie? I’ve dealt with similar harassment from that Tengu tabloid reporter. Of course, It is natural for someone in my position to attract all sorts of gossip.
Like most of my days, I shall wake early for my aesthetic training. I shall preach in the village on the importance of faith. Finally, I shall fight a Buddhist monk and get drunk at Hakurei Shrine.
But Lady Pyrrha, I am already famous. It comes with the territory of being the heir of the Emperor of Japan. Not that I wish to shirk my fame, my popularity allows me to guide society.

Lady Pyrrha, I have met many, many people over the course of my storied life, yet only two would I un\equivoc\ally call my friends. Those who would follow me in the path of the hermit, and attempt to reach immortality.
Hmm… it more depends on the circumstances, Lady Pyrrha. It would be in poor taste to joke about poverty to the poor Maiden Reimu, yet we can both share a good joke about Buddhist nuns.
Well, why else would I play, Lady Pyrrha— it seems a good spot of fun. The tantalizing prospect of seeing naked women writhing in pleasure appeals as well.
Lady Stella, sometimes a leader must excise individuals in order to keep the peace of a country. Killing someone to save the entire world? In my mind, that’s not a question.
Truthfully, Lady Stella, I am not from this world either. I came here from the Land of Illusion, Gensokyo, where forgotten magic still thrives. I am very well regarded there.
Lady Stella, in this world exists a drink unrivaled in all the cosmos, a drink even the gods imbibe. We cal it saké, and I’d be happy to treat you to this establishment’s finest.
Normal animals do not speak, Lady Stella, though a youkai, or demon, animal would. Ah, but I wonder what my gorgeous winged mare of old, Kurokoma would say if she could talk.
If you wish not to get your hands dirty, Lady Stella, you could always have people do the dirty work for you. Not that I’d ever have anyone do something for me I wouldn’t do myself.
Magic is built on the unknown, Lady Stella. Once scientific explanations began to unshroud the mysteries of the world, people stopped believing in magic— and without belief, nothing can exist.
Ah, so you’re familiar with the basics of saké, Lady Stella. Of course, the drink is far more than just rice. Perhaps I can demonstrate my extensive knowledge of saké with some taste testing?
Ah, I should clarify, Lady Stella. Almost no horses in this world have wings. Only mine was so magnificent. As it usually goes.
Yes, I know that feeling, Lady Ayano. Though I may often be too proud to admit it, my beloved Tojiko keeps me grounded in my desires. I owe much to her.
For society to flourish it needs order, for order to be effective it needs all citizens from the emperor to the serfs to be in harmony. All must avoid petty quarrels, and be far-sighted.
Well, Lady Pyrrha, one of my comrades can best be described as a “gremlin” with a penchant for destruction, the other is a vengeful spirit with the power of thunder.
The most beautiful sight was my beloved Tojiko on our wedding day. Her bridal kimono looked positively radiant. The second most beautiful thing was a ten-thousand yen note with my face on it.
You can commune with hair, Lord Bobobo? Talk as long as you wish with mine. It is every bit as impressive as the rest of me.
Having met my dream self, Private Hijiyama, I can definitively say we are nothing alike. Experience is what makes us, more than physical appearance ever could.
I’m happy to say I’ve never needed to worry about Tojiko, Private Hijiyama. She doesn’t stand on ceremony and is honest to a fault.
As a hermit, I don’t need to eat much more than mist to survive… but I enjoy eating my three square meals a day. Plus the finest sake.
I don’t live here, Lady May. I have my own hidden hermit realm, Senkai, where I keep my dojo. A place where nobody can bother someone is well suited for hermits.
All your vast knowledge, Miss Wikipe, and still you live like a wretched beggar. In that case I shall be charitable: I shall purchase this “Wikipedia” and administer it directly myself.
Well, the idea is that we have so honed our bodies that mist alone provides enough nourishment for us, Miss Penny. I know not a single hermit who actually keeps to that, though.
Simply put, Lady Pinelli, a great mercenary is one who accomplishes all goals I set out for them with perfect efficacy— even if the task is to fetch me more saké.
I may be shrewd, Private Hijiyama, but I’m not so duplicitous as to trick anyone into marriage. Tojiko was aware of the truth ahead of the wedding— and more than happy to take a woman as her lover.
I’d love to take you up on your offer, Sir Victor! If I may, would you be so kind as to paint my lovely Tojiko? Preferably in the nude. And posing erotically.
I myself have found the best assassins dispatch their target efficiently, but disturb little else. A silver tongue or silver coin can work wonders in granting one entry.
How many ghost wives do you think I possess, Lord Bobobo? It’s sadly just the one. Futo is a hermit like myself. A rambunctious little gremlin, she is, and more clever than she looks.

Lady Fina, a woman of honor does not just walk up to another and ask to bed them. Instead, invite them to sample some expensive saké. Then get drunk and talk of yourself at length. I’m certain it will one day work for me.
At present, I reside in the land of illusion, Gensokyo. A place hidden by a barrier of common sense, where legends and monsters of old can still live without fear of the modern world.
The power of the moons? We’ve dealt with Lunarians before in Gensokyo, formidable foes. I’d love to study these moonberries… so long as my mentor’s jiang-shi doesn’t eat them first.

Lady Fina, the sad truth of this world is that one cannot have it all. Sometimes you must allow choices to be made for you, for the sake of harmony. Thankfully, I still ended up with everything I could want!
These were originally earmuffs, Lady Sachi, however I commissioned the Kappa to add technology that projects music while I wear them. I use it to inhibit my superhuman hearing.
Miss Tomoko, no one will continue to call you sexy so long as you hide away. If ever you leave Byakuren’s Temple, the first thing to do is find yourself a wife.
Oh, I knew you were cheating the while time, Miss Tomoko. I allowed it, because such unfair advantages could never measure up to natural talent.
Lady Sucrose, In order to get “in the mood”, so to speak, I allow a beautiful woman to take my lips against hers. Then I allow her to masturbate myself for me.
Indeed I do, Miss Scuttlebutt— the Divine Spirit Mausoleum. It used to be inside the Hall of Dreams’ Great Mausoleum, but youkai built a temple on top of it so I relocated.
Indeed I am, Lady Zoe. I’ve written legal documents and my country’s constitution, but what I’m really proud of is my poetry.
Lady Kumatora, though I have had any number of feasts, I’ve long since learned the greatest meal is one enjoyed together with the ones you love. And also accompanied by the finest sake.
I consider the allies within my Taoist clan as close as family, Lady Kumatora. Tojiko is steadfast. Futo is loyal. Seiga… is also around.
“Lady Kumatora” is a wonderful name. If anything, we ought to make it stand out more. “Princess Kumatora the First, Lady of Tazmily and Regent of All Nowhere.”
A poet, Lady Hu? You know, I’m something of a poet myself. Feel free to compose an epic about my deeds, and I shall give critique.
I think there was a tale from the outside world about an emperor being clothed in invisible robes. I don’t believe it to be anything more than a story, however.
Magic is far more than simple fighting spells, Madam Syrenne. With my mastery of the Taoist arts, I can disarm even death itself. Would you like me to teach you?
I don’t believe I’d want my allies to see me disrobed and pleasuring myself… though I wouldn’t mind seeing that of some of my rivals.
If I needed some quick liquidity? I suppose I could sell some of my treasures, but I’d rather recover the ones the magician Marisa stole from me first.
I can put my underlings to work on any odd jobs I need done, Madam Syrenne. Though if it helps me to gain popularity, I’m willing to dirty my own hands.
The simplest explanation is that they’re an arse, Madam Syrenne. For instance I butt heads with Byakuren all the time, and would absolutely not want to plant my face into her warm, motherly breasts.
I could never bathe communally when I was disguised as a man for obvious reasons, but these days I rather enjoy relaxing in an onsen with the others. Feel free to accompany me, Madam Syrenne.
I’ve had my share of libations over the years, Madam Syrenne, but my philosophy is that what happens at Hakurei Shrine, stays at Hakurei Shrine.

Opener? Do you mean like a poem to recite to woo you? Ahem.
We share the same tap,
Drinking, yet thirsty for more,
Intoxicated.
Madam Syrenne, the best politicians can tailor their message for their audience. Tell them what they want to hear. Not that you should be giving campaign speeches in bed… I’ve learned.
Oh, what a charming little poem, Lady Hu. Though I’m not sure I understood it. In any case, let me know when you’ve prepared my poem.
The way most alliances are forged, Lady Kumatora. I was born into power and the others married into my family or came seeking favor.
We’ve been together quite some time, Miss Mari, but there is always something new one can learn. We could never have been so open in the past, so I appreciate this experience.
I served as regent over Japan, a harmonious land, and wrote our first constitution. I’d love to talk legal philosophy with you, Lady von Luftschloss Narfidort.
I prefer to delve into myths and legends over mere fairytales, Lady von Luftschloss Narfidort. But allow me to tell you of the legendary Crown Prince Shoutoku’s deeds long ago…
Nothing at all, Lady Cagliostro. I chose this body because it suited me the best. It’s crafted in the image of myself as a young woman.
Lady Seiga is my mentor, who revealed to me the Taoist arts. In any case… I can’t control her, no. I apologize on her behalf. For everything.

Hoho, I suppose I give off the air of a playboy, do I not? No matter. Position invites gossip.
{Tojiko}True, though I think the Crown Prince started most of the rumors herself.
I was buried with a myriad of treasures in my mausoleum, ancient relics which have only increased in value. Also a strong investment portfolio.
My carnal desires happen to guide me to the softer sex, that’s all. Though it wasn’t so much a concept during my life, I suppose I was a “lesbian.”
{Tojiko}Her new body is remarkably faithful to her appearance as she was in her late twenties. Though, I did notice she got rid of a few blemishes here and there…
On other women, yes. I’ve no need or desire for my own figure to look as such. I’m not so vain that I would fall in love with myself.
Of course I could grow a man’s hard rod and use it to inseminate Tojiko. But not at this time. I like my family as it is now.
We didn’t have such aids in my time, Reimu, so the only way to learn was by experimenting and doing. Experience builds expertise, after all.
{Tojiko}The Crown Prince’s eyes and clitoris may wander, but I know I’ll always have my place in her heart. Of course, I intend to share in the pleasure of any other women the Crown Prince finds.
All the money in the world can’t buy you everlasting life, Lady Kumatora. I should know, I’ve had both. I’d rather remain healthy and virile.
The second mushroom, clearly. I am a servant of womankind, so it is my partners’ desires that matter more than my own. But I would also like to get off.
I assume no beautiful damsels share my capsule, Lady Kumatora? Well, anything worth doing carries a mote of risk. I’d rather seek immortality the proper way.
It was no trouble for me to resurrect into Gensokyo after sleeping for over fourteen hundred years. The current world is more my speed than feudal Japan was anyway.
I’ve seen a mermaid around the Misty Lake a few times. I don’t know of her personality, but for a fish she’s rather busty.
I believe Gensokyo would count, Dame Arle, as a land of illusion hidden away from the outside world. I’ve enjoyed my time there.
I love animals, Dame Arle, though I don’t have any pets currently. I remember my winged horse of old, Kurakoma, though. What a gentle soul she was.
Date spots? Hmm… in my day, I would journey to my beloved’s estate and recite poetry with a silk screen between us, but that may be a bit old fashioned for today’s youth.
Blood type? Why, Holy Blood, of course.<hr>{Tojiko}Crown Prince, can your current body even bleed?
If there is anything I need, I have the means to purchase it. What is truly valuable, and what I truly desire, are things that no amount of money can buy.
People must realize! I am the light of humanity! The hope of the world! Revere me!<hr>{Tojiko}No Suzuya, there’s really no extra praise the Crown Prince needs.
I’m sure you’d look ravishing in anything, Miss Suzuya… or nothing. What about a cape? I think they help to give one presence.
Horoscopes are rubbish. Do you think I will allow the stars to dictate my destiny? No! I shall make the cosmos bow down to me!
I didn’t summon Tojiko, Princess Koriand’r, she apparently followed me here. Ah, Tojiko no Soga would be my consort.
Although some of you are already familiar with me, I’ll make clear for the rest: you needn’t concern yourself with my station. Simply call me Miko.
Undressing? Fine but... why am I the only girl?
Undressing? Fine but... where are all the cute girls?
Ah, even though I call myself "Crown Prince" I'm really a woman. Sorry.
Ohoho, how charming, little nun. I’d be delighted to join you in a prayer to your god. Ah, you can call me Miko by the way, no need for formalities like “Crown Prince”.
Ah, you needn't refer to me as "Crown Prince" in this setting. Just "Miko" will do.
I used to be more discerning with my alcohol consumption. My compatriots in Gensokyo drink without discrimination and and I’m afraid they’ve rubbed off on me.
I don’t think at this stage I’ll be having any more children, though. Too bad as well. I’d love to impregnate Tojiko!
It was surprisingly easy to deceive an entire nation. Men’s clothes and a fake beard did the trick. After all, who would ask a monarch to drop their pants?
My consort Tojiko of the Soga clan, known as Tojiko no Iratsume, very much found out about my sex. Fortunately, she preferred to have a woman.
Somehow, the head of the Soga clan, Umako, uncovered the truth— as did his cunning wife, Mononobe no Futo-hime. They were the true rulers of Japan, operating from the shadows.
I was found out by the Wicked, Unreasonable, and Unjust Hermit, Seiga Kaku. Because I told her, she said she’d make me immortal. But not that many people knew the truth. Really.
In Gensokyo, and in the modern world, there is no reason to hide my womanhood. However, to be called anything but Crown Prince would not sit well with me.
Perhaps it is naught but empty habit, however “Crown Prince” is the appellation I choose to this day.
I see that has cleared up any confusion you had regarding my title. Now, did I ever tell you about the time Seiga stole Christmas?
Futo was a Mononobe who studied Taoism under me, but conspired with her husband Soga no Umako to eradicate her own clan.
The Soga clan and the Mononobe clan were fierce political rivals during my reign. Anyway I killed all the Mononobes and Mokou’s grandpa killed all the Sogas.
Because she studied the Taoist arts, after death Tojiko ended up as a ghost with a corporeal body. Eheheh…
It was because of Futo that Tojiko failed to properly resurrect in a new body. Did I mention Futo is Tojiko’s mother? I know someone who’s not getting a card this year~!

Your hearts are all as easy for me to read as a picture book. In the interest of fairness, let’s air it all out: what is your true, deepest desire? Mine is to live forever carefree, fearing neither death nor defeat.
Though you all may say what you will, my hearing can sense your true needs. I aim to to live a carefree life without end. Now then, is anyone else confident enough to share their innermost desire?
I must say Lady Nayru, you’re a mean drunk.
So you’re better at cards when drunk, Lady Nayru? I suppose the same could be said of my compatriots in Gensokyo with danmaku.
Be sure to drink plenty of water, Nayru. You don’t want a hangover.
Seiga Niang-Niang and Miss Meiling seem to get along well. I saw the two of them speaking in Chinese earlier. They looked over at me and laughed… I wonder what that could mean?
Though I had to disguise myself as a prince, a few did find out my true sex during my reign. For instance my aunt, Empress Suiko, on whose behalf I officially ruled.
Ah, you were wondering, ~player~, why I am still called “Crown Prince” though the world has changed in the fourteen hundred years I slept.
I sense some confusion in your heart, ~player~, about why I am called “Crown Prince.” By which I mean, you’re worried I’ve got a penis.

Reimu, the “Rose Hermit” Kasen Ibaraki tells that you would be unfathomably powerful if only you applied yourself. Wouldn’t the long-term ease from being strong outweigh the short-term toil of training?
Reimu, I hear your desires for a partner with good looks and attitude. But what about money? Considering your avaricious nature, I’d have thought you’d prioritize your partner’s financial situation.
Say, Reimu, have you given any more thought to what we talked about during that symposium you broke up? How your heart revealed that you desired a peace without violence?
You’re fairly traditional in most regards, Reimu. So how’d you end up openly bisexual? I’d have thought you’d be attached to the dogma of man and woman.
Reimu, did you realize your nontraditional shrine maiden attire has affected a few people’s desires? Due to the gaps which show your skin, they now fetishize your belly, shoulders, sides, or armpits.
Reimu, many suitors actually prefer their partners to have experience. Wouldn’t you like to electrify your spouse on your wedding night?
Perhaps a bit of a personal question, Reimu, but have you ever used any sex toys? Or any other aid to pleasure yourself?
Reimu, what’s your opinion about oral sex? Either giving or receiving. I find it to be quite fun, though I’ve never sucked upon a man’s rod.
Do you think you’d ever fancy “anal sex”, Reimu? It’s not all that appealing to me, but some girls love the experience and I don’t judge others’ pleasure.

Of course you’re curious about me, Lady Chen. Though I don’t intend to present myself as a man currently, I’ve grown accustomed to certain habits. See, I was born long before gender equality, and in order to rule…
I know you’re just trying to placate your followers, Lady Chen. My hearing is so acute I can understand every one of your desires in a minute, and thus know your past, present, and future.
You wish to know more about Taoism, Lady Chen? Very well. Don’t blame me if by the end of it you wish to become my disciple!

I have many accomplishments to choose from, Lady Chen. To start with, as a child, I carved statues of the Four Heavenly Kings and built for them the Shitennou-ji temple. {small}Of course, that doesn’t come close to what I accomplished later in life. My triumph over the Moriya clan precipitated my unification of Japan…
I can sense from your desires you too understand, Lady Chen. There is a sinful lust that all humans have from the moment they are born. It is the Original Sin, so to speak.

Though it’s a tad embarrassing to admit, I enjoy the melody of my own boss theme, Shoutoku Legend ~ True Administrator. It has a litany of wonderful remixes, if you were so inclined to give them a listen.
Specifically speaking, Tojiko can be considered a “Vengeful Spirit” or bourei. Though she made preparations to transfer herself into an immortal body, the process failed, leaving her as a ghost.
Mega… Christmas? That aside, I have no doubt the best that I can give others is the gift of my wisdom and guidance in the Hermetic Arts.
I was never able to impregnate Tojiko, try as I might. Fortunately, we were able to clandestinely adopt some children, to keep up appearances that I was a man.
You would think a grand ruler like myself would be afforded an harem, would you not? Many wives to do my bidding! …Tell me Tojiko isn’t standing right behind me.
Now, now, Reimu. You’re no stranger to rumors either. It is inevitable to those in our position. We must simply stay above it all— and not let such stories hurt us.
Your accusations are untrue, Reimu. My harem isn’t made-up, it just needs to be filled is all. And where better to find lovely vixens than this venue?
Sadly, I never enjoyed a harem’s pleasure, Reimu. Having too many who knew my true sex would spell death for me… and in that era, finding women who loved women was much harder.
I wish I could say to you I used Taoists arts to grow a mans’ rod, and filled each of my wives to the brim with my seed. Sadly, that was not the case.
Slobbering? I think you misunderstand my desires. Yes, sometimes I enjoy laying back and receiving pleasure, but more often than not I prefer giving ecstasy to other ladies.
Ah, a fair question to ask, Reimu, when I am so freely distributing my sexual knowledge. Indeed, I am devoted to the female body, but devotion means nothing without practice!
{Tojiko}Reimu… I’m going to be honest with you. This is a place to find floozies. You’re not going to find a good girl or boy worthy of your hand here.
I don’t reveal my holy of holies to everyone, Reimu. Only beautiful women. Who want to see me. And are voluptuous.
Well, this is a conundrum. No matter. Though you are clearly the greatest foes I have ever faced, I shall still come out with the victory.
I suppose a politician must be a bit of both, Sir Leon. I am the once crown prince of Japan, current leader of the Taoist clan of Gensokyo, and future beacon for all humanity!
It’s a tale as old as time, Lady Kumatora. Our marriage was arranged by our parents for political gain. I’m just glad one of my four wives enjoyed the fairer sex as I did!
Oh heavens no, you’re not my type at all, Lady Cagliostro. You’re far too short, and flat, and self-centered. I prefer women with a much fuller figure.
It seems to be a cultural distinction, Lady Cagliostro. Your Western ghosts are thought of as ephemeral, but spirits in Japan are capable of physically existing in and interacting with the world.
If only such were true, Sir Leon. While I loved my regency, in order to do so I had to hide my true sex and romantic inclinations. I never got up to performing a tenth of my wildest fantasies!
“Best, Lord Bobobo? To learn the secrets of the universe that cannot be taught. To guide your people to prosperity. To sink your hand into a large, soft breast.
We have both had more of The Tao revealed to us through this battle, Lord Bobobo. Yet neither of us can be satisfied by merely this much. We must see our duel through to the end!
My resurrection inadvertently drew spirits from across the land to my resting place. Is it a crime my arrival was so monumental even the dead could recognize it?
Oho, so my reputation precedes me? It is as you say, Lady Fina, I’ve long since abdicated. But a long while back I was Crown Prince and regent of the Empire of Japan.
There is no reason to be shy, Arch-Wizard Megumin. I am always willing to share my legend with others. Feel free to ask away!
No one would consider my physical size for a minute, Arch-Wizard. If you wish to rule, you must project an aura taller than Mount Fuji!
Ears? Of course they would be— Oh, you mean these points of hair? Just tufts, my hair grows like this naturally.
Through Taoism, one can control the forces of the universe, bend the cosmos to your will! Oh, sorry Tojiko. Yes, I’ll take something off.
I’ve never been one to turn down the opportunity to study new types of sorcery and mystical arts. Tell me, Arch-Wizard, what sort of things does your village have to offer?
Oh, are you good at sealing evil? The Buddhist nun (and my rival) Byakuren was sealed in Makai long ago. Could you do that again?
I’m more than willing to accept students, Arch-Wizard— however, they must first prove themselves worthy.
Though I look glamorous, Arch-Wizard, this immortal body is nearly 1400 years old. I discarded my mortal body when I was but fourty-eight years of age.
…Fluffy? Well, I’ve been turned into an owl in the past.
I suppose you could say that I am part of a “cultural organization”, Lady Yuri. Besides my avid patronage of the arts, my political reforms effectively created the nation-state of Japan.
You needn’t be rude, Lady Perona. ~Player~ seems like the perfectly serviceable sort. There’s no reason to compare ~player.ifMale(him|her)~ to me.
W-what is this, Lady Perona? Tojiko would never join you! I treat her very well, and, er, also have nice things to offer. Right?
So you recognize my abilities? You’re not dealing with the average human warrior any more, Lady Caulifla. I have risen above, to become— Oh, sorry Tojiko. I’ll strip, I’ll strip.
Though I have long since abdicated my claim to the throne, Lady Pyrrha, in life I served as Prince Regent of Japan. In short, I was the chief executive of my little island nation.
P-pay, Lady Perona? Wait, was I supposed to be offering Tojiko a salary? Is that why’s she mad at me?

Lady Perona, if you’re going to be running off with my Tojiko, you should know there is none more forthright than her, but it’s an outspokenness born of love. Also, she knows the exact spot to rub in my—

My resurrection was quite literal, Lady Yuri. In life I was Prince Shoutoku of Japan, but my frail, mortal body betrayed me. So I transformed my sword into a new body and 1400 years later here I stand!
Serving as regent caused me little stress, Lady Pyrrha. Stress comes from knowing not what you are doing— and I was more than competent.

As delightful the idea of taking your hand may be, Lady Luxanna, I doubt my parents are involved. Both because they passed away fourteen centuries ago, and because they’ve already seen me happily married.
Though don’t I obsess over the opinions of others, I do worry that some see me as vain and superficial. Truthfully, I am the rather quiet and studious sort.
My Shichi-Sei Ken is very much a practical weapon, Lady Yuri. So much so that it would be unwise to unsheathe it in a peaceful game like ours.
Power is a tool like any other, Lady Pyrrha. It can be used, or misused, in service of one’s task. I just happened to have the nece\ssary job of safe\guarding a prod\uctive society.
So you understand too, Lord Asterisk, that a leader is only as strong as they appear. I must project confidence to put my subjects well at ease.
Oh, I’m no goddess, Miss Voorhees, though I often tangle with such in my exploits. I am an immortal hermit known as a Saint.
I see you are skilled enough to recognize my power, Lady Luxanna. Indeed, there are few who can match me in the land of Gensokyo.
Quite the opposite, Miss Nami. Back when I was regent of Japan, I wanted people to think I was a man.
From my perspective, Lady Pyrrha, there is very little which has changed over the eons. Though customs may differ, still there is power and order, law and religion.
How many ghosts do you think I keep in my company, Miss Nami? Well, I wouldn’t mind more— provided they were as alluring as Tojiko.
I’m not sure what an “anime” is, Lord Bobobo, but my hair is as correct as always. Though I may have surpassed my humanity, I am in no way beastly.
I, uh, sure do remember you, Lord Bobobo. You leave quite an impression.
It’s been a long time since I’ve actively governed, Lady Fina. But a long while back I was crown prince and regent of the Empire of Japan.
Oho, you’re a sharp one, Private Hijiyama. Toyosatomimi no Miko is but one of my names. I’ve also been known as Prince Umayado or Prince Shoutoku, among other titles.
While my Tojiko is enchanting, Lord Bobobo, please treat her with the respect a lady of her station deserves.
Not at all, Lady Yuri. In fact, I would have been loath to disrobe when I had disguised myself as a man. Frankly, I prefer the more libertine attitude of the present day.
Aha! You’ve fallen victim to the classic blunder, Lord Bobobo, now watch as I swoop in for the victory! Ahem— Tojiko, I promise not to talk like that.
I was a ruler who valued progress for my nation and people, Lady Fina. To replace the quibbling of warlords with peace and order. To unite all under the mantra “Harmony is to be valued.”

Ah, yes, modern romance. The youth of this age do seem to be more, erm, casual. The village sweets shop seems to be a popular location for dates. I still believe in the power of poetry and fine penmanship.
A student of history, Private Hijiyama, but one can’t always trust the record. While the books say a man died, in truth a woman studied Taoist alchemy to gain immortality, and faked her death.
Thank you Lady Charlotte, but I must regrettably admit I’m far from perfect. Since my resurrection, I’ve been somewhat lax in my training. Even if I am immortal, I’m still not a celestial.

Are you even listening to me, Fina? Mi— The Crown Prince is not some two-bit tyrant! In your journey across the skies of Arcadia, did diplo\macy always work, or did you sometimes resort to cracking skulls?
Are you interested in studying the hermetic arts, Private Hijiyama? Though the path is difficult I could certainly guide you, but why would you be interested in such things?
To be blunt, Lady Pyrrha, whoever wed me would become princess consort— few would throw such an opportunity away. I was far more concerned I would be married to an ugly sow!

Think nothing of it, Lady Fina, I’m not one to hold grudges.
{Tojiko}Crown Prince, I was the one defending you, you were too enraptured with her pretty face to care.
Sadly, my failures meant I had to settle for the lowest level of immortality, a shikaisen, Lady Yuri. Effectively, I faked my own death and transferred my soul to a vessel transfigured from my sword.
I’ve settled in Gensokyo, land of illusion, Lady Fina. I train as to better hone my mastery of the Tao. And I seek to expand the sway of my clan— using only reputable methods, I assure you.
Truthfully I don’t do anything to live, Lady Monika— I’ve long surpassed such things. However, I seek to ascend to the level of eternal celestial. Do you not wish the same?
Indeed, Lady Fina. Gensokyo, the land of illusions, holds both the Rose Hermit Kasen Ibara, and the terrible Wicked Hermit Seiga Kaku.
Who’d want some old man disrobing them? Besides, in life I needed to hide my true sex from all but a few. Fortunately, Tojiko here knows all about my… true sex.
I spent the last millennium asleep, awaiting a time when the world was ready for my resurrection. I kept watch over our nation during my slumber, though.
Lady Kumatora, a princess like yourself must spend time mingling with the common folk in order to truly know them. And I see a number of fetching damsels here I’d like to know.
Ah, do you recognize my greatness, Lady Hu? Indeed, I have slipped off the shackles of life and death.
I don’t mind in the slightest, Hu Tao. Not having a physical body is actually quite pleasant, and I can still serve the Crown Prince.
I’ve enjoyed relaxing in hot springs with others since my resurrection, but there were few who ever knew I had a woman’s body in life. A pity, since it meant I never had a proper harem.
In order to ascend to the highest class of immortal, I must still yet train, Lady Monika. Celestials reside in Heaven and are untroubled by Earthly woes.
A more pertinent question may be when I am from, Miss Mari. Though I hail from Japan, I reigned during the Asuka Period long, long ago.
For now, Mari, my goal is to ensure the Crown Prince plays the game the right way. No one will have a good time if we stall all night with trinkets.
I have no designs on Gensokyo itself, Lady Yuri. Neither the humans nor the youkai need a formal leader. I’m satisfied simply maintaining the prestige of my clan and I.
Lady Pyrrha, this body is my own creation. Every bit of it is as I chose. Likewise, I am thankful for all of Tojiko’s blessed gifts.
I’m not truly concerned, Lord Bobobo. This is but a game, and as much as I value my pride I’ve come out ahead of far worse.
You’re a perceptive one, Lady Nico. Though this body was created to reflect my likeness during my physical prime, I have lived a great number of years.
Oho, Lord Kaz, I hope you realize that I am capable of hearing your inner monologue… that you are saying aloud. In the sixth century, I was of average height.
Of course, Miss, um, Kagamine, was it? I’m not only a presence in my home of Gensokyo, but I once ruled the land as Prince Shoutoku. So it’s only natural to recognize me.
In Taoism, one is made to understand the natural universe, and render it one’s own. However, as ruler, I actually spread a separate religion more suited to pacifying the masses.
Ah! W-well, Tojiko is my consort, my wife, so, um, no scandal here. She used to be alive, so it’s fine. Your “Charles” doesn’t sound voluptuous at all!
Governance is all about building a harmonious relationship between the people and the leaders, Lady Nico. It is the duty of both to take care of the other, following the natural order.
I doubt anything I witnessed was so momentous, Lady Nico. But perhaps it was when I defeated the rebellious Mononobe Clan? Or when I wrote my constitution? Or when I…
I can respect a lady with similar interests to your friend Sheba, Lady Kora. Still, it’s fair to worry if she might try seducing one of my women. Wars have been fought over less, you know.
I suppose my mastery of Taoist sorcery makes me a fairly decent fighter, Lady Kora. Most disputes in Gensokyo are decided by the two parties battling, non-lethally.
Not exactly my own people, but most exterminations are done by the shrine maiden Reimu and the witch Marisa. Though infrequently, I directly investigate incidents which catch my interest.
As a political and spiritual leader, it is imperative that I throw stellar parties. Such activities help one retain their base of support.
Oho! You’re not wrong, Miss Nikaidou. Through my glory I could be thought of as a living idol for Japan— no, for humanity!
This Poker malarky shouldn’t be so difficult for me. I’ve crushed my enemies in both politics and wars!
I am a powerful and immortal hermit of legendary stature! That means I should be winning.
Were you aware that Japanese women did not wear undergarments before the Mid-Twentieth Century?
Lady Yuelia, you have an eye for quality, do you not? A Crown Prince must look the part, but I suppose convention dictates I ought to part with one of these.
I suppose if one is not serious about this, then even a crown prince will falter. Oh, Miss Cujoh, you wish to learn of my life’s saga?
This is no “costume,” Lady Cynthia. As a mortal, I was an influential leader of my nation, and ushered in reforms that made it the state it is today!
You’ve been paying attention to my tales well, Lady Chara. Indeed, I ascended to the rank of immortal hermit and saint.
Indeed, I am a great hermit much learned in the ways of the Tao, Sir Deimos. But although many desire to study under me, I am afraid I am not accepting disciples at this time.
Tojiko’s woeful tale is lengthy, but I shall recount it in its— oh, ought I to remove a trinket now? Yes, I suppose I must.
You have a discerning eye, Sir Raynor, if you recognize my nobility despite my casual garb today. But please don’t call me “Crown Prince”, Miko shall suffice.
I never truly died, Lady Chara. Rather, I transformed my legendary sword, Shichi-Sei Ken into an immortal vessel. My soul was then transferred to said vessel— which you see now before you.
Lady von Varley, please. Tojiko is my consort, you ought to show more respect.
Leaving aside Lady von Varley for now, is it absolutely necessary to take off an entire layer each round?
Not so, Lady von Varley! Tojiko is definitely going to come out now! Else I shall look like a fool! Or worse, have to take off my own garments!
I lost? But I thought my strategy perfect! Tojiko if you— I mean, vengeful spirit, take my garb, and spare poor Lady von Varley!

I was officially appointed regent by my aunt, Empress Suiko, when I was nineteen years of age. I carried out my duties until I was forty-eight, when I faked my own death to become an immortal sorcerer.
But of course, Sir Raynor. We were all once normal, if good-looking and talented, human beings. The Soga clan was the most powerful at the time, so it was only natural our marriage would be arranged.

Indeed, Lady Chara. The power of a Saint was what I sought by my resurrection. Though unlike a vengeful spirit, I actually ressur— oh, sorry Tojiko. No offense intended. Yes, I’ll take my trinkets off.
I can’t deny being a tremendously lucky woman, Sir Raynor. Especially in light of how the dating scene for lesbian polymaths disguised as males in the sixth century was particularly brutal.
I suppose I must discard one of my many trinkets now. I apologize if this seems unerotic, Lady Polina. Perhaps we might arrange a private game of our own, later?
Lady Polina, in normal circumstances I would be overjoyed that you wished to denude me… but in a competition like this, I cannot let my desires rule me. I must act strategically.
I apologize, Lord Brock, but I am accustomed to giving my all, whether it be on the battlefield, the pulpit, or the card table. I pray you don’t take it personally.

I’m no despot, Sir Raynor, I only desire to keep the peace. Without both strong authority and moral guidance, human beings will inevitably become frivolous and apathetic, as society crumbles around them. Oh right, Tojiko. Stripping.
I won’t deny being self-assured, Lady ~marinette~. Still, even I can become dissatisfied with my lot in life— that despite surpassing the bounds of humanity, I have far to go in my training.
You may put on princely airs, Sir ~adrien~, but bearing without power makes you but a peacock.
This Valerian is the one vested with the honor of administrating your Dominion, correct? Pray tell, what is his philosophy on leadership?
Sir Raynor, please, there’s no need to apologize. I love talking about myself. There’s never a bad time to seek my council.
With a wife as fetching as mine, Lady Luxanna, I’d be surprised more don’t take ghosts for their brides.
