These were but paltry losses. Revel in them if you wish, but my confidence will not be shaken while victory is still a possibility! Hm, what was that, Lord Asterisk?
Tojiko is my consort, Miss Voorhees. She attempted to resurrect as a hermit like myself, but failed. She is but a vengeful spirit now.
Oho, I’m glad to see you recognize me, Miss Senko. I trust things are going well for you?
W-well, I suppose I have enough things to fill my mind. Such as, which bauble to take off for this round. Apologies, Miss Senko.
I understand, Sir Raynor. If I read your heart's desires, there is no need for words. Poker is a battle, no different than the ones in your past.
Hmm… I suppose it has been some time since Tojiko has had proper attendants, Miss Senko. She could do with an extra pair of hands.

Ah, I consider myself a woman prince, Lady Sucrose. The mistake is not yours, of course. Rather, in my time period, in order to rule, one had to be born male… thus, from a young age, I disguised myself.
Indeed, Lady Sucrose. It was absolutely my intention to bring Tojiko here, and show off her voluptuousness. I was not blindsided in the slightest.
Certainly, Lady Sucrose, we have a plethora of animal youkai, though I don’t believe that to be your case. For what reason do you ask?
You lost, Crown Prince, and so in the interest of sports\man\ship we must ensure you take off something worth the others’ time… Oh, Komi, you look like you have something to ask.
I came from a noble family myself, Komi, so it’s not like there was a great change in status. The only notable aspect was keeping this prince in particular in check.
Lady Komi, do you have any queries for me? I’d gladly answer them— there’s nothing more I love than to share my knowledge with worthy maidens.
Even the Crown Prince isn’t the type to surprise her lovers like that. She revealed herself to me during my courtship. I wasn’t the least put off… I think I could only truly love another woman.
Lady Komi, you seem pensive. Could it be Tojiko and my appearance in this game is opening new worlds to you? Are you wondering how two women express their affection physically?
Oho, so you recognize my greatness? I call myself many things: The Almighty and Humanitarian Taoist, The Almighty Taoist Who Controls the Cosmos, The Fiend of the Two-Colored Mantle…
Ah, so you’ve heard stories of my greatness, little maid? The gathering of spirits was not my fault though. They gathered on their own. Because I’m so great.
I shall now recite some of the poems I wrote back when wooing my consort, Soga no Tojiko.
I suppose even The Shoutoku Taoist can be fallible. Now which one of my myriad accessories should I discard?
A single loss perhaps, but I can spare a trinket!
Cape or not, I still have items to spare. Perhaps a bracelet, or one belt?
I can’t take off my anklets without first taking off my sandals too, so, um…
Now that all my trinkets have been taken, I’m as close to losing as the commoners!
I am a politician! A general! The hope of humanity! How can a card game be vexing me so?
To think I would meet such a worthy adversary in a card game, of all things…
It seems this is entering into a war of attrition. I suppose it was fortunate I brought many garments, though I can ill afford to lose another hand.
Did you know that until very recently, Japanese women didn’t wear undergarments?
So you have won my sarashi. Congratulations. Though you may not be impressed with my naked chest, know it matters to me not.
The battle has at last reached its climax! This next hand will decide it all!
Oho, so you recognize my greatness? I call myself many things: The Almighty and Humanitarian Taoist, The Almighty Taoist Who Controls the Cosmos, The Fiend of the Two-Colored Mantle…
Ah, so you’ve heard stories of my greatness, little maid? The gathering of spirits was not my fault though. They gathered on their own. Because I’m so great.
I shall now recite some of the poems I wrote back when wooing my consort, Soga no Tojiko.
A pity, but a loss was bound to happen eventually. Now, which of my many trinkets should I part with first?
No matter, I still have numerous accessories I can part with!
Cape or not, I still have items to spare. Perhaps a bracelet, or one belt?
I’ve lost more hands of this card game than wars and political struggles combined!
I am better at danmaku and igniting religious wars than this!
Gah! I’m… already out of small things.
…Powerful and immortal hermits aren’t supposed to taste defeat.
I wonder, is my increasing nudity also increasing my popularity and following?
Did you know that until very recently, Japanese women didn’t wear undergarments?
I think I understand the problem. Human desires factor little into the machinations of this game.
Would you think me ashamed over my svelte bosom? Such a thing is patently absurd!
For fourteen hundred years I slept, awaiting a time when the world would require a Saint.
Oho, so you recognize my greatness? I call myself many things: The Almighty and Humanitarian Taoist, The Almighty Taoist Who Controls the Cosmos, The Fiend of the Two-Colored Mantle…
Ah, so you’ve heard stories of my greatness, little maid? The gathering of spirits was not my fault though. They gathered on their own. Because I’m so great.
I shall now recite some of the poems I wrote back when wooing my consort, Soga no Tojiko.
I am the first to taste defeat? So be it. I have many bits and baubles I can part with at my leisure.
Impossible! Poker should be child’s play to me, because I’m so good at everything else!
Another loss. I must determine how to best ration my remaining garments.
If I’m losing, I should be allowed to take off one sandal at a time!
I came here with so many adornments, and now I’m stripped bare. It’s almost like Tojiko wants me to lose!
Everyone’s desires speak with the same voice: “take it off!”
The Crown Prince, the first to be stripped to her undergarments. Seiga would be laughing herself silly could she see me.
I think I understand the problem. Human desires factor little into the machinations of this game.
I have been beaten fair and square. You’ve earned the right to see my breasts— though not to malign them.
I’ve been pushed to my limits before. In danmaku battles. In furious wars.
Streaming-Chan, was it? I suggest you understand what you’re getting into. The Crown Prince is far and away her own favorite topic of conversation.

state.text: You needn’t worry, Streaming-Chan. Though she can hear all your desires, The Crown Prince can only make educated guesses over their meaning. It’s far more fallible than she’d like to think.
Crown Prince, do not be distracted. Before giving your sermon, you must follow the rules of the game and strip.
My apologies, Streaming-Chan. I don’t think she’s paying attention. I’ll just undress her here quickly.
The Crown Prince means she wants a harem, Streaming-Chan. She thinks life has a “Harem End”.
Emotional— Tojiko, hold up! Lady Chen— Tojiko wait! Lady Chen, I admit Byakuren’s theme may be catchy— Let me finish! Tojiko! Stoooooop!
The Crown Prince neglects to mention I was supposed to transfer my soul into a sturdy ceramic vessel. Let us not trust Futo to know the difference between a fired and unfired jar again.
Crown Prince, perhaps the best gift you could give others is keeping an eye on Lady Seiga, and making sure she doesn’t steal people’s belongings whilst dressed as the Saint Nicholas.
The Crown Prince now considers young Kokoro to be her daughter. She’s a collection of masks the Prince designed, which became a youkai after being lost for centuries.

What the Crown Prince means to say, is that because she had to disguise her true sex, hoarding many lovers was impossible. She took on other wives to maintain appearances, though only I partook of her.

case.state: Hm, so it seems the rumors of the Crown Prince sneaking off on her own were true. And with the shrine maiden to boot. Let me help you with that, Crown Prince.
I don’t particularly mind this side of the Crown Prince, Reimu. Or perhaps I’m just used to it. So long as she follows my “advice”, I can’t complain.
I was truly blessed to be introduced to Tojiko, a woman who felt the same love. I had four wives, as was the custom at the time, but the other three did not share our romantic desires.
Ahem. Since the Crown Prince obviously needed to sire heirs to establish her own legitimacy, we secretly adopted orphans from time to time. Even they never knew her secret.
The Crown Prince has many faults, but attentiveness in bed isn’t one. What about you, Reimu? I worry with your lazy attitude you’d be nothing but a “pillow princess”.
It’s as you say, Reimu. While the Crown Prince and I have done it together plenty, getting together with anyone else was a rarity. She couldn’t let anyone know her true sex.
I was a problem child for my father. I never hit it off with any of my suitors until I met Miko, who felt as I did. Even so long ago, you had to be patient to find your perfect partner.
I wear what I find comfortable. If there was even a single hair I didn’t want to be viewed, it would be hidden. But you who have bested me until now deserve to see everything!
The Mantle the Crown Prince refers to is toilet paper, by the way.
Crown Prince… what the hell is going on here? Where did all these others come from?
Thank you Crown Prince. Now let’s get you out of your cape before things drag on too long. Ah, please call the Crown Prince “Miko,” Leon. Not “Jesus”.
The Crown Prince already tested her alchemy on me, once upon a time. It’s how I ended up in this state to begin with. Forgive me if I’m reluctant to experiment further.
There’s no use in trying to flirt with the Crown Prince, Cagliostro. She melts in the presence of any woman with a large chest and wide hips, but isn’t interested in girls that look like she does.
Is that how it is, Lord Bobobo? Forgive me, I forgot we are both hermits. Two beings revived to eternal life must join together in combat, and join together in study of the Tao!
Never despair over a love lost, Lord Bobobo! For somewhere out there is a woman for you, and all heartache is healed by sinking your head into a warm, soft bosom!
It seems you are unable to govern over your desires, Lord Bobobo. My ability, to hear and understand ten desires at once, is necessary for that!
Though they seem like cockamamie stories, the Crown Prince is telling the technical truth. She doesn’t mention she was sleeping for most of the past fourteen centuries, though.
It’s— oh, hello. Sorry, where did we meet last, Fina? But yes, you needn’t get the Crown Prince started on her accomplishments.
Though I suppose the Crown Prince’s sermons could be thought of as a song and dance routine, the cape is overkill once off the stage.
Yet even hermits and saints must abide by the rules, Crown Prince. Lady Chara, the ascension was managed via Taoist sorcery— Not that it has anything to do with vengeful spirits like ourselves.
You seem rather… existing for an obliterated spirit, Lady Chara. In any case, something similar happened to Tojiko. The vessel she was supposed to transfer to from her frail, mortal body, um, broke.
Since the only things worth comparing here are the clothes left, let’s take off something big. Oh, and I assure you, Lady Perona, pampering is the last thing the Crown Prince needs.
So you and ~player~ were like I, Lady Chara! Wondering why Man was fated to die, even as the world kept turning and the seas— all of them, Tojiko? No, I’ll do it, I’ll do it.
Oh, what a fantastic offer, Lady Perona. I suppose I’ll have to think on this enticing opportunity. Tell me more, what would working alongside you entail?
Lady Pyrrha, I’d advise against such lines of questioning. The Crown Prince’s reign is among her favorite subjects, and she needs to strip now, not talk.
You’re right, Lady Perona, the Crown Prince should be more appreciative of me. Instead of letting her eyes wander, she should cherish what she has. Oh well, too late now.
Ahem— Crown Prince, young Lady Perona doesn’t need to hear all that. Talk instead about when we first met.

It is a tragic tale, Lady Yuri, but the men of my time period weren’t interested in being ruled by a woman, despite my sublime acumen. I’m thankful in this day and age I can discard such unneeded trickery.
The greatest calamity I overcame— Tojiko, careful where you— was the military insurrection by the Mononobe Clan— you’re touching my— against the civil reforms of my administration.
And who, pray tell, is the one you are so “happily married” to, Crown Prince? i’m sure Miss Lux would love to know.
It is tragic that so many don’t look past the exterior of a person, Lady Yuri. Still, there is little recourse than to continue being yourself.
I think what would put people at ease here would be removing your garments as you lost, Crown Prince. That’s one piece of clothing down, correct?
Crown Prince, you needn’t flatter so. Lady Lux, I doubt most would keep a vengeful spirit as their consort. Is the other ghost’s partner as… exceptional as Miko?
Clearly, Lady Pyrrha, a productive society is one where private interests are put aside for the public good. None are envious, with the violence and corruption such resentment brings.
It really wasn’t as impressive of a disguise as the Crown Prince makes it out to be, Lady Nami. Really, she just slapped a fake mustache on herself.
You see, Tojiko? Miss Nami says our love transcends mortal bounds. Shouldn’t you demonstrate your bond with me by letting me win? It’s not cheating if I came in here wearing all this!
It’s not all that important where Japan is, Fina. The Crown Prince hasn’t wielded power there for centuries now.
Ah, I suppose people’s ways of speaking and mannerisms inevitably change. My dear ward Kokoro thinks me old fashioned— but isn’t that something all young folk think of their parents?
There are a few hurdles preventing our relationship, Lord Bobobo. Such as your… you. Still, if you won’t sneak off to play strip poker, maybe you’d be an upgrade over my current relationship.
As much as the Crown Prince enjoying flaunting the Seven-Star Sword, it wasn’t made for her. It’s a legendary Chinese jian, passed down by Taoist masters.
Our hobbies back then were rather boring, I must admit. Calligraphy, archery, seeking immortality via alchemy, and writing were my regular leisure activities, Lady Yuri.
Despite what the Crown Prince might have you believe, it wasn’t anything glamorous, Miss Lux. She stayed up late a lot studying. Sometimes too late— she needs to sleep properly, you know?
Um, Lord Bobobo… as much as I cherish our totally real and not at all faking it to needle Miko relationship, you sound exactly like my mother. Knock it off, please.
Technically the Crown Prince only conquered the warlords who resisted. When she says “harmony is to be valued” she means “do not oppose me, or else”.
Thats nice and all, now promise me you’ll strip like a good regent, Crown Prince. Don’t you want to set a good example for Lord Bobobo?

The youth of today will never experience the feeling of seeing your bride-to-be alight from her carriage the first time, Lady Pyrrha. Then later revealing to her you were actually a woman the whole time.
Don’t worry, Takatoshi. All the junk with the Crown Prince was so long ago, it doesn’t really matter how it happened. Even today, all you hear is what makes people look good.
Fina, Miko re\formed our country and the people loved her for it. Yes, she’s vain, arro\gant, con\ceit\ed, bad at stripping, and woman\izing, but she is truly is one of the most noble people I know.
Yes, we appreciate the honesty, do we not, Crown Prince? In any case, Pyrrha, it was my father, Soga no Umako, who arranged the marriage. The Soga clan was the most powerful in Japan at the time.
I have no qualms if you wish to live your life free, Lady Fina. However, most human beings are not so inde\pen\dent. Without a strong admin\istra\tion, the land falls to chaos and destruction.

It’s incredibly difficult, Takatoshi. Aside from the years spent studying forbidden knowledge, if you did undergo the ritual you’d have to leave behind your friends and family— unless they joined you.
Miko has the same set of ladies she came to Gensokyo with. We’re an odd family, Fina, but how much do you need to get drunk at parties and pick fights with Buddhists?
Soul transference is not an operation of the body, so one feels no pain. Besides, it’s important to keep your wits about you during the process. We had enough problems as it was— just look at Tojiko.
A hermit is one who has acquired great power and abilities as a result of religious training, Jason. I also seems to make them poor sports. Let’s take off the cape, shall we?
No Jason. I’m here for Miko. If it wasn’t for me, who knows if she’d take anything off.
I am of the belief that what everyone truly desires is the removal of your cape, Crown Prince. Ah, apologies for interrupting, Monika.
Crown Prince, in order to understand the common folk, you need to first lower yourself to their level. Sorry for the interruption, Lady Kumatora. I’m known as Soga no Tojiko.
Lady Kasen is a noble sort who keeps the young maiden Reimu on her training regimen. Though, it’s possible in this case, “Every rose has its horns”.
What hasn’t Seiga done? Treachery. Necromancy. Stealing Christmas. I know well her evil deeds… er, because she is my mentor and lives with me.
My mausoleum drifted into the land of illusion, Gensokyo, after being forgotten for so long. I was roused from my slumber when a horde of Buddhists erected a temple on the land above.
How rude, Lord Bobobo! Tojiko was my lawfully wedded wife! Though, I suppose since gay marriage wasn’t legal at the time… would that make our nuptials void?
That’s all well and good, Crown Prince, but in this game we’d rather you slip off your cape.
The Crown Prince is indeed more high maintenance than most, but I enjoy keeping the Crown Prince on the proper track. Isn’t that right, Crown Prince? …The Crown Prince says yes.
I think what the Crown Prince aims to say is to forgive her if she appears old-fashioned, Mari. Now, let’s get you out of that cape.
The Crown Prince has a great political mind, but perhaps is lacking in “common sense”. She never listens to the other side of a conversation and can be swayed by… pretty faces.
Though the Crown Prince may seem selfish, and smug, and carefree, she’s an attentive lover. She’s caring in her own way, but I also mean in a physical sense.
Royalty in my era had multiple wives, not harems. But besides Tojiko, my consorts were only in it for the political gain… they didn’t enjoy a woman’s touch as we did.
You needn’t worry, Kora. I wouldn’t let the Crown Prince go to war over something as silly as a harem… not that she even has a proper one herself.
Gensokyo doesn’t need much in the way of infrastructure… rather, there’s no use for it. What the people need is someone to bring peace to their souls— and I am just such a messiah!
I’m glad you understand, Kumatora. You’ll make someone special very happy one day. Of course, the Crown Prince has her charm points as well…
I don’t want to wholly abandon this world. In every age, humans will need a leader. However, even hermits will decay eventually. Only Celestials are truly eternal.
In other words, the Crown Prince stuffed her soul into a new body that satisfied her vanity. I can’t deny she looks good, though.
It’s fine, Kaz. The Crown Prince has the body she chose, so it’d be silly if she got offended over her features. Ah, the cape if you please.
I suppose I understand, Lord Kaz. My underling Futo is diminutive and irascible. But though I wouldn’t have her as my wife, her loyalty to me is unquestionable!
Though I always had popular support, not everyone will be on your side. For instance, the Mononobe Clan took up arms against my spreading of Buddhism. Obviously, I crushed their rebellion.
The Crown Prince has an excellent memory when it comes to herself… unless she were to try to remember her moments of embar\rass\ment or failure. Then her memory is oddly fallible.
If I am to be the hope of humanity, I cannot allow myself to get sucked into trivial matters. I must be always focused on the big picture!
Crown Prince, do not stall with tales of your exploits. You need to take off all your jewelry, lest you be thought of as cheating.
You need have no fear, young Kamina. I’m already the best, even without my valued headphones.
These Kappa-built headphones are an important item to me. They block my hearing of unwanted desires and let me listen to my theme music on repeat.
A Prince would never send out their servants to do her dirty work. Unless it’s something I don’t want to do.
Thank you, Princess Koriand’r. Miko is a tremendously lucky woman indeed.
I’m afraid these are a one-of-a-kind artifact, Sir Guzma. They were originally a pair of hand-crafted earmuffs, used to give me respite from my super-human hearing.
I’m sure the Crown Prince can undress herself, Lady Yuelia. If I’m here, however, I may as well attend to her, and ensure she properly follows the spirit of the game.
They were once but simple earmuffs, used to block out overabundances of voices. I had them modified, so I could listen to music as well.
Crown Prince, before you start monologuing, please remember the rules. Your cape will do for this round.
Miss Jolyne, it’s wisest not to get the Crown Prince started on her favorite topic. You’re young and have so much better things to do.
And now as an immortal, The Crown Prince needs to remove her cape. By the way, I’d prefer if you didn’t set your creature on me, Lady Cynthia.
The Saint of the outside world? Lady Seiga seems to think our Crown Prince is far more magnificent, so I doubt any battles would end in this Lord Hank’s favor.
The Crown Prince has been a part of Court since she was a child, Sir Raynor. Though since she’s clearly never learned to undress herself, I’ll take over that duty.
I— No, Miss Bernie, I’m here for the cape. Just what have you been telling this girl, Crown Prince?
I hardly stand on ceremony, Crown Prince. Miss Bernie’s remarks don’t offend me. Now, off with this garbage here.
Oh, Lady von Varley? Are you saying that should I send this vengeful spirit away, your faith in me would surely grow? (Erm, feel free to play along, Tojiko.)
Observe, Lady von Varley, as I valiantly hand over my… does it have to be my headphones? They’re Kappa-made, and quite comfortable.
You understand now, Lady von Varley? There is no reason to fear, if I am keeping order. Truly, my way is that of heaven, and my right to rule divine!
Ah, yes, I supposed you’ve realized, Lady von Varley. Indeed, this spirit is my consort. Really, I tried telling you earlier, but I suppose some people just do not listen to others.
The Crown Prince has no shortage of tales, Sir Raynor. And no shortage of breath either. But keep in mind, though it is may be a self-aggrandizing version of the truth, it is still the truth.
The Crown Prince, myself, and our ally Futo planned to transfer our souls to immortal vessels. The Crown Prince somehow saw fit to allow Futo to look after mine. It broke, and now I’m dead.
I see you found yourself a spirit friend, Crown Prince. She’s quite pretty. Well, best of luck in your game.
I’m flattered, Miss Polly, but my duty must be to taking care of the Crown Prince’s garments. I’m not sure she even knows how to undress herself, frankly.
Perhaps, Crown Prince, the people would admire you more were you to give your all in stripping.
So you understand, Sir Raynor. Though I could have resurrected in any era, I chose a time when I could live freely as a woman. A woman with a gorgeous wife.

Humans shouldn’t be ruled for personal ambition, yet they deserve a leader able to guide them to their hope-filled future. Ideally, it would be one to arise from their own ranks— I should only step in if needed.
Ah, it sounds like you’re in good hands, Sir Raynor. In order for the people to flourish, harmony must be valued and petty quarrels avoided. This is the sacred truth above all else.
Crown Prince, a leader must take care not to appear over-confident, lest her subjects see her as a fool. Listen to Lord Aster.
Being a leader comes with its share of headaches, Sir Raynor, but I feel a deep satisfaction in my work. My guidance allows others’ lives to flourish.
Hi Senko. I have to be honest, I don’t think the Crown Prince actually recognizes you.
I think we want to impress for this round, Crown Prince, so lets remove your sword and belts. Thank you, Senko, glad to know someone appreciates me.
Thanks for the offer, Senko. These days I mostly just take care of the others— including making sure the Crown Prince fulfills her obligations. Do you want to help me with that?
This is a competition, Sir Raynor, no more, no less. Is your desire not to to oppose me, and achieve some merit should you defeat me?
Hi Takatoshi, my name’s Soga no Tojiko. You don’t need to tell the Crown Prince about her life— she already loves talking about it herself.
What the Crown Prince won’t admit, Sucrose, is all the pomp and circumstance is mostly a force of habit. She hasn’t ruled as a prince in fourteen hundred years.
Well, you assume I’m on the Crown Prince’s side in all this, Sucrose. I just want to make sure she doesn’t cause trouble to the others here.
Ah, my Seven-Star Sword is quite literally priceless, Miss Scuttlebutt. It is a legendary sword, and more importantly a part of me.
Ah, no. I’m a vengeful spirit actually, brought back by a grudge against one Mononobe no Futo— who happens to also be one of our Taoist clan.

The Crown Prince doesn’t need anyone else to praise her voice, she’s her own biggest fan.
(Though between you and me, Komi, I love her regal and commanding sound.)
Or is it that you wonder If I’ve a man’s organ down there? I promise you, my body is biologically female.
I wouldn’t describe myself as a friend, Heris. Think of me as a devoted attendant, who handles many of the Crown Prince’s… needs.
{Tojiko}I’m not a butler, Arle. Believe it or not, I was the daughter of a noble family. However, the Crown Prince needs someone to watch over her.
I’ve heard them before, Crown Prince. Perhaps write something new?
These cards are beholden to naught but the randomness and unpredictability of fate.
I do though, since during my mortal life I presented myself as a man.
Do you think if I were scared, I could have accomplished half as much? A quarter? An eighth? A trillionth of one percent!?
This era, when humans deny my existence and I have become legend, is what I was waiting for!
This is a Saint’s last resort— an ultimate desire to prevail. Spell Card: ”Newborn Divine Spirit”
Let’s take off your cape to start with, Crown Prince.
It’s poor manners to wear one’s cape indoors, Crown Prince. I shall relieve you of such.
Crown Prince. Allow me to take your cape for you, while you enjoy your game of Strip Poker.
I think it would be fair to count the belts as one item, Crown Prince. After all, you have so many more adornments than the others.
Crown Prince, it would of course be unseemly to stall by removing but a single trinket.
These accessories are so small. Fairness dictates we ought to count them as a single item, Crown Prince.
Crown Prince, you are no doubt aware this venue has a strict limit of eight clothing items.
Crown Prince, those who bend the rules to their advantage are not looked upon with admiration.
I wasn’t using my headphones at the moment, so it’s a sacrifice I’m willing to make.
These weren’t on my ears? No wonder Soutoku Legend ~ True Administrator wasn’t playing at full blast all day like normal.
Originally these were simple earmuffs to block out unwanted conversations. I had the Kappas modify them.
I’ll be fine without my headphones, as long as everyone doesn’t start talking about… odd things. I can hear it all.
Nevermind all that. Tojiko, my garments, if you will.
Don’t worry about stuff like that, Crown Prince. I shall undress you post-haste.
Tojiko, I suppose you can remove my— oh you’ve already started. Thanks.
In any case: A prince does not remove her own garments. Though it seems Tojiko is on top of things.
Perhaps there is more to this game than I initially suspected. Regardless, I remain focused on victory for now.
The true measure of a woman is hardly how big her breasts are!
ERROR! YOU SHOULDN'T BE SEEING THS!
However, I’d rather not dwell upon your desires, Lady Chen. Your fantasies are a bit much, even for me.
Tojiko, wait! Um, I mean… through Taoism, one can understand the natural universe and bend it to your will! Unbelievable strength! Immortality! Hold on, I’m not finished!
…And to top it all off, I came in first place in Reimu and Sumireko’s Danmaku Fireworks Contest!
Even though they know that they'll get banished from Paradise, humans cannot resist tasting the Forbidden Fruit. Judge me not for my humanity!
You are wrong, Lady Chen! It matters not to me which you prefer. Just know, empirically, my ears are better than yours!
Yes, well. At least Tojiko doesn’t hold a grudge against Futo. And thankfully, unlike your Western Ghosts, Japanese spirits can be fully corporeal.
Yes, well, after I cut off any allowance for buying fetuses to use in her dark arts, she tried to accumulate funds through other means. Even tied an antler to Yoshika’s head.
And of course, dear Kokoro adores me! She may say that I’m so unfashionable, or out of touch, but that’s how daughters let you know they care!
Y-yes, well, dear Tojiko, in this new world, women can openly have multiple lovers! I’d include you, of course! It’s called a “threesome”.
T-T-T-Tojiko?? How long have you been here! I— I wasn’t meeting up with Reimu secretly! Her boobs aren’t big enough for me!
I’d be unhappy too, if the Crown Prince messed around behind my back. Thankfully, she makes her intentions more than clear. And I too can enjoy the fruits of her labor, hm?
The others kept my secret so they could enjoy the political benefits of being married to me, but I was never able to enjoy my birthright: group sex with lustful ladies!
Sadly all my heirs, as well as the remainder of the Soga clan, were eradicated by the Nakatomi clan, later the Fujiwara. But what can you do, that’s politics!
Oho, even a deaf man could hear your desires, Reimu. No one can determine your role or what gives you pleasure but you. If you wish to top, then top with passion!
Tojiko! A wise man once said: I fear not the woman who has pleasured a thousand ladies once, but the woman who has pleasured one lady a thousand times… I think.
What a beautiful declaration, Reimu. While you and Tojiko were talking, I revealed my chest. I know it’s unspectacular compared to my consort’s, but do please pay me mind.
My body was designed to adhere to my ideal form! Every hair on my nethers, every fold between my legs, is as it should be! You look fine though, Reimu.
(Miko is enjoying herself tremendously, Madams Sakura and Saki. This is just how she is. Please, have fun.)
I have no qualms with you learning all you need to know from me of denuding and losing at cards, Lord Bobobo. I have a feeling the student shall soon surpass the master!
It seems to me I have nothing left to teach you in the art of denuding and losing at cards, Lord Bobobo. For once in my life, I have been surpassed!
Tojiko wait, I wanted to save that cape for later! Oh, I know what you’re thinking, Leon, and it’s not true. I wasn’t born in a stable at all!
Of course my wife would be the best, little one. A prince doesn’t settle for any less (from the options provided her by the Soga Clan)!
Do you think I would choose any lesser woman to be my wife, Scarlet Devil? Ignore that it was an arranged marriage.
In a friendly game of cards such as this, I hardly need to show the full breadth of my abilities, Sir Raynor. It’s more fun if our skills are even, is it not?
Oh, this display is merely luck, Sir Raynor. I needn’t go all out in a friendly game such as this— it’s more fun this way.
Tojiko! When— L-lady Yuri, please understand! I was not sleeping, I was awaiting my resurrection!

Tojikoooo! Lady Fina’s simply gifted in the art of future sight! She remembers the future! And, when did you get here, Tojiko?
…I could use future sight of my own.
Cursed, Arch-Wizard? My modest bosom allowed me to disguise as a man. I’d much rather sink my head into another woman’s chest!

So you wish to follow in my footsteps as an immortal saint, Lady Chara? Sadly, you’d need an intact body and functioning soul in order to take a form akin to my— wait, where’d Shichi-Sei Ken go? Tojiko!
Tojiko!? What— how— wait, don’t take her for yourself Lady Perona!
Tojiko! What is the meaning of this? Have I— Lady Perona, what do you mean she’d do everything?

You’ve a wealth of strength, Lady Chara. Yet you are still but a vengeful spirit at your core, far away from power unending. Even I, despite my clear brilliance, have not yet reached the pinnacle of everlasting life!
Fool that I am! Since awakening in Gensokyo, I have only thought of bettering myself, and neglected gratitude for what I had. Tojiko, I shall shower you with praise! Um… give me a moment to think.
T-T-T-Tojiko!? Lady Pyrrha does wish for me to talk! Wait, how long have you been here?
Yes… The Soga clan had come to present her. It was an arranged marriage, of course. Still, when I saw her alight from the carriage… I was immediately smitten.
In all time periods, Lady Yuri, there are those who seek to hold out against progress. But you cannot let that stop you from moving forward! Um, Tojiko, may I have one of the belts back? No?
Ah— Tojiko!? When did you— you needn’t be sorry Lady Luxanna, being a ghost doesn’t significantly inconvenience her. Also, Tojikoooooooo!
Though there were some small skirmishes, I and the Soga Clan desisively routed the Mononobe at Mount Shigi once and for all! Um, Tojiko, I need that sword, won’t you— ah, she’s gone.
Tojiko? How long have you been here? Ah— I know she’s cute, Lord Asterisk, but please don’t be eying her so!
Someone has to be in charge, Lady Pyrrha. If the people can be trusted to choose their leader, they may. Such was not the case when I was a mortal, the only alternative being war and barbarism.
You understand well, Lady Yuri. We must be true to our desires, for it is that which makes us human. Leave the self-abnegation to the religionists!
Tojiko, I would rescue you from any soul-stealing creature! Also, why did you intone “exceptional” like that there? Tojikooooo!
Aaah! Tojiko when did you— Oh, please don’t be rude, Miss Nami. That’s Tojiko. Only I may scream at her presence.
T-Tojiko!? How long have you— Hold on, Lord Bobobo, I saw her first!
No! Wait! Come back! I only happened to come across this game, but next time I’ll invite you, Tojiko!
Tojiko! How— when— my magic is based on the Tao, but I am indeed quite skilled, Lady Fina. Also, aaah— Tojiko!?
What are you saying, Miss Nami? I don’t— well, I only somewhat need her! Don’t tell her I said as such, she may get mad.
Indeed, yes, Lady Yuri. More importantly, it’s also my original body, swapped via transfiguration to create my current, immortal body. So, Tojiko… may I have it back? It’s kind of important.
Understand well, Lady Pyrrha! One day you too shall have a closet of infinite electronics, and Kokoro will be the papa whose tastes are unpopular!
I understand, Lord Bobobo— you are so long lived a hermit that you’ve lapsed into your original tongue! Unfortunately, it makes me think of a six foot tall version of Lady Futo. It’s uncanny, really.
Tojiko!? When did— Ah! Is it so obvious we’re together, Private Hijiyama?
(I don’t think you quite understand what you’re speaking of, Fina. Miko is revered as a Saint in our land even today. But don’t tell her I said this, we’d never hear the end of it.)
Princess Kaguya is very much real, Takatoshi. Kind of a NEET, though. Spends most of her time playing with her friend with phoenix powers.
D-do you truly find me so wonderful, Tojiko?<hr>{Tojiko}Please don’t talk, Crown Prince, or else I’ll thunderbolt you.{!reset}<hr>Yes, Tojiko.
It was certainly a surprise, Pyrrha! But you know, I can’t imagine giving myself to a man. I doubt many in arranged marriages end up as happy as I did.

Oh no, Lady Yuri, all that mercury I ingested ruined my old body. That’s why I had to settle for turning my legendary sword into a new body and my old body into a new legendary sword. Speaking of, Tojiko, where did you put it?

I care deeply for my people, Lady Fina. But it is far better to take the possibility of a state’s cruelty over the certainty of the wolves’! Oh, these are called headphones. I paid the Kappa to make them.
The Soga Clan was completely wiped out a few decades after I died, Pyrhha. Well, that’s life in the Feudal Era. I suppose when one powerful family falls, another will naturally take its place.
W-well, please do not look down on Tojiko, Lady Luxanna. She means well. Though I must admit, I don’t often garner sympathy.
Well, all except my loyal retainer Mononobe no Futo and my beloved wife Soga no Tojiko! …Though, you can see in the case of Tojiko things didn’t go according to plan.
A pirate, eh? I suppose in the end, living your life unmoored from the suffering of the world is the hermit ideal. …Though, I’m sure your pirate armada could be more efficiently organized…
Don’t worry, Yuri, being a vengeful spirit rather suits me. I don’t at all mind the lack of legs.
I plan to look after the Crown Prince the rest of the night, Kumatora. Though I must warn you— The Crown Prince has a thing for tomboyish princesses.
T-T-Tojiko! Lady Hu, she likes being a ghost, honest! And I like being me!
Tojiko? Ah, I mean— Her name is Soga no Tojiko, Lady Monika. I knew she was here, of course, I simply forgot to mention it.
Seiga was willing and able to teach me the secrets to life everlasting and other unnatural powers. You can’t make an immortality omelette without allying with a few evil eggs.
Well, I shouldn’t repeat rumors I’ve yet to confirm myself, Lady Fina. Let’s just say “wild and horny” may need to be taken literally.
Right again, Lord Bobobo. And since the monarchs of the Asuka Period had multiple wives, I ought to be having even more nuptials!
Ah, you needn’t fear Tojiko, Miss Mari. Yes, she’s a ghost, but she’s also the most beautiful ghost around!
I really don’t have much in the way of a grudge against Futo any more, so now I’m more spirit than vengeful. That said, I’m not about to pass on. It’s actually quite nice, being a ghost.
I’m certainly very lucky, Doctor Heris. Though perhaps I may be lucky enough to have a companion who allows me to extend my wardrobe? No? I suppose not.
What’s with that look, Lady Komi? I would never cavort with a woman without Tojiko knowing! In fact, one of my fantasies is being pleasured by two ladies at once!
With that face, it’s clear as day what you’re thinking, Lady Komi. But no, I haven’t used Taoist sorcery to temporarily give myself a man’s rod… yet.
Ah, Tojiko! I do look good, thank you. Um, I mean— feel free to ask any question, Lady Nico, and I would be willing to answer. At length, and all that.

Tojiko, you know I’m planning on amassing a harem!
…Oh, did you take my cape?
Oh, that’s just Tojiko, Lord Kaz. Apologies, but once my rework is finally finished she won’t appear so abruptly. Until then, pretend she was here the whole time.
Futo doesn’t have the two big things the Crown Prince most desires in a partner, so I have nothing to fear. And note she didn’t say Futo’s competency was beyond question.
Now, try to defeat me! And I will be resurrected as a statesman of eternal life!<hr>{Tojiko}Don’t bother, Bobobo. Once she starts her grandstanding she doesn’t pay attention to anyone else.
I abhor cruelty, but I cannot afford to garner a reputation as a coward. Still, it is infinitely more effective to lead through positive emotions than negative ones.
I remember the time she tried to ride her horse, Kurokoma, faster than ever and fell off. Or the time she had Futo prepare our vessels for immortality and mine got broken. Or the time…
Breasts! Big, soft breasts!
Kaz, don’t let the Crown Prince flatter herself. She always goes with her whims and only gets involved when it tickles her fancy.
She is not my producer! I could defy her if I chose to! I just don’t choose to.
So? Mankind ill needs a savior such as you! Myself, on the other hand, I would be an excellent savior.
I must look the part of royalty for all my adoring fans. You understand, do you not, Miss Nikaidou?
Fool that you are, young Kamina! Do you not see that a Prince’s true power is that of delegation!
The Kappa are foolish. You just need to throw money at them and they do what you want!

Lady Caulifla… I would warn you if you would go into battle against the inhabitants of Gensokyo. Though your power is maximum, our abilities transcend raw strength.
A victory for me. But a pity that the loss landed at the feet of this lovely young lady we have playing with us today.
It does not bother me in the slightest our chests are about the same size! After all, it is not my own bosom I would sink my head into after a long day.
You have returned, Young Chihiro? Green Chihiro was speaking of you. I hope this game has not caused you undue worry.
You strike a most imposing figure, Lady Li.
Oh, it appears we're earmuff sisters! Yours are most charming.
A witch, eh? The cape draped around your shoulders tells me as much about you as your general disposition. I should hope there shall not be any conflict between us.
Witches love their research. Might I suggest researching the noble Taoist arts instead?
Another loss, Professor Croix? Perhaps science cannot explain my majesty.
Oho! It seems “science” is no match for “Miko”!
You seem to possess much competitive spirit, Miss Ibarazaki. I’m impressed with the drive of one so young.
Ah, what I meant earlier is that, due to a sequence of events I’d rather not delve into, my own beloved consort, Soga no Tojiko, lacks legs. Also life.
If Tojiko was here, I feel she would have words of wisdom to say. Seeing as she also lacks legs.
It seems you have nothing left to wager, Miss Ibarazaki. Though you fought well, I—
Lady Erufuda, the “Elf,” was it? I must say, you’re… more than what I’m used to in Gensokyo.
The first step to polishing your physique into shape, Lady Erufuda, is to make sure you’re eating only the healthiest foods.
Prosecutor von Karma, I can hear within you a desire for justice, for victory, for upholding order on behalf of the state.
I must say, the whip is a unique method for executing the will of the state.
I don’t understand all this talk of perfection, Prosecutor von Karma. Don’t you think such things are unobtainable ideals? After all, you’re not me.
Prosecutor von Karma, I hope you don’t mind me saying: though I appreciate your dogged pursuit of all who would challenge my order, your attitude is unnecessarily severe.
Just between you and me, I present myself as more humble than I truly am. Such as when I lied about once having a bad hair day.
Lady Futaba, was it? Your desires tell me you’re very much a fan of games, so poker must be old hat to you.
I apologize for everything Futo did to you.
You appear to be some type of Tskumogami. A youkai born from some discarded weapon, presumably. I suppose that explains your odd name, Miss “HK416.”
Hold up— that symbol on your shirt! Are you one of those wretched Buddhists?
Even a clown is no match for my Taoist arts!
Oh no! Stand back everyone! She’s about to unleash her lunatic clown magic!
Clown magic!? Stare not at her, lest your mind be driven to madness
An “Ay Eye?” I know not what such a thing is, but I can tell you are not simply an ordinary human.
Always naked? Then these clothes are but figments?
You must realize there are others here, including the Almighty and Humanitarian Taoist. Or do we just not rate?
Do what you will, since we are naught but figments to your addled eyes!
Are you really so concerned with your gloves at this stage? Bah, why am I arguing with this creature?
Could it be that this girl, Ai, has ascended above the mortal world? That is why she acts so superior, and why our transient lives are inconsequential to her!
A “water bender?” I take it then your special ability is “The Ability to Manipulate Water?”
Princess L’Arachel, I can tell you are most cultured and of indisputably noble birth. Much like my gracious self.
You must do better to instill your will upon the game, and by extension the world, Future Princess Consort Hata no L’Arachel!
You ought to embrace the gazes of the common folk if you are to lead them from up high, Lady L’Arachel, wife of Princess Kokoro of House Hata!
Oh, before I forget, Princess Kokoro’s wife! I am, as you surmised, the greatest religious leader in Gensokyo.
Let me look into your heart, Miss Lotte. I shall see if you are an evil witch, or if you’re the kind that isn’t Buddhist.
Miss Lotte, if you desire to learn true sorcery you could always become one of my Taoist acolytes.
It seems the Inventory has been blessed to serve many a prince tonight. Well met, Prince Marth.
I can see why you’d be reluctant to remove your garb, Princess. You do look quite dashing, no?
If you seek to lead your Halidom to glory, you’re going to have to try harder than that, Princess.
I would recognize that hair at a glance, knave! You are Kijin Seija, the damnable Amanojaku and all around huge bitch!
Lady Borowski, are you not some sort of bakeneko or nekomata youkai? That is to say, a type of cat demon?
Feel free to take my photo, Mahiru. After all, I am gorgeous.
Not the first witch I've defeated.
Oho, it seems as if a facsimile is no match for the one true original!
You mentioned an “Angel attack” earlier. Is that damned whelp Tenshi causing trouble again? I’ll handle her if so.
Hmmm…. This is an interesting one… but what’s her goal? I must collect more data on this one... surreptitiously.
You are called Moon, correct? Yet I sense no connection with the moon’s denizens, The Lunarians.
Tell me, young Moon, did Junko or her partner Hecatia Lapislazuli create you, to drop you into the Lunar Capital?
Your desires place you as a princess of Makai. I believe another daughter of the goddess of Makai lives in the Forest of Magic.
Ohoho! What a spectacular job you’ve done, “Ping.” Even I was fooled for a split second.
Ohoho! So the truth is now revealed! What you say is true, Lady Mulan, men fall so easily for such disguises!
So you shall keep your weapon? Respectable. I know all too well how a sword can become an extension of one’s body.
Hm, and what’s this one? A pirate? A rapscallion and ruffian, do doubt.
I've looked into your heart Natsuki... though you look young, your desires are that of an adult.
It’s reassuring to know the fairies in Gensokyo are no more annoying than the ones in the outside world.
The problem solving skills expected of a fairy.
You’re… pink. Very pink. A youkai, I’m guessing?
After staring deeply into your cleavage, I believe I can safely say you are not Unzan, nor even a cloud spirit.
Now that we have established you are not Unzan, I suppose we must address the obvious. Unless you’ve received a particularly bad sunburn, your pink skin is certainly the sign of a youkai.
Seems almost pointless to save those stockings for last. You could even keep them on if you wished, no one would mind.
You claim to be fashionable, yet you don’t even posses a cape?
I myself am hailed as the most fashion-forward in Gensokyo. My cape has won over numerous devotees.
Ah, I recognize you now! Miss Sakuya, Head Maid of the Scarlet Mansion, are you not?
I’ve found myself accompanying Kokoro to some of her playdates with Lady Flandoll, and have gotten to know all the mansion’s denizens quite well.
Now that I think about it, Kokoro mentioned Franranruu having a sister as well.
The only inhabitant of the mansion I have yet to meet is Frandle’s sister. No real loss, apparently.
I wish I had brought a servant with me to fetch saké… or remove my garments.
Oh, what a cute little magic trick. Nothing compared to my Taoist Arts, but a fine spell nonetheless for a young girl like you.
Oh, is something wrong with Lady Flandre? I hope not, she’s such a charming young girl.
Think you intimidating with your little gizmos there?
Normally I would refer to you as “Lady” Revy, but in this instance that seems untrue.
A white-haired maiden with the power of fire? Are you some relative of the Lady Fujiwara?
I know not this “Lady Satsuki” you speak of, Young Ryuko. There is no higher power I could serve that isn’t my own self, Regent of Japan and Taoist master.
If left up to me, breaking the spell that bonds you and your dress is hardly anything difficult. You! Lady Ryuko! I'm about to sunder you from your dress; you don't mind, do you?
Miss Saki, I can see from your desires that you are a very lonely girl.
How unfortunate you won't join me at my dojo, Lady Saki. Well, if you do die my comrade Seiga can always make you into a jiang-shi!
Looking and listening to you more closely, Miss Nikaidou… Oho! Though you disguise yourself with makeup, you are a jiang-shi, are you not?
Miss Nikaidou. Or should I say, Jiang-Shi Number Two? Does your master allow his seven enslaved corpses to just walk freely?
The truth, Miss Nikaidou, is that you shall get nowhere trying to forward your agenda on fighting alone.
Politics may not be as glamorous and thrilling as a danmaku battle, but it is an effective method of enacting your will upon a country.
So then, Miss Nikaidou. Will you give up your silly crusade for control of Japan? You cannot hope to compete with a true administrator.
And that’s that, Miss Nikaidou. Did your master beautify your most feminine aspects as well?
I see even rotten delinquents of the modern age can recognize the utility of the noble sarashi.
But of course. Though my deeds may sound outrageous to mortals, I never make claims I cannot back up. To use the modern parlance, “I am that bitch.”
Now this one is bizarre. A jiang-shi entertainer, made to look like a normal human. A body enslaved for the master’s gain, deceiving all. That’s brilliant, actually!
You are awfully limber for a jiang-shi, Number One. What is your master’s secret?
You neglected to cover enough of your body with makeup, Jiang-Shi Number One. Unfortunately, without that particular ruse the prospects for a jiang-shi troupe seem dim.
Lady Sayaka! From your desires I can tell you detest witches!
Oh dear, another loss by our hero of justice, Lady Sayaka?
Perchance I wasn’t paying enough attention, Lady Sayaka, but from where does your hatred of witches derive?
You need not fear, Lady Sayaka. Should you be stripped bare, I can handle any witch, lasers beams or no.
If you used clothing transformation magic, shouldn’t you at least know the contents of your outfit? Unless, this is not your spell?
You haven’t much left, Lady Sayaka. I don’t detect your immortality spell can last long without your gemstone.
You ought to have kept your cape, Lady Sayaka. Now you shall be naked and unstylish.
Have you any desires, Young Sayori? Dreams of love and literature? Allow me to peek into your heart, and I may find it in myself to grant a wish or two.
No worries, Lady Sheena. Women in my age wore no underwear as well.
Are you some type of.. boat tsukumogami?
Please continue to take bullets— I mean, lose games on my behalf.
I have done well to not lose. You were acceptable as well, boat.
Shimakaze, are you acquainted with Futo’s boat?
Shimakaze! All my followers are willing to give their lives for me if need be! Except Seiga.
Shimakaze! Sacrifice your modesty so that I may brag of my victory!
Excellent, tsukumogami. You excel at losing!
I say, Madam Syrenne, you’d fit right in with the denizens of Gensokyo. You certainly possess the lushness.
I ought to introduce you to the fellow drunkards of Gensokyo. Well, for the sake of brevity, I should only introduce you to those drunker than even that.
Say, Madam Syrenne, where does your beer sometimes disappear too? My baton needs not be consistent, for I am magic.
Not to be rude, ~player~, but Madam Tharja here seems strangely enamored with you. I can’t imagine why.
Wait, are we allowed to use spells to cheat— I mean, ensure our victory? Well, it’s not as if I need to resort to such measures.
I've been wondering, are you some manner of horse youkai?
Your desires mark you as... part horse, part human? Be you a youkai?
Not surprising a human could outsmart a youkai. Or a horse.
A Horse Youkai… That would be a Sagari or a Kiran, correct?
I apologize for my earlier outbursts. It’s just… horse desires are hard for me to read.
I mean, does it even matter now?
What more can you lose, really?
Well… now you’re naked.
Whether a witch or a goddess, it matters little to me. I am the Almighty Taoist who Controls the Cosmos, the Hope of Humanity, and the light for all mankind!
It seems you look down on humans, Lady Zizou. I can assure you, the feeling’s hardly mutual on my end.
Oh, at first glance I thought you were Patchouli Knowledge, librarian of the Scarlet Devil Mansion. You have the same… purple-ish aura.
Crown Prince, I think you’ve offered Young Emi enough encouragement.
Thank you for you assistance earlier, Miss Nugi. You remind me of my retainers at the imperial palace.
Nugi, was it? You seem a respectable sort. How would you like to serve me in my dojo?
Tojikoooooo! Fetch me some saké! … I’m sure she’s getting it right now.
Oh, very well.
Tojikoooooo! Fetch me some saké! … Actually no, nevermind. You’re busy.
Now do you see the fruits of my brilliant tactical mind? Even when I lose, I find a way to win. Such is the cunning of the Shoutoku Taoist.
You’ve failed to protect me Shimikaze! It seems what Reimu said about shipgirls was true!
Pathetic! How dare you fail now!
I cannot believe I lost to this fool!
The entire Japanese Navy is extremely disappointed with your performance, Shimakaze.
I’ve been listening to the other boat tsukumogami talk behind your back, and they say your speed is middling at best!.
Ah, Madam Jessie. Your body is most richly tanned. Are the seasons acting up again?
Madam Jessie, could you teach me how to use this “internet” portal, and gather patrons? I believe it could prove advantageous for my designs.
So people on your internet only tune in to watch you perform sexual acts? I suppose I ought to have expected as much.
And this loss is… oh my. You poor creature. I see, so you were born without arms.
Lady Rin, listening to your desires I can tell that you don’t appear interested in acquiring magical hermit hands.
Lady Rin, I cannot be satisfied with taking “no” for an answer! You must return with me to Gensokyo so that I might outfit you with new arms!
Princess Estelle, was it? A pleasure to make the acquaintance of a fellow royal.
Lady Estelle, games such as these can prepare a young ruler for the throne. Think of this poker game as preparations for your inevitable political battles.
Excellent. Though you faltered this round, I can see your understanding of this game has expanded. And thus, your understanding of ruling.
Phenomenal, Lady Estelle! That loss was less excruciating than your previous!
Lady Estelle, now that you have a handle on the basics, I think it would be prudent to discuss your long-term goals.
Oh? It seems I am not the only member of the nobility present tonight. Princess Koriand’r, I’m ashamed to say I know little of your country, Tamaran.
No need to explain, Princess Koriand’r. With a word, I can discern your entire thought process. And what a thought process it is!
Princess Koriand’r, allow me to invite you to my dojo to train your abilites.
Surely this act of disrobing will bring our two lands closer together, Princess Koriand’r.
You still have much to learn if you shall one day be a leader, Princess. Now your last secrets will be laid bare.
A short, scrawny witch, whose first and only instinct is to fire off destructive magic. I’ve tangled with your kind before, please refrain from taking home any of my treasures.
You have enormous magical potential, Arch-Wizard Megumin. You could become a great sorcerer indeed if you studied under me.
You are unwilling to change your repertoire out of a belief that your explosion magic gives you a legendary stature. But understand this: all the things you wish to be, I already am.
It seems you are still a bit too young to appreciate the true majesty of the Taoist Arts, Arch-Wizard Megumin.
By the way, so we’re clear, Arch-Wizard. Explosion magic won’t do much to me, thanks to my Taoist arts. Or rather, I’ve already received my fair share of it.
You cannot explode away these cards, Arch-Wizard.
It seems your time has come, Flutter. Or should I say, The Goddess Yuelia?
Another failure by the goddess. It seems you are no different from those who give you faith, Lady Yuelia.
So you understand that I am the one fit to guide humanity to unlock their potential? I’m glad to see you are the agreeable sort, Lady Yuelia.
Lady Yuelia. I fear your sister must be quite strong. Tell me everything you know about this person named “Noelia”.
Lady Schnee, was it? You have all the trappings of a Yuki-onna, yet I can only detect a human spirit emanating from your desires.
Lady Schnee, correct me if I’m wrong (I’m not), but your clothing seems exquisitely tailored. You are one of great wealth and importance.
Oh? You must be a Pegasus Youkai, Lady Dash. I see you take great care of your body. It’s a pleasure to make your acquaintance.
Let’s get the obvious stuff out of the way. You’re not human, are you, Lady Amygdala?
You seem rather well behaved for a youkai, Lady Amygdala. Are you sufficiently quelled by my strength? Or do you truly mean no harm to humans?
So, are you really only interested in sleeping with a human, Lady Amygdala? I’d have thought youkai would prefer their own kind, but Lady Kirisame’s many suitors cast that into doubt.
Lady Amygdala, I’m glad to see that you both behaving yourself and enjoying our little game.
Lady Amygdala, I can sense the bulk of your desires are in like with what they call “horny”. But I also sense you hold a grudge. Such a thing wouldn’t impact our human guests, would it?
How philosophical for a youkai. Still, you needn’t worry. I’ve met my dream self, and even she doesn’t compare to me.
Are you talking about grooming, Lady Amygdala? We’ve already seen how well put together you are, for a youkai.
Lady… “Spider-Woman”, correct? Though I don’t believe you’re a youkai, both of us know you’re not entirely human either.
To whom to have you been speaking to? Have you familiars with you? I sense no one alongside you.
You keep yourself exceptionally fit, Lady Schnee. I was distracted by your expensive garments and obvious Yuki-Onna heritage, but you are a Youkai Exterminator, are you not?
Young Nanoko, wasn’t it? Well met. And you are… Oh my. You appear to be an ordinary human being.
You fascinate me in your plainness, Young Nanoko. At least ~player~ has the good sense to say as little as possible.
It seems such a pity to end our dialogue already, Young Nanoko. I am truly fascinated by your commonality.
Young Nanoko, as for your future plans: what hope you to accomplish with what little time your mortal body gives you?
Our discussion today has been elucidating, young Nanoko. I feel I’ve been given a firm grasp of the state of the peasantry of the outside world.
What a charming young lady we have with us today. I’m used to the bunch of cheating jerks we have in Gensokyo, so you are a breath of fresh air, Miss Azami.
You’ve been just lovely, Miss Azami. ~Player~? Yes, ~human.ifmale(he|she)~’s fine too.
~Player~ is wonderful, truly. Say, Miss Azami, did I ever tell you how I was crucial in solving the Urban Legend incident?
If this game is causing you stress, Miss Azami, you’re welcome to recuse yourself.
Miss Azami, your desires are ear-splitting! This is why I always wear earmuffs.
Miss Azami, your desires are ear-splitting! Where did Tojiko put my earmuffs?
Yukari Yakumo, was it not? We didn’t get much of a chance to chat during the Perfect Possession incident, given the circumstances.
What are you here for? Surely you're not here to see the naked harlots, Lady Yakumo.
You weren't even serious, were you? I've lost interest.
So, Miss Tatara. It seems your disguise was so complete, even your true desires were hidden from me.
Ahem. Perhaps I should not take a youkai as seemingly low-level as you lightly either.
Lady Nishikino, wasn’t it? I can tell in an instant you are a minstrel of some sort.
Lady Nishikino, you say you are not a medical-themed troubadour? Pity, you would have served me well in my capacity as President of Health in the human village.
Lady Nishkino, my dear young Kokoro is something of an idol herself. She sings and dances for the merriment of others, back in our home of Gensokyo.
Perhaps it would help Kokoro is she could view idols of the outside world. She would love to meet your group of bards.
Lady Komi. Although I give off the impression that I am a mind-reader, the truth is I only have preternaturally acute hearing and a indefectible understanding of human psychology.
Perhaps you failed to understand my last, Lady Komi. I must hear you speak. My powers don’t work through calligraphy.
Mocking me with more writing? No! I refuse to read any more of your derisive scrawling!
You still won’t talk, will you Lady Komi? Oh never you mind, I won’t lop off your head— that’d be gross, and I came here to have a good time.
So what shall you remove this round, Lady Komi? I must say, not knowing your desires makes the whole affair thrilling.
I’ve come to wonder, Lady Komi… are you actually a youkai? I don’t know if you’ve noticed, but you sometimes grow cat ears.
La— Miss Tomoko. Please don’t take this the wrong way, but you are a piteous wretch.
No… no, this doesn’t sit well with me. Even if Miss Tomoko has given up on life, I cannot allow myself to sit idly by!
Miss Tomoko, pay heed to my words. I shall mold you into so a citizen so shining, girls will freely allow you to feel upon their breasts.
Miss Tomoko, once you’ve come to understand the mysteries of nature, you then will take on a trade or profession.
Physical training may be too much for someone of your constitution, Miss Tomoko. But adopting some of the hermit lifestyle would be doable.
Forgive me Miss Tomoko, but your desires are simply too grim. More even than you are nonfunctional to society, you are a menace.
Lady Shamir, you said you were tasked with assassinating a target, correct? Well, it’s probably me. I’m far and away the most important one here.
Lady Shamir, would you be willing to sell your services to me? I’ve been troubled by a Buddhist monk named Hijiri Byakuren.
Lady Florence, it is fortuitous you are so open with your emotions, as I cannot get a read on your desires. If I am not mistaken (and I never am) you are no human.
So your company takes dolls similar to the terracotta figures and conscripts them as soldiers, Lady Florence? I admit, it’s a brilliant venture.
Since your masters are clearly human, I assume the goal of your enterprise is not Tea Doll supremacy. What, then, is your mission, Lady Florence?
I must say, for a doll, you’re very… well built, Lady Florence. And I hail from Gensokyo, where Youkai taking on the appearance of fetching damsels is the norm.
Despite your skills as a soldier, Lady Florence, your clothes do not seem suited for a frontline mercenary.
You’re certainly enjoying this, Lady Florence. For that matter, so am I. Like the battlefield, this is no place for cowards.
Another ruffian, by the looks of things. Oh no, I’m so scared, and so on and so forth.
You look to be a human version of that muckraking Tengu reporter, Miss Scuttlebutt. Well, I can do nothing but tell all, so ask away.
I needn’t rely on my preternatural perception to deduce your origins, Lady Galatea. You are clearly a statue youkai.
So you are installed in a gallery with fellow statue youkai and critiqued on your performance? I’d be disappointed if you received anything but high marks.
I suppose fine art ought to be appreciated from every angle.
Well met, Lady Chara. I was not expecting to meet another vengeful spirit here today.
I do not wish to pry, Lady Chara, but as I know too well, vengeful spirits are powered by a grudge against something or someone.
My consort Tojiko was supposed to reincarnate as an immortal hermit, like myself. However, our comrade Mononobe no Futo switched the vessel she was to use with a counterfeit.
After awakening, Tojiko quickly realized not having a physical body was, for her, pleasant. Her grudge has now almost dissipated, and she will likely become a simple thunder-causing ghost.
You’re quite the cute one, Lady Neptune… for a goddess. I can in an instant see your true nature, as there are many such as yourself in Gensokyo.
You are a goddess of games? I suppose there are worse things to reign over, though I can’t imagine any major religions forming around it.
Lady Neptune, you say you too must compete against other goddesses for your dominion?
Lady Neptune, Gensokyo’s Moriya Shine gathers faith through an imposing-looking goddess named Kanako.
Lady Laevatein, if it wasn’t for the faintest hint of desire hiding in your voice, I’d think you inhuman. What is it that has hardened your heart so?
Because of my mystical and preternatural abilities, I can listen to the sound of your voice and deduce your deepest desires. Lady Yunyun, I feel you might be a tad lonely.
By the way, Lady Yunyun, your aura is not a mere human’s. Are you a witch of some sort?
Lady Yunyun, I would like to propose a new method of abating your crippling loneliness: an arranged marriage!
Lady Cynthia, you are a historian and archeologist, are you not? You lucked out considerably choosing a table with me.
I’m surprised you’re unfamiliar with me, Lady Cynthia. Clearly Sinnoh does not appreciate the riveting history of Japan. Well, no matter.
Arch Wizard, you have a certain stubbornness that sets you apart from the young witch Marisa. While she endeavors to learn every type of magic, you seem rather… devoted.
There is no shame in being the Futo of your group, Arch Wizard. You will have a noble role at your prince’s right hand! Surely there is one out there to whom you would pledge yourself to?
Lady von Varley, I wish not to be rude, but you are a wretched, pathetic creature. Simply gazing upon you tugs at my heart.
Lady von Varley, so you know, my hearing and empathy are so acute I could deduce your history, mind, and destiny from but a sentence.
Lady Yuri, you are an eminently sophisticated individual. Your literary acumen is ample. Your knowledge of decorum is well-formed. And your posture… impeccable.
Oh my. Lady Polina, was it? I thought it was more than I could hope for to meet such a fetching damsel here. What sort of a spirit are you?

Lady Perona, if I may. You call yourself the “Ghost Princess”, yet you clearly are not a ghost yourself.
{small}How disappointing…
Lady… Ladybug, is what you called yourself? That’s an odd getup for a human. Are you trying to disguise yourself as an insect youkai?
Lady Yuri, I’d love to see you at one of our famed Gensokyo drinking parties. Do you have a beverage of choice? I’d only furnish you with the finest quality, of course.
You know Lady Perona, thinking on it myself… why give you five retainers, when I could teach you how to gather five hundred! All you need is a leader’s pulchritude!
Lady Polina, you mentioned the girls of my harem. Would you be amenable to joining as a loyal concubine?
Miss… Susie, was it? Though you may look human, a dark aura swirls about you, and I hear two— no three voices behind your own. This, to put it mildly, is undesirable.
Lady Pyrrha, it’s clear you take tremendous care of your body. If you don’t mind me saying. What prompts you to hone your physique so?
Lady Nagisa, would you mind terribly if I studied you? It’s just, you present such a fascinating specimen.
I am correct in presuming that your blessing was bestowed almost by accident, Lady Nagisa. Still, for an otherwise normal human to call down the power of the gods— one cannot take that lightly.
Ah, forgive me,Lady Nagisa. I’ve prattled on about your blessing this long without properly explaining it, haven’t I?
Lady Nagisa. There is someone in your life, is there not, who can see the barren land between the divine and the dark. He who can see the Illusionary World.

Oh! Forgive me, Lady Nagisa, surely you must be confused as to how I know all about you. To put it simply, I am the legendary Prince Shoutoku. A saint. And my ability is that of preternatural hearing.
Lady Yuri, I recall you said you wrote poetry. I am something of a poet myself. Just dreadful little things, hardly on the level of a true adept.
Lady Hermione, was it? I’m eager to talk with you. It’s not often I get a chance to chat with a Western Magician who seems both so studious and so… sober.
Lady Luxanna, you remind me of an “Ordinary Magician” from my home. Do you specialize in a form of magic yourself?
Lady Stella, I’ve analyzed your abilities and it seems you have the power to manipulate the gaps between worlds. Are you related to the Youkai of Boundaries, Yakumo Yukari?
Is that pink creature some sort of rodent youkai? Well, in any case it seems genial enough. How do you do, Miss Amy Rose was it?

Lady Ayano, I want you to know that from the beginning I could hear every desire echoing in your heart, and I want to say: I’m impressed! You’re clearly a de\ter\mined and hard-working in\divi\dual. I don’t see many like you.
You are a lawyer, correct Lady Mia? I’m well acquainted with legal matters— for as Prince Shoutoku, I wrote the laws of my nation!
How did you learn your magic, Lady Luxanna? Did you have a teacher, or were you self-taught?
Lady Pyrrha, I come from the realm of Gensokyo. Normally, any woman of your stature and build would be a boorish oni, yet you are unceasingly polite. Are all maidens of your home like you?
Tell me, Lady Yuri, what do you draw upon for inspiration in your work? Romantic fancy? Impassioned longing? Or perhaps raw, carnal lust?
I hate to say it, Lady Stella, but I was disappointed earlier when you said you wished not to have your powers. You’ve been given a magnificent gift. You ought to be honing such skills!
I believe you were introduced as Lady Chell, miss? How enchanting! You seem to have brought along a Tsukumogami servant? Well, I need pay it no heed.
Lady Polina, obviously I hope for shapely harlots, but that is moot if they have not the right personality. A harem is like a society: all must be in harmony under me.
Well now, you’re an interesting one, Miss Voorhees. I hope you shan’t be causing any trouble.
Still, Lady Stella, needing to wrestle with your powers while performing your super heroics certainly must take a toll on you. Surely you must do something to relax.
You were introduced as Lady Constanze Amalie von Braunschbank-\Albrechts\burger, correct? Well met. I appreciate how you seem to be the silent, studious type.
The scope of your knowledge impresses me, Miss Wikipe. I suppose your some sort of youkai scroll? An encyclopedia given life by mystical means? Well, it hardly matters to me.
Student, sportswoman, public figure, and youkai exterminator. You have so many obligations, Lady Pyrrha, have you any time for romantic activities?
Miss Wikipe, if you would be so kind as to edit my article, in accordance with the true facts of my life. To begin with, I was born a girl, and disguised as a male to wield sovereign power.
You look every bit the dapper kitsune tonight, Miss Senko. Have you a master with you, or are you here on your own?
I know how you feel, Lady Luxanna. Where I was from, the people wanted no part of a woman in charge. In order to lead, I had to hide my gender and sexuality.
You’re an odd one, Miss Amy Rose. Though I can listen to the desires within peoples’ hearts, we all can hear your pines for this “Sonic”. Another hog youkai, I assume.
Miss Senko, why is it that you help humans? I know many fox youkai would rather not trouble themselves with the problems of humans— or else act against them maliciously.
You know, Miss Wikipe, I could use someone of your near-infinite knowledge in my organization. Would you care to join me?
Miss Penny, though you look like a human, I can tell your insides are metal. Are you like those terracotta soldiers crafted by the sculptor god?
If I may be forward, you are stunning, Lady Fina. And possessing of a mysterious aura. For what reason has someone so enchanting come here?
You said you were a “robot”, was it, Miss Penny? It seems not unlike a jiang-shi. My comrade Lady Seiga had hers protect my mausoleum during my resurrection.
Lady Yuri, if you’re not one to lean on real life experience for your writing, then I assume you must instead draw inspiration from reading others’ works.
Forgive me if I’m prying too much, but… you have no paramour, Lady Pyrrha. As a woman, I understood all too well the urges you must feel. Are you able to take care of your needs at all?
Lady Sella, I could easily sneak you into Gensokyo if it meant you could visit at your leisure. Young Sumireko does something similar, freely passing through the barrier when asleep.
Lady Fina, if you feel a romantic inclination towards someone, your first step should be to send a heartfelt love poem to their domicile. Make sure to use your best calligraphy.
I’m excited to meet you, Lady Sucrose. I hear you’re a student of alchemy. I myself am a master of the Taoist alchemical arts.
Lady Charlotte, Princess of Hell, correct? It is my honor to meet you. Though forgive me, which Hell was it you were from again?
Ah, Miss… Grunt, was it? You seem to be something of a wayward soul, in need of reformation.
Lady Sucrose, what is the ultimate goal you seek through alchemy? I envied the mountains and seas, which withstood time’s ravages, and sought immortality and ascension.
Lady Fina, you bunk aboard a pirate vessel, correct? I imagine privateers to be such ruffians, I hope they treat a fair maiden like yourself with respect.
Good Lady Yuna, how is it you happen to have such fetching souls besides you? Oh forgive me, Ladies Sachi and Megumi, I don’t mean to disregard you. Quite the opposite, in fact.
Lady Sucrose, to “talk shop”, if you will, what methods are you taking advantage of to fulfill your dreams? I studied the natural world in my attempt to gain eternal life and ascend to Heaven.
There’s nothing wrong with giving in to your desires, Lady Pyrrha. When it comes time to do as such, what fantasies do you find yourself drifting to?
I mean no disrespect, Lady Sucrose, but you are remarkably timid. I’m surprised someone so learned in the ways of the world would not be more confident.
Lady Fina, disregarding Sir Cupil, are your other crewmates as charming as you? Or if not, are they at least loose and bawdy women?
Dear ladies Sachi and Megumi, you are much like I am. From a time before girls’ love was accepted, let alone celebrated. Don’t you wish to fulfill the fantasies you were unfairly deprived of?
Lady Pinelli, forgive me for prying but I can hear the desires in others’ hearts. Who is this man who so inspired you to become a mercenary?
Lady Fina, in preparation for your now seemingly imminent defeat, I must ask. What would your ideal night of passion between you and your crewmates look like?
It’s good we’ve talked so much of self-pleasure, Lady Pyrrha, for it seems your hour is soon to come. As are you.
Forgive me, Miss Amy Rose, but it seems foolish to leave something as important as one’s betrothal to fortune telling. Instead you should be married due to political benefit.
Lady Yuri, you have the figure of a goddess, yet I get the sense that you are unaccustomed to comments to that effect. Do you not have suitors throwing themselves at you back home?
Lady Macneary, I heard through the grapevine you were the crown princess of the nation of Brigid, correct? Please, tell me of your homeland.
Lady… Zoe, was it? Not that it’s really my place to say, but I’m afraid you’re not quite passing. Where I’m from, youkai are much better able to pass as human.
Miss Noelle, you work as a maid, correct? I’ve never known a maidservant to wear such heavy armor, or armor at all for that matter.
Lady Monika, my powers as a saint allow me to hear your desires. Only a hermit lacks such attachment to life and fear of death.
If I understand correctly, Lady Kumatora, you are a princess? Wonderful! I shall take your hand in marriage and expand your lands’ dominion.
Ah, Miss, I believe you were looking for me earlier? It’s me that you want. I am the Tao.
Lady Hu, I feel as if you’re not entirely interested in my offer to teach you my Taoist Arts. Is it because you think me a liar? I assure you, my powers are legitimate.
Lady Hu, you seem rather perturbed by my ideals. Wait, what was it you said your title was? Seventy-Some-Numbered Director of the… Wangsheng Funeral Parlor?
For one as I, whose vision sees beyond the land, whose designs extend for eons ahead, whose aspirations circle the globe— how could I satisfy myself with a mortal’s allotted lifespan?
Doctor Heris, did you come to study the, ah, biology behind today’s activities? Or are you here for pleasure?
Since we are in such a venue, Lady Yuri, permit me to ask: how would you desire a partner to love you physically?
Your lightning bolt motif is most eye-catching, Lady Kora. And I can tell from your body you are a seasoned fighter. Surely a knight as alluring as you must have someone they serve?
I’m pleased to be playing alongside a Princess tonight. Well met, Lady von Luftschloss Narfidort. I’d love to hear about the land you rule over.
Ah, so this is your invocation to the god Barbatos you spoke of? I’d like to meet them. Even if it is not my faith, you can learn much from other devotions.
What devotion, to serve your god in such a carnal game. As a Taoist, I believe human desires are beautiful and should not be repressed. But even I wouldn’t send my acolytes here.
Are you allied with the “families” of the Animal Realm, Lady Ganyu? You look a little too… soft to be yakuza, but I suppose even mobsters need bookkeepers.
From my understanding, Princess Turandot, if I am able to complete your “Dungeon of Death” I get to bed you? Wonderful! I shall like to try as soon as this game finishes.
I always relish meeting a fellow immortal hermit, Lady Cagliostro. Is that the body you have crafted for yourself? It’s not bad at all.
That’s strange. I hypothesized that the magic of the Inventory would translate our words for us as we spoke them… yet I don’t understand a single thing Miss Gloria has said.
Are you cooped up in your castle all day, Lady Kumatora? You must crave excitement. Should you take my hand in marriage, I can guarantee you an unceasing life of passion.
Princess Turandot, I know I haven’t completed the trivial formality of passing through your dungeon, but I should ask now: what brings you the most pleasure in bed?
You seem as much a natural born leader as I, Lady Monika. Once your young studies are over, what sort of position would you seek out?
Lady Kora, I’ve been thinking. Without a doubt, I’d be an excellent driver. Which manner of “Blade” do you think would suit me best?
I must commend you for choosing the path of an archeologist, Lady Nico. There’s so much the past can inform us about the future.
Are you all right, Miss Kagamine? Your voice sounds odd. Perhaps you are in need of some tea to clear your throat?
I’m ecstatic to meet a fellow poet, Miss Mitama. I too am an accomplished author, not that I’d dare bore you by reciting my works. Unless you were to insist…
