I’m observant enough to know when I’m being observed, Lady Kirigiri. No matter, I love encouraging others’ curiosity. Though may I ask why you’re so keen to study us?
Forgive me if I seem prying, Lady Kora, but you and your driver— Lady Nia, was it? Are the two of you committed, ah, romantically?
Learning from the past makes no difference unless one puts it into practice in the present. I have a wealth of experience, Lady Nico, and I’d love to teach you.
Excuse me, Miss, erm, Sempai. What sort of magic do you study? I myself am a practitioner of Taoist sorcery.
Miss Kyouko, was it? in some ways, your desires are kin to my own. You certainly enjoy the finer things in life, yes?
Mitama, as a woman of the cloth it might interest you to know that I am regarded as a saint. Perhaps you’d be interested in worshipping me?
It’s wonderful how you clearly take care of your body, Miss Nagatoro. Healthy citizens mean a healthy state. What manner of athletics do you pursue?
Miss Suzuya, was it? Somehow I got the idea in my head that you were a member of the Japanese Navy, but you certainly don’t seem… militaristic.
So, Miss Kyouko. We talked of the luxury of having a gorgeous woman by your side. Do you have a paramour of your own, then?
Dame Arle, you have the appearance of a dashing knight. Are you the hero of some far-off kingdom?
Duchess Sweetheart, not to overstep my boundaries, but don’t you worry you come off as a wee bit narcissistic? A true noble must show restraint and dignity.
Ninja Lady Yae, was it? Were you sent here to eliminate me? I’m sure you could get me quite vulnerable.
It seems your church did not guide you for victory, nekomata.
I don't know if humans can join your church, but clearly, they shouldn't.
I’d try to recruit you nekomata, but I’m more interested in humans.
A nun could never match a saint.
A clown, eh? I’ve heard of stories of the havoc and terror they sow.
Hello person I know not. Let's not speak of this again.
By the way, if you recognize me it’s because you mistook me for another gorgeous, wise, and powerful Taoist leader.
You know ~name~… your dark aura reminds me of someone…
I know! You’re ~name~, correct? From the "Electronic Game" that Sumireko girl was talking about?
So ~name~, you’re from the land where the sun sets? I’m from the land where the sun rises. It’s the better one.
Something about this one seems familiar… though I don’t recognize their desires…

condition.saying: That was my anime villain laugh

case.state: My apologies, Young Nanoko, but I can only rate that laugh at a 4.5. You’re neglecting the importance of body language in both underscoring and projecting the laugh.
Four of a Kind? Wow! I'm as great as I think I am!
It seems I am ever destined for victory.
That could have been close. For someone else.
Excellent. For the sake of those who admire me, I cannot lose.
Come, worship me!
I suppose I should be thankful no one in the royal court asked this of me, lest my true sex be exposed.
Off with her clothes!
Well? You mustn't keep a regent waiting.
Oh my, and someone here was desiring to see you strip. Other than me, of course.
My, my. It seems ~player~ and I have the same desires regarding ~name~.
Most fights I've been in ended with clothing damage. This doesn't seem much different.
I hope you know I'm not using my Hermit Arts to cheat. You're losing the old fashioned way.
Though I'm sure I could develop a Hermit spell to see through clothes, this method seems... sexier.
Usually it's rude to greet royalty in your skivvies, but I'll let it slide this once.
What clothes do you desire least, Lady ~name~?
Perhaps we should form a consensus about what you must take off next?
Good, this should be pleasing to the eye.
It is Lady ~Name~'s loss.
Ah, what lovely armor you have, Lady ~name~. Obviously, it would serve no purpose would you to go against me in battle, but it looks most dazzling on you!
It looks like you came prepared for a fight, Lady ~name~. Too bad you ended up matched against the Shoutoku Taoist.
Surely you aren’t going to be so terrible as to strip your cape, Lady ~name~?
Oh, in appears we have a Nekomata, a type of feline youkai, with us today. Well, a cat is fine too.
You seem popular, Lady ~name~. Perhaps I, as the one who established the modern Japanese Empire, could give you tips on how to handle renown.
Just so you know, Lady ~name~, I can tell you’re cheating. But I shall allow it to pass, in order to give myself a handicap. I still expect to win.
You seem to be enjoying yourself, Lady ~name~. How wonderful! It’s good to see others having fun.
Oh, you’re a goddess? You and every other jill in Gensokyo. But tell me, Miss ~name~. Who here will actually look after the humans? It’s me.
You’ve drinks? Is it a party? I would have brought sake had I known.
The way you’re downing that libation reminds me of… everyone.
You know, Byakuren doesn’t drink. But all the disciples at her temple sneak libations when she isn’t looking. Isn’t that sad?
Aah, booze. The engine of Gensokyo.
I must say, your wardrobe is exquisite. Now take it all off.
Did you dress up for the occasion, Lady ~name~? I wish I did too. These paltry garments of mine are only suited for casual adventures.
I don’t see how you can be so apathetic to our proceedings, Lady ~name~, when someone as spectacular as myself is here tonight.
Are you Japanese, ~name~? Then you must know I, Prince Shoutoku. In fact, I kind of invented Japan.
By the way, I'm glad to see my country continues to thrive a millenia after I left.
On the outside where as much as 1400 years have passed, do the people still speak rightly of my exploits?
Aren’t you the sourpuss, Lady ~name~? Do you really think your words sting? Compared to Reimu, you’re downright supportive.
Aren’t you the cutest, Lady ~name~? You remind me of my Kokoro and her friends. Should… we really be getting naked together?
So you are a musician, Lady ~name~? How would you like to perform on my concert stage? That sort of steady activity is how you gather patrons.
It's now or never, so you've got make your decision.
From one royal to another, I respect your resolve, Princess ~name~.
So Princess ~name~, are you the kind of princess who disguises herself as a man and rules their country with wisdom and splendor? Or some other kind?
You handle losing with dignity and grace, Princess.
Princess ~name~, how would you like to unite our two lands? First I need to have a daughter though, for you to marry.
You're quite lovely, Prince ~name~.
Have you ever dreamed of meeting a handsome prince, Lady ~name~?
I wish you would say more, Lady ~name~. Truth be told, I’m not a mind reader. Just gifted enough to be able to deduce everything I need to through hearing.
You’re clearly a sort of youkai, Lady ~name~. I detect metallic elements to your body. Are you a Tsukumogami of a tin can or axe?
Lady ~name~, forgive me but you do realize the titillation of Strip Poker comes from watching others slowly disrobe, yes? It rather defeats the purpose if you come dressed like… that.
Oh, are you coming on to me, Lady ~name~? I cannot blame you. Very well, I shall allow myself to be seduced.
My my, Lady ~name~, you’re so serious all the time. You’ll never get anywhere if you don’t learn to lighten up, you know?
Though it appears you have passed from this world, Lady ~name~, your beauty has not passed from you. Say, can you turn corporeal?
You look good… for a jiang-shi. Yes, you can’t fool me, Lady ~name~. Fortunately, living with Yoshika, I am used to such things.
Oh, you hold that object of the newspaper tengu, Lady ~name~. A camera, was it? Feel free to get my best side.
That little stick you have there… is that supposed to be a magical item, Lady ~name~? It doesn’t seem too impressive. Unlike Reimu’s stick.
So… are you a good witch, or a Buddhist witch?
Witch girl! You had better not steal my garments after the game!
It seems you could not "steal" victory, witch.
The last witch I played poker with stole my clothes. It wasn’t even strip poker, and I was wearing them at the time!
Oho, you have a sharp tongue, Lady ~name~. You’d be able to match wits with any in Gensokyo!
Surely you were not fighting seriously, I hope.
I was hoping it would be ~name~. Or anyone, really.
Show us something good!
Show some skin! Make this exciting!
Let's see some of your best attributes.
Tojiko, turn around! ~name~'s about to show some skin!
Please take pity on this poor, immortal, sexually-active monarch.
Oh, this is about to get even better.
Noooo! Somebody save the beer!
This was to be the moment of truth! I demand a do over!
I shall best others, or else be bested myself. I have no need to be dealt a stalemate. It just seems so boring!
If I am to be the hope of humanity, I cannot be wasting my time with such meaningless stalemates! Plus, I had a good hand.
It seems without me in the game, the others are unable to distinguish themselves.
For instance, I can tell Palutena wants Pit to give her chest a hearty massage.
Gensokyo’s youkai of darkness could eat her whole, and she’s probably eight years-old.
Nevermind the cards and the clothes then— tell me at once how I can ascend to the Celestial Realm!
Although… from what I understood, these things required a driver, did they not?
All right, ~Player~, I can see you hold no respect for me.
You ask “Who the Hell” you are, yet without the power of listening to one’s desires, I would not know you.
Agreed Mr. Link. And a “Hi-yah, wah” to you too!
And it seems you and I are alike in another way.
I too have a daughter, Hata no Kokoro. Often I worry over her, but we all must give children space to become what they will, no?
Ah, I understand, you are the heir to a particularly wealthy merchant-class family. I suppose without a strong central monarchy, merchants would emerge as the country’s de-facto ruling class.

I have a “daughter” of my own, but she is far too young to wed. She wouldn’t even be allowed in a place like this!
{small}And if anyone tried to bring her I’d have them slain on the spot.
This a perfect solution! You merely have to marry my mother-in-law! Don’t worry, she’s not some aged crone— she was reborn as a hermit with a new, barely-legal body!
Ah, I understand. You are the leader of a band of ruffians. Well, I suppose not everyone is suited for law and order.
There’s no use posturing in front of me, Sir Guzma. My hearing is such that from a single remark from you I can discern all there is to know about you.
You are a sort of wolf youkai, Lord Dust? I remember hearing about a Loup-Garou around the Misty Lake, though I’m certain that was someone different.
Well met then, sir. I did not expect to find a fellow hermit here.
Bwahaha! No one but I could ever have the cunning to rule over my country disguised as a man!
A “rocket launcher”? I take it to be comparable to young witch Marisa’s Mini-Hakkero then, a power source for your bombs.
What a strange device. I don’t quite understand how this is supposed to function as a bomb.
You seem to be one of those “Salt of the Earth” types, Sir Raynor. Just the sort of subject a Crown Prince would do well to familiarize herself with.
This Mengsk sounds like one of the vile warlords who ruled my country of Japan before the land was united under my Seventeen Article Constitution.
That’s quite the odd costume you have there, Sir Black Cat. In Gensokyo, Kasha and Nekomata youkai disguise themselves as human, but I’ve never seen the opposite.
Ah, farming. how quintessentially provincial. Yet I suppose that life is now forever closed to you after what you’ve been through. You’ve managed to attain a greatness beyond your station.
Your words are the height of hypocrisy, Mister Colt. Mired in pride as you are, you don’t realize how laughably conceited you appear!
Lord Bobobo, is the reason you are so devoted to your necklace because, as a hermit, you’ve transformed the original into an immortal body as I did with my sword Shichi-Sei Ken?
It seems bad enough to not know where your men are, let alone when. How did you end up outside your era— unprepared, clearly, Private Hijiyama.
This “Fist of the Nose Hair” is a particularly arcane hermit art. There’s little benefit should I reverse engineer it, seeing as I only have hair on my head… and, er, nethers.
…Mickey? Well, in any case, I don’t think I could duplicate your underwear tactics. Tojiko would get mad at me if I were to steal her panties, and I don’t believe Futo wears any.
Ah, so you are a frontline fighter, Private Hijiyama? That takes courage. For what reason are you so willing to put your life on the line?
Women are like quicksand, Mister Colt. The harder you thrash, the deeper in you get. Except the opposite, because being deep in a woman is good. In any case, you need to relax.
Extrication it is then. Are you brining your minion directly in to battle, Lord Bobobo? I’m confident my Tojiko would prevail, were I to send her out.
Ah, so wealth there is determined by one’s ability to exterminate youkai? Interesting. That poor Hakurei shrine maiden, she was simply born into the wrong world.
That is in fact something you can remove, yes.
Are you really about to take off your ~clothing~?
Might as well get the inconsequential things out of the way.
Take off whatever you want— you will lose in the end.
~clothing.ifPlural(Those ~clothing~|That ~clothing~)~ better be part of your shirt somehow!
You'll never become a hermit by using such half-measures.
You are in the presence of royalty. Impress me!
I’m not going to say anything and attempt to make this the least amount of awkward possible.
Juuust kidding!
Gensokyo is full of minor gods. Of course, it has only one Almighty Taoist who Controls the Cosmos.
I tried to ask that Celestial Tenshi back home, but it’s hard to drag an answer out of that brat.
Oh, I see. It’s simply your run of the mill demonic possession. Very well, carry on then.
Come, Tojiko. Let us return to Gensokyo.
I don’t begrudge the youth to try to “Fight the Power.” But often, humans need the power of a gifted (and charismatic) leader.
Sir Kira, I think it goes without saying: you will not be acting upon your desires here.
Well, she’s a collection of Masks I designed, becoming a youkai with a human appearance after being forgotten for centuries. Perhaps a bit complicated for you to understand.
Worshipping of money is but empty idolatry, though I suppose you wouldn’t understand. Tell me, what good will your mountain of gold be on the day your mortality wins out?
And waiting for Dear Young Kokoro to become of age may take the better part of a century due to youkai age curves. I doubt you’d wish to wait so long, The Lord Chazz.
I assure you, The Lord Chazz, you’ll like Futo. She’s… earnest, and, um… good at breaking plates!
So long as your brigands do not make trouble for peaceful citizens, I see no reason why we cannot enjoy one another’s company, Sir Guzma.
Your kind heart shames that of the insincere Buddhist nun. It’s even refreshing, considering the cheating jerks who fill most of Gensokyo.
Perhaps you are not yet strong enough a youkai to transform into a fully human form? Nonetheless, I will expect you to behave in human company lest you face my wrath.
There is no need for modesty among your fellows, Arash. In life I was Crown Prince Shoutoku, Regent of Japan, but was resurrected in a new form as a saint.
Bwahaha! But of course! Inspired by my brilliance, women upon women would rule over their country disguised as a man!
Still, one cannot survive only trying to bomb through all your opponents’ attacks. Even Marisa, of all people, has other tricks up her sleeves.
Did your tool gain a rebellious mind of its own? Something similar happened with young Marisa’s Mini-Hakkero.
Sadly, in my era it wasn't expected a woman would be able to handle the affairs of a nation. But with a little Taoist magic here and there, I appeared as man before my loyal subjects.
If ever you need someone to advise you on administrating your Dominion, I would be more than happy to assist. Otherwise, I wish you the best.
Hmm… though your magic is not an innate skill, it doesn’t seem as if you’re being controlled either. Forgive me, Sir Black Cat, but I’d like to study you further.
It does me well to see a commoner like you attain a great rank, Sir Raynor. Though I was born great, I must remember that greatness can come from anywhere.
You need to learn, Mister Colt, what true charisma is, how to show real beauty, and most of all, how to be humble. Fortunately for you, there is no better teacher on Earth than I!
Oh, um… I think… I’m pleased to meet you, Lord Patch. Is this… person your husband, Lord Bobobo?
Ah, I suppose not. Well, I feel like there is much I can learn from you, Lord Bobobo, so I shall continue to study you.
Ah! A brilliant move, Lord Bobobo! How could I match that? I know— I’ll bring along Futo next time, and have her strip for me!
So I suppose that makes you AWOL, Private Hijiyama? Not that it would matter to me. You must have some powerful friends if they can manipulate the flow of time.
The sort of noble answer I’d expect from a soldier, Private Hijiyama. Yet who you love seems to be your greatest inspiration. It’s the same for most. Tell me of him.
Now that you are relaxed and confident, you must wow your paramour with your sophistication. Talk of important things, such as fine saké, national politics, and alchemy.
Lord Bobobo, having minions is all well and good, but you can’t have slaves in this day and age! It’s simply not done!
So Magicians are well regarded in Neo Yokio. Though as a Taoist Sorcerer, I would be an aristocrat even if I was not already an aristocrat by virtue of being an aristocrat.
Oh, my apologies. My mind seems to have wandered there.
Chip away at the smallest pieces and the largest will fall in time. A great general such as I knows this much.
Not all of us are going to live forever! I will, but the others might not.
The only thing with real value is speed.
Well, I suppose you had to remove your ~clothing~ eventually.
Your ~clothing~ won’t be the last garment you lose. I guarantee it.
I wonder if I could gather more faith wearing something like that.
You wouldn’t last long in politics if you always dragged your feet so. Be bold!
Oh. That’s actually it.
Might as well get trinkets like your ~clothing~ out of the way early.
Better than if you removed your ~clothing~ while I was standing nude.
Oh, are you so old you have no hair left to lose, Lord ~name~? I jest, I jest. Of course, if you did wish your hair to return, I’m sure I could concoct a Taoist spell.
Buddhist monks often shave their heads. But of course, such worthless creatures would never partake in jollity such as this, right Lord ~name~?
Black hair like you have, Lord ~name~, is common in Japan. Though the denizens of the Land of Illusion, Gensokyo, have such a myriad of hair colors.
With fine-looking black hair such as yours, Lord ~name~, you could easily fit the mold of a classic Japanese gentleman.
Blonde hair such as that on a man feels most aristocratic, Lord ~name~. Indeed, shades that pure cannot be obtained except through centuries of inbreeding!
Pure blonde hair such as yours, Lord ~name~, feels most regal. I almost want to marry one of my daughters off to yours!
Lord ~name~, would you happen to be related to an ill-disciplined Celestial whelp called Tenshi? I ask only because your hair is similar.
Your hair is a lovely shade of cobalt, Lord ~name~. Not at all like that atrocious shade of blue of that sycophant lackey of Byakuren’s.
I suppose it helped when I had to disguise myself as a man in Sixth Century Japan to have brown hair. Imagine if my hair were pink!
What an exquisite shade of brown you hair is, Lord ~name~. Only we refined few understand the simple beauty of the amber color.
With red hair like that, Lord ~name~, one might think you to be one of the helper demons in the Scarlet Devil Mansion’s great library.
Lord ~name~, I’ve seen hair like yours before… in Hell! It belonged to a friendly catgirl named Orin.
I admit I rarely find myself being taken by men, but you are most dapper, Lord ~name~. If I may, your hair is most striking.
I don’t mean to be soliciting you, Lord ~name~, but may I state your hair is most alluring. You must take great care in it.
Lord ~name~, It’s odd to see men with… salmon colored hair. I’d wonder if you were related to my fellow hermit, Ibaraki Kasen, but you definitely aren’t an oni.
I’ve never seen a man with rose-colored hair, Lord ~name~. Everyone I know with that shade is a girl. Though, most people I know are girls, to be honest.
Deep Purple is an excellent shade for the garments of those who rank highest and display Greater Virtue on the Twelve Level Cap and Rank system, but on hair it just looks gross.
Lord ~name~, were your hair to grow out, would you end up with blonde tips? No of course not, you’d never have such ghastly coloration.
I’ve not seen a man with hair so long as yours in a while, Lord ~name~. It’s even longer than that of the irksome poverty goddess, who I doubt can afford a haircut.
Your magnificently long hair reminds me of that immortal phoenix girl from the Bamboo Forest, Lord ~name~. Though, I think she simply neglects grooming. Well, she is immortal, after all.
They say women are most enamored with the “White-Haired Pretty Boy” in the outside world, Lord ~name~. Though, few in Gensokyo seem interested in the shopkeeper of Kourindou.
Lord ~name~, I hope this little game isn’t putting too much strain on you. After all, you wouldn’t want to find any grey hairs later.
Did you say Miko Day!?
One royal can easily recognize another, though we may be separate species. There’s something about you which none of our table mates possess.
As the leader of Gensokyo’s humans, I apologize on behalf of this ill-bred cur who would raise not a hand to assist those of a higher rank.
Miss Monika, is Natsuki the Futo of your group? She's very small.
I must say, your new body is quite the upgrade.
No… no wait. Though you live in a big house with a bunch of weirdos, I don’t sense you have a sister. You cannot be the Scarlet Devil.
She ran off!
I understand your penchant for destructive magic, even if you are far from mastering it. However, such spells are but matchplay compared to the arts of a Hermit Master.
Be careful, fellow card-players! Oni are known to trick humans into drinking games, and abduct the losers.
Though your spells are crude, I see the potential in you for greatness.
Those are wonderful pursuits. I too was interested in the same things at your age!
What? No! You’ve already removed your undergarments! That can’t be allowed, can it?
Oh, is that girl a friend of yours, Agent Cammy?
Oh, hello ladies. I’m sure Agent Cammy was just about to introduce you.
A pity about your sword, but even if we were to match blades, you couldn’t possibly hope to complete with my Seven-Star Sword.
A pity you most clearly are not human— you might end up my opponent. You’re a Sarugami, a monkey youkai, at a guess.
I... oh my. I see.
Ah, L— Lady Chihiro. All can see your bloomers on display!
With a physique such as that, you certainly prove you can handle the physical aspects of taoist hermit training.
You see, Professor Croix, the world would not be ready for more than one Almighty Taoist who Controls the Cosmos.
Magic Tonics? Well, I understand the concept of emotion-based spells, yes.
I myself am driven to nothing but victory, not in races of the feet, but in battles of politics and war.
Many in Gensokyo hold disabilities. I’ve heard the Secret God Matara Okina uses a wheelchair much of the time.
Do you know how much sugar can sneak into your diet? Those “French-Fried Potatoes” of yours actually have nearly half a gram of sugar. And that’s without ketchup!
I need not judge methods if they get results. I only desire that you are able to bring all those who challenge my reign to heel.
Ah, your appearance isn’t due to getting between my underling and a flammable Buddhist temple? I mean, er, nevermind.
In my day noble swords such as my Shichi-Sei Ken were honored with illustrious names. It seems the firearms of the outside world deserve no such prestige.
To be sure you’re not an ally of the Buddhists, I shall listen to your desires!
Though I sense in you the ability to manipulate other elements: Earth, Wind, and Fire.
I can feel within you a desire to hide something. But what is it, I wonder...
I must say, you’re far more mature than any fairy I’ve yet met.
What a magnificent scepter! Truly befitting my Daughter-in-Law to be! I… think it’s broken, though.
Akko? Ah, I see, a fellow acolyte of your magic most noble (and not taught by Byakuren).
I’ll teach you to enslave the elements, control the cosmos, even thwart death itself.
And it seems you and I are alike in another way.
Not a bad blade. Not as good as mine of course, but good none the less.
You thought that frizzing your hair to hide your horns and tanning your skin would allow your stench to slip by I, the Taoist Prince with unparalleled powers of perception, and…. umm…
Greetings, Lady Monika. Tell me everything about yourself.
…Um, Young Moon? Earth to Moon?
No, no, I won’t spoil it for the others. But from one who enjoys similar garb for similar reasons, well done.
Even if your jian doesn’t hold a candle to my legendary Seven-Star Sword, I’m sure it has value to you all the same.
Miss Nami. Though I am adorned in all manner of expensive ornamentation, you would do well not to lay a finger on my sword. If you were to, I, um….
Oh, Miss Nami. You dropped your wanted poster.
Are you a fairy of some sort, Miss Natsuki?
Oddly, I feel within you vague equine inclination. I could see you being some sort of horse-deer.
Or perhaps being a horse demon from Hell, you have no concept of human stripping norms?
I must heap praise upon your noble and illustrious young mistress. She has earned my esteem, which I can say of few others.
Though you don’t yet desire to threaten me, let me give you a word of advice. I dodge bullets as a hobby.
I don't see the appeal in such ugly toys— especially when spellcards produce such beautiful danmaku.
Though I don’t feel as if you hold the power of the Immortal Phoenix on your side. A pale imitation, then.
Do you have your servants undress you as well? Well done, Lady Ryuko.
You are a strong warrior, Young Ryuko, but you sadly lack discipline. How about I train you in the Taoist Arts, and have you serve as a knight under— oh dear.
Saki, embrace Taoism and you will never want for friends. Also you’ll be immortal.
You may be able to fistfight a man, but you cannot fistfight an army. To rule is to invite enemies. What then, Miss Nikaidou?
Jiang-Shi Number One, as you are called. I wish to meet your master. I can tell he and I are much alike, enlightened beings who shy not away from the arts most arcane!
In my home of Gensokyo, there exists a terrible witch called Byakuren, who seeks to proselytize for her mediocre religion!
Oh, the boat tsukumogami recognizes my greatness? Perhaps I could find use for you after all!
Well, I suppose taking bullets comes with the territory.
I didn’t think your ~clothing~ would be part of your hitbox.
You may continue to get blown up in my stead.
Well, nonetheless, as a notable personage in Gensokyo, the Land of Illusion, I am used to being hounded by those who would seek my inner thoughts.
You seem like you could hold your own against even the eternally inebriated Oni of the underground. Either drinking, or fighting.
Oh, uh… ribbon? Sure, whatever. Go ahead.
Take off whatever you please, Princess Twilight. I don’t think it matters.
You’ve been displaying something warmer and softer for a while now, princess.
However, I hate to be ostentatious. Please Lady Zizou, refer to me merely as Miko
But I suppose a goddess, sitting all high and mighty above the world, would never understand a creature who had to work tirelessly for their radiance!
I don’t know you… and I don’t know why I feel this way…
I’m afraid I don’t understand. Clearly you have terrible troubles performing everyday tasks. You cannot even remove your tie by yourself.
You seem to be new to all this, Princess. Both to card games as well as to public exposure. Well, the second one is new to me also.
Even though you have been bested at this moment, do not be afraid to seize the spotlight for yourself! A failure is only such if you allow it to be!
Ah, so the land of Tamaran is beyond the terrestrial plane. Similar to the Lunar Capital, or Makai.
A land-uniting prince of legend, I secretly studied the Taoist Arts and transferred my soul to a legendary sword, resurrecting in the Land of Illusion as an immortal Saint!
The thieving, short-statured witch I mentioned earlier loves to fire off lasers as much as you adore explosions. Not maliciously even, just as a lark.
Quite an impressive disguise. Someone with no training would think you simply an insect, and those with lesser abilities would see a butterfly fairy or youkai.
I sense no malice from you, Lady Yuelia, but let me make my stance on the matter clear. An ambitious human can come to understand the universe and surpass the gods.
One wishes the other religious leaders of Gensokyo were as rational as you. Though I respect my rivals, that lot has a habit of being very stubborn. At this point, our bickering is almost familial…
If you are indeed a Yuki-onna, this is simultaneously the best and worst disguise I’ve ever seen.
Should you attempt to devour any of the humans here, I would be happy to dramatically obliterate you, so I might gather the the— what did young Sumireko call it? Ah yes, The Clout.
One moment… you’re not planning on eating your partner after your fornication, are you?
Now that we’re understood on that front, Arch-Wizard Megumin, it is an honor to make your acquaintance.
That is odd. I’ve grown accustomed to Gensokyo’s magical beings as my bedfellows. All the humans I know are magicians and shrine maidens.
Perhaps this is a good idea to get to understand the common people better. To understand their hopes and concerns, so I might yet further improve myself as a leader.
Never mind such a silly little thing, Miss Azami. You’re quite lovely.
It would be nice, given the opportunity, to pick your brain. You know Gensokyo as well as anyone, and such insights could help me to gather followers.
To clarify, you are a former member of 9 “idols of music” known as The Muse? Have you been sent here by the Goddess of Hell, Hecatia Lapislazuli?
Kokoro is a menreiki, a youkai born from a collection of masks I crafted. She does not yet know how to express her emotions with her face, instead relying on her masks.
Were you to utter even a sentence, I could hear every desire in your heart, and from that flawless deduce your past, present, and future!
I am not callous. I aim to ensure the wellbeing of all my countrymen, even those far, far, far, far below my station.
I am the Almighty and Humanitarian Taoist, but can I dare call myself such a thing if I have not the audacity to tackle as monumental a disaster as this pathetic creature?
Have you not heard of me, Lady Shamir? Through military strength and political maneuvering, I united Japan into one empire.
A “Tea Doll”? Are you akin to that poisonous doll youkai I’ve heard about? No, you’re more like the haniwa used by the sculptor god.
In any case, Miss Cujoh, I can tell you have the tremendous power necessary to wield your living weapon. “Stone Free” is what it is called?
I suppose the box is… a way to attempt to eavesdrop undetected.
I’ve encountered many youkai in Gensokyo who are statues given life. Even Young Maiden Reimu’s pet Komainu was once a simple decoration.
My consort, Soga no Tojiko, came back as a vengeful spirit due to a botched attempt to reincarnate as an immortal hermit. As you can imagine, I am deeply familiar with your kind.
Tell me, what grudge powers your tether to this mortal world long after your untimely end?
You say you came here to acquire “shares”? Is that your word for Faith, Lady Neptune?
However, the true power of the shrine derives from another goddess, Suwako. Unlike Kanako, Suwako has a build almost identical to yours, Lady Neptune.
If you lack direction and camaraderie, Lady Yunyun, you would do well to join up with my Taoist clan. Find purpose in becoming my follower.
The Crimson Demon Clan? So there are more witches like yourself? You nearly rival young witch Marisa in terms of skill.
You would get a wife of your very own, and I would gain your Crimson Demon Clan as an powerful ally to my Toaist Clan. No one in Gensokyo could stand up to us!
I was once an influential leader of my nation, ushering in reforms that made it the proud state it is today. My mastery of politics, art, and warfare may still be unrivaled to this day.
Also, I can tell by your name. Yuri. You are, without a doubt, a fellow woman of culture!
I can tell that, unlike your attire, your magic is no laughing matter, Lady Ladybug. Speed, strength, agility, object creation, even the ability to heal spacetime.

Pulchritude is not something bought in stores, Lady Perona. It is the combination of one’s come\li\ness, ele\gance, de\meanor. A char\is\matic aura such that I oft have to turn away an over\abun\dance of visitors to my dojo
I see. From what I gather, you are a type of youkai exterminator, are you not? The exterminators of Gensokyo could learn a thing or two about conditioning from you.
A dark aura surrounds you, Lady Nagisa. Yet, at the center, a divine blessing shines. It rivals even the fortune of the Shine Maiden of Paradise.
I honestly can’t claim to know the details, Lady Nagisa, but your sire made a wish for you to live despite your dark fate. A wish which was granted by a god.
Hm, it seems as if Western magicians are a “type”. I suppose your belief is that magic is all about power, Lady Luxanna?
Proud as I am of my Seventeen-Article Constitution, I must admit that it was largely just the common sense of old. In the end, laws are simply a method to enacting one’s ideal society.
There’s no need to stand on pretense here, Lady Ayano. Though I may have my own commitments, we share the same… determination.
Lady Luxanna, if your magic is as volatile as you say, you are in desperate need of a teacher. You’re undoubtedly gifted, but such strength needs to be honed.
I see, Miss Amy Rose. Though you were once a shrew, and sport animal ears, I should assume you not to be a youkai. I don’t know who you think you’re fooling, but it isn’t the Shoutoku Taoist.
You’re in need of a teacher to guide you, Lady Stella. Please allow me to invite you to my dojo. You are sure to master yourself studying under the Almighty Taoist who Controls the Cosmos.
It’s embarrassing to admit, but busy as I am I always need to be tended to by others. Those to prepare my meals, and give me back rubs, and prevent Lady Futo from burning down temples.
If personal experience drives your work, Lady Yuri, then the only way to expand your repertoire is through adventurous living. Perhaps you would be interested in some artistic experimentation?
Yes, yes, do be sure to take notes, Miss Wikipe, this is the truth. I rode around on a pegasus named Kurokoma, wielded a legendary sword, and secretly became an immortal Taoist Saint.
I respect someone so open in their desires, Lady Fina. If you feel yourself to be inexperienced in matters of a sexual nature, I would be willing to serve as teacher.

You’ve an interesting situation, Lady Fina. How about this: you invite your beloved to an intimate dinner for two, providing the finest liquor in the land. Then you retire to your room to talk at length about yourself.
Even if this game is meant to be somewhat, ahem, relaxed, would it trouble you were I to ask you some questions on alchemy? I had difficulty with my own pursuit of eternal life.
Ah, so much like me you see the big picture, Lady Sucrose. Of course, I was more pragmatic in my politics, but the intent was the same.
Sadly, because cinnabar and mercury work as well as they taste, I had to create a new body for me to inhabit, the immortal vessel you see before you. Ascension to Celestial is still far away.
How fortuitous, Lady Yuna. And Lady Megumi, you needn’t fear me. I have no desire to separate Lady Sachi and yourself. Quite the opposite, in fact, I’d prefer to have you together.
So to clarify, you desire to be a mercenary… who fights against mercenaries? Forgive me, but aren’t you simply extending the mercenary cycle of violence?
Simply here for a good bit of fun, then? I suppose I can’t impugn that. I hope you’re prepared for things to get steamy, though.
Well, I’m satisfied. Let’s arrange your marriage to one of my clan so that our houses may unite in power.
It is right for you to seek me out, Lady Hu. My knowledge of the hermetic arts affords me powers over the very cosmos themselves.
I take it a “Driver” is akin to a “master”? What makes one worthy of being a Driver? Or at least, your Driver specifically?
You needn’t shy away from your most human of desires, Princess. If you possess that which makes you a woman, then you too ache for satisfaction— satisfaction I can skillfully give.
Brains and beauty… quite the bombastic package. You know, I’m not only a medieval politician and prince, but a scholar as well. You’re surely brimming with curiosity over me.
Ah, but too much freedom would lead to degradation of the natural order and a weakening of the state. Oh, forgive me, little nun. I don’t mean to test your faith.

{Tojiko}Mitama, no!{!reset}
Ahem,
For the shrine maiden
Offer divine tithe to her
Holy of holies
Worry not, fellow players. I will protect you from her dark clown arts!
You are wicked to the core, filled with cruelty and deceit…
Oh-ho. Do you want to anger me?
Feel free to take off as much of your garb as you want.
You merely desire to remove your ~clothing~? I'm a bit disappointed.
Is that truly the best you can manage?
~Clothing~? Please reconsider your desires.
You've decided to take off your... ~clothing~? I didn't even notice ~clothing.ifPlural(those|it)~ before!
Your desires are... conventional. Too conventional.
Blue haired peasant child! Bow your head! Unlike the miserable vampires in your mansion, Lady Mavis Dracula here is true vampire nobility!
Fraudulent whelp who calls herself Scarlet! Apologize at once to the noble and illustrious Lady Mavis Dracula for theft of her birthright!
Not a bad start, Lady Korra! A few more centuries and you’ll be caught up to that mansion’s pet librarian!
I hope this simpleton next to us won’t spoil this sport between aristocrats of cardinal esteem, both of whom can track and verify their lineage.
Though Futo is actually the oldest of our group, her reincarnated body is short in stature.
Oh, but Sheena, you’re supposed to transfigure your old body into an inanimate object, like a sword. Silly girl.
You said your name was Mavis, yet you are the daughter of Dracula? I suppose that means the Scarlets’ pedigree is fraudulent. Oh well, for the sake of Young Flandre, I will keep quiet.
Please, don't force yourself Lady Florina.
But worry not, fellow humans. I will defend you by getting drunk in your stead. Praise me.
Young Kagari, why not leave those parlor tricks behind and study the divine magic of the Taoist arts?
I hope everyone knows my Taoist magic allowed me to see through that disguise!
If you ever want to further your education, feel free to visit me in my hermit realm. I could teach you all sorts of Taoist Arts!
It’s taken this long to get here, I wanted to see you gratify yourself!
Why hide that you’re some manner of bakeneko? Honestly, it’s not all that juicy a secret.
Please, Agent Cammy. It’s rude not to introduce your friends.
You defeated them too quickly, Agent Cammy. You need to take the time to enjoy your battles. Then enjoy a bottle of saké together afterwards.
Just so we’re clear, this is my normal attire.
Though you have the power to challenge the leaders of Gensokyo, your personality is closer to that of the detestable Amanojaku. For all our sakes, let us hope you do not cause any incidents.
Well, perchance I shall see how this develops for now.
If you ever desire to master the hermit arts and study under me, Lady Li, my dojo’s door is always open.
The cubes are, I’m guessing, familiars of some sort? As is the serving tray behind you.
As Crown Prince, Croix, my emotions are always in check. I hope I don’t spoil your science experiment.
My my! Despite your love of racing, you lack feet altogether? Are you even still alive?
Mental disabilities abound as well. My own cohort, Lady Seiga or Seiga Niang Niang is what you’d call a psychopath!
Why, just look upon me! I built this physique through careful attention to my diet and regular, appropriate exercise. And by creating a perfect immortal body.
Tell me Prosecutor, in the modern age, am I still allowed to arrest a monk for the crime of spreading Buddhism?
The dull, monochromatic bullets you spew forth could never match up to my vibrant and vivacious danmaku!
How odd. I feel sorrow… hate… drifting around a curve and gunning the engine in a sick Aston Martin DB5… vengeance…. Not the emotions I thought I’d find…
Not a bad start, Lady Korra! Soon you’ll have dominion over as many elements as I!
An extraordinarily low bar, I must admit.
You must heed the words of the Outside World’s wrights, who Young Sumireko oft quotes: “Have you tried turning it off, then turning it on once more?”
So Miss Lotte, what sort of magic is your forte? Elemental? Puppeteering? Laser beams?
Of course for the first hundred years I’ll just use you as my maidservant. The secret hermit arts come later.
Though not as utterly convincing as mine was, Princess Lucina, your Princely disguise serves its purpose.
I am my sword and my sword is I. Literally. That's why it's so grand.
Oh, my mistake Miss, you’re not Seija. Lady Borowski, was it? Very good, carry on.
Hmph, I see you are only concerned with blabbering on and drawing attention to yourself. I shall waste no more of my time with you.
And you’ve even got a sword! You’re like the Chinese knock-off version of myself!
Actually, I don’t know what would happen if someone stole my Shichi-Sei Ken. At the very least it would terribly inconvenience me, so for that reason you should not do it.
It was a mistake to think you could hide anything from the infallible ears of the Shoutoku Taoist, who can hear ten desires at once. Wait, why do you keep your own wanted poster around?
In Gensokyo there are girls many hundreds of years old who look like children. Are you like them, Natsuki?
Oh, of course, you must be Mezu, the horse-headed demon guard of Hell! Or perhaps his daughter?
No matter, this is all still good fun. Pinkie, daughter of Mezu, if the party you speak of has enough beer to get a horse drunk, I shall attend.
Yes, thank your charming Mistress Frandoodle, for being such a good friend to Kokoro and Koishi.
Yes, thank your Lady Furandoore for being such a good friend to my dear little Kokoro and the sweet maiden Koishi.
Now curvy lasers or clown moons… well, we won’t get into that.
Ah yes, we’re all so terrified of your metal sticks that only fire one tiny bullet at a time.
Considering the popular fashion in Gensokyo, their variations on such playthings would likely incorporate quite a few frills.
I suppose I could find use for you as a soldier in an army. But should you die, you’ll stay dead.
It appears your underling is undressing herself in solidarity. What a devoted servant.
You need not worry, Lady Ryuko. As a bonus for your services, I shall perform funerary rights for your fallen companion.
Yes, that settles it. You must join me at my dojo and study the Tao under me.
Speaking as the literal definition of a legend, you are right. True legends are forged through masterful manipulation of statecraft! Also, killing your enemies.
Later I can introduce you to Lady Seiga’s Yoshika. You two can run around in the park, or whatever it is jiang-shi do.
Lady Sayaka, together you and I could defeat this horrible witch, and steal her motorcycle for ourselves!
Alright shipgirl, your first order is such: ensure my victory even at the cost of your life!
So Young Streaming, feel free to ask me anything! Do not discourage yourself from prying into even my darkest secrets! Pay attention to me!
Though, I’d caution against challenging the “Shrine Maiden of Paradise.” She’s a meeeeeean drunk. And, always drunk.
I hate to say it… but I’m torn. She's a girl. But also a youkai. And a horse.
I promise you, no one is concerned about your legs.
That's not why everyone's staring at you.
Yes… what could you even do with fewer clothes?
Oh, what a precious little transformation spell! Or have you been practicing your butterfly effects to charm the noble Lady Yuyuko?
I’ll show you the majesty that humans can create! For I am Toyosatomimi no Miko, the greatest human of them all!
It appears your servant is undressing herself in solidarity. Tojiko could learn from such devotion.
It appears your wife is undressing herself in solidarity. Well, it can’t be helped.
But somehow, I feel a real dislike of and rivalry with you. So keep your distance, shipgirl!
I admit, I am of perfect health in mind, body, and soul. We are decidedly unlike. But I can’t imagine choosing to be crippled, were there an alternate.
Lady Estelle. I am both an experienced and— though it is a bit embarrassing to admit— tremendously successful ruler of my country. Should you have any questions, please allow me to impart my wisdom.
A defeat can be a springboard for far greater victories! Unless it’s a military defeat, in which case you’ll likely be killed.
You seem to possess the abilities one would to expect to find in Gensokyo— strength, flight, and the ability to fire danmaku. You could perhaps aid my cause, Princess.
I’m afraid I’m not familiar with the “Crimson Demon Clan.” Are they a faction within Gensokyo? I myself teach and guide a clan of Taoist devotees.
Arch-Wizard, I can teach you thaumaturgy and alchemy such that you can control the cosmos, enthrall the masses, and even surpass your own mortality!
I hold an ultimate Spell Card: Hermit Sign "Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun”! Is that not a spectacular name? Indeed, it is splendid!
It’s not dangerous to one such as I. But it grows tiresome quickly, being Master Sparked all the time.
But know you this, Lady Yuelia. I am one even the gods bow to. The Immortal Taoist hermit, the legend that shines before you, Toyosatomimi no Miko!
Humans need leaders to guide them towards a hope-filled future. Gods allow mankind to grow complacent and careless! I will be the one to usher humanity toward its true potential!
Your… sister? So, you have a twin sister?
Well, even if you were a Yuki-Onna, you wouldn’t pose much of a threat. There’s no harm in giving you the benefit of the doubt, Lady Schnee.
Though if you really are just here to get dirty with a human… well, I shan’t stop you.
Know this, Lady Amygdala. I have been central to stopping multiple incidents within Gensokyo, and… she’s not even listening to me. Ah well, her loss.
My interactions with the human village’s citizens are mostly limited to speeches and official business. Being with a… normal person in so intimate a setting is new to me.
Yes. Mmhmm. I see. Alright, I’m bored now. Thank you for your time, Young Nanoko.
My own consort has no legs, and is also a ghost. A scar hardly bothers me. Yes, boys. Quite.
Fascinating, I can’t read your desires at all. I suppose I should have expected as much from one of Gensokyo’s sages. I shan’t take you lightly, Lady Yakumo.
Your group merely named yourselves after the real Muses? I suppose that makes sense.
Do you think one day the Outside World would embrace, as an idol, a short, pink haired girl who can only express her feelings through emotive masks?
So please, Lady Komi, despite being in the presence of royalty, there is no reason to clam up. Simply say a word or two, and then you may return to being taciturn.
But ruminating on your desires, I feel there is little hope for you. I shan’t worry about gaining you as a follower. Good day, Miss Tomoko.
Miss Tomoko! Allow me to demonstrate my magnificence by converting even you into a functional human being!
Even if I am not your target today, I might well threaten your dominion in the future. You’d do well to listen to what I have to say.
Eh, a company? You mean to tell me there is an army’s worth of you Tea Dolls, Lady Florence?
Despite your innate power, you lack the skill to be truly exceptional. If you wish, I will gladly take you on as my student of the hermetic arts.
Or perhaps it’s a method to conceal your identity? Such things work not on a hermit— you can’t even conceal the loneliness in your heart. Good thing this game lets you meet new people, hmm?
The youkai I’ve met have skin more similar to a human’s. You must then be a young or inexperienced youkai, Lady Galatea.
I often refer to her as a ghost, as that is a term most people are familiar with. However, she is as corporeal as you— down to her kneecaps, at least.
What a tragic tale, Lady Chara. I suppose no vengeful spirit would have a story any more cheerful.
We religious leaders of Gensokyo must often compete for faith. Either through sermons, performances, or fisticuffs.
I wonder, is this a form taken to conserve power, or to hide it. Are you able to adopt a more striking form, Lady Neptune? I must study you further.
If you study well, you too may end up being nearly as beloved and charismatic as I. Though don’t expect such a change to occur overnight.
An entire village of powerful sorcerers? And you are the daughter of the chieftain? I see, I see… that’s very interesting.
How would you like to wed my underling, Lady Mononobe no Futo? She’s short, petite, and best described as a “destructive gremlin.” Seems like just the woman for you, Lady Yunyun!
That was 1400 years ago. After my apparent death, I became a Saint and resurrected as an immortal. I now lead my clan of Taoists in the land of Gensokyo.
Lady Yuri, I implore you to join me at my Taoist dojo. I could make much use of a woman with your… taste.
Yet, Lady Ladybug, I can also tell that this power is not your own. Please introduce me to your Master, would you? There are a great many things we have to talk about.
Oh, what a tale of tragedy, Lady Perona. I don’t know what I’d do were I separated from my loyal retainers— none of the others in Gensokyo seem remotely worthy.
You’re undoubtedly fetching, Lady Perona, but you are, dare I say, too cute. My authority shines clear, for I talk about what the people crave: government decorum and taxation policy!
Yet, I fear that neither you, nor the one who bestowed the blessing, understands its true nature or capabilities, Lady Nagisa. Nothing is more volatile than unknown divinity.
Without proper knowledge of the divine, Lady Nagisa, you are likely to inadvertently bequeath your blessing to another you love deeply. And then, the darkness shall have no impediment.
My apologies, Lady Pyrrha. I didn’t wish to assume you weren’t familiar with Japanese. Speaking of, from where derives your foreign vibrance?
I’m glad you seem more agreeable than that pilfering witch from my home, Lady Luxanna. You may make a great mage yet.
Indeed, Lady Ayano. You possess all the qualities necessary to be a successful politician!
Long dead rules do still influence the modern age, Lady Mia, yet I am anything but deceased myself. If you wished, perhaps we could discuss my legal legacy in a more private setting.
“Hide your light,” Lady Luxanna? Wouldn’t it be better to learn to bend light to your will? To harness your very radiance as the marksman wields his bow?
I’m glad to hear you shall accept, Lady Stella. Soon, your power will be honed into something even the gods couldn’t match!
I do know everything about everyone, Miss Amy Rose. I can hear humans' desires. To understand the ten desires of a human is to know them fully.
Feel free to pamper me if you feel the need, Miss Senko. You might start by fetching a flask of warm junmai daiginjo sake. No, on second thought, a cold glass of nigori sake.
Also, be sure to add how great I was at lesbian sex. My technique could surely melt even the most hardened woman. Be sure to liberally use the phrase “clitoris maestro”.
Lady Yuri, I’d love nothing more than for Tojiko to join us on our little adventure. The three of us together could provide a new experience even for me— why, we’d never run out of inspiration.
Odd how many seem to flee from their desires, Lady Fina. But never fear. I shall demystify the arts of sex and seduction— by demonstrating on you!
A question which has mystified me: my first attempts at im\mortality involved heavy ex\per\i\men\tation with cinnabar, yet that instead brought about my original body’s ruin. Would you know why?

But don’t forget the most im\port\ant part, Lady Fina! Your life’s story should so en\rapture your fair maiden Vyse that she will throw herself at you, and make love to you ’til dawn. It’s, um, never worked for me, though.
You needn’t apologize, Lady Sucrose. Only the spiteful denigrate such dreams as childish, while those who will inherit the Earth simply do what needs to be done.
I am powerful and un-aging, Lady Sucrose, but I am not impervious to damage. Were a shinigami to appear, I would be forced to fight it to avoid being dragged to the Netherworld.
If you would prefer I be blunt, Ladies Yuna, Sachi, and Megumi… I never was able to have a harem as a mortal. But in this day and age, I needn’t be deprived!
Ah, a president? I can respect such drive and ambition. Unrelated by the way, but have you ever done magic or been not human?
Lady Macneary, I understand your being shy. However, to be an effective queen, you need to be able to play politics. If I was on your side, you’d be running Fódlan in a fortnight.
Do you wish to study under me and surpass the weaknesses of humanity? With my knowledge, even you could obliterate the cruel maw of death!
How like a scientist to embrace experimentation. If you wish, I would love to impart all my well-tested knowledge to you.
I… see. Then, do you like your current Driver? If not, I may be able to offer you a place by my side… only if you want, of course.
Desires of the flesh exist for all humans, Princess. And, um… if you’re at this game, you’ve probably been feeling them. I myself have.
My best known work must surely be the Seventeen-Article Constitution, which governed my nation of Japan. One of the many reforms I introduced as crown prince and regent.
{Tojiko}Mitama, you’ve fallen into her trap. Now the Crown Prince is going to blabber on forever! And, yeah, basically every maiden.
That… wasn’t as bad as I anticipated. In any case, I’ve got my eye on you, clown.
I know! You remind me of my friend Seiga.
~clothing.ifPlural(Your ~clothing~ are so nice, ~name~, I might even wear them.|Your ~clothing~ is so nice, ~name~, I might even wear it.)~
I’ve worn down plenty of partisan stalwarts, so I can wear down you too!
As a politician, I understand even the best processes can take time. Still, hurry it up.
Let us reach an accord. I will allow you to take off your ~clothing~ for now, but next loss you must remove something bigger.
Though I hold the power of eternal life, even I don’t want to wait around forever.
Wa ha ha! You needn't mind, it doesn't bother me at all. Splendid!
All fall before me in the end. Your clothes will be no different.
You look even better without your ~clothing~.
Fair. It’s too early in the game to expect the best bits to be unveiled.
Ah well. In due time.
I still have many trinkets. Unsuprising you would have one or two as well.
In due time, we may both be denuded.
You don’t often see women with shaved heads. Except, of course, for Buddhist monks. Are you my enemy, Lady ~name~?
What lovely black hair you have, Lady ~name~. It reminds me of the princess of the Moon, Kaguya.
If I may, that is a beautiful shade of hair, Lady ~name~. Black is the quintessential color for a Japanese maiden. That said, my own wife’s hair is green.
Often you hear jokes about “dumb blondes,” Lady ~name~, however to me you seem of perfectly adequate intellect!
Though I am Japanese, I am quite used to blonde hair such as yours, Lady ~name~. We have many foreigners in Gensokyo, from both lands terrestrial and… other-dimensional.
Not to badger you, Lady ~name~, but your hair looks to be the same shade as Lady Seiga’s. I’m afraid that’s not as much a compliment as you would hope it to be.
The Kappa who built my headphones has blue hair like yours, Lady ~name~. Hopefully you won’t be as rambunctious.
Lady ~name~, I feel many do not grasp the beauty of brown hair’s simplicity, and how it allows one’s personality to shine. Only a vapid bore would possess gold and purple gradient hair!
Your hair is a gorgeous shade of brown, Lady ~name~. It’s almost the same shade as my own!
Lady ~name~, your hair has such a cute little swirl in it. Lady Seiga has the same! I shall keep my distance.
Oho, I’ve seen lovely orange locks like that before, Lady ~name~. Are you perhaps Chinese?
No offense, Lady ~name~, but you’re not quite what I’d consider a “red head”. I think that lebel better applies to the Goddess of Hell, Hecatia.
Lady ~name~, your hair is a simply marvelous shade of emerald. Would you mind terribly if I just… ran my fingers through it?
Your hair is so… green, Lady ~name~. I hope this isn’t too forward of me, but I find it quite fetching.
What lovely rose hair you have, Lady ~name~. It reminds me of my dear ward, a girl named Hata no Kokoro. I hope she is keeping well while I am away.
My apologies, Lady ~name~, I was just admiring your hair. It has the same sheen as the Ghost Princess of Hakugyokurou’s hair
I don’t mean to be rude, Lady ~name~, but have you considered dying your hair? You’d look so much nicer with a simple shade of brown or black.
Lady ~name~, you are so attractive, it seems a waste to keep such an atrocious hair color. After the game, let us get you a dye job at once!
What lovely, long hair you have, Lady ~name~. Eientei’s Moon Rabbit resident has such gorgeous long hair too. Must be hard to take care of, though.
I can’t imagine what goes into caring for hair as long as yours, Lady ~name~. I’m sure it must trouble your servants.
It seems white hair like yours, Lady ~name~, is the hallmark of a Lunarian. Lady Yagokoro has it, as does Lady Sagume… hmm, and Lady Sakuya as well. I wonder…
My comrade Futo possess white hair. Odd, since the body she created for herself is that of a young lady. And her mind too… perhaps she messed up?
I didn’t realize you still had that. Am I so far behind?
Look what ~name~ still has to take off, Crown Prince.
Ridiculous! Foolish! I have no words! I am truly disappointed in you, from the bottom of my heart!
That helps me little!
What a lovely necklace, Lady ~name~. I’d wear one of my own, but I feel I’d look to ostentatious.
If you’re in the market for a new pair of headphones, Lady ~name~, might I recommend the Kappa-built ones like mine? Of course, they don’t come cheap.
The Lord Chazz, please let me know if you need me to exterminate this werewolf for you. Otherwise, please enjoy your biting play with your boyfriend.
How about it? Come back to Gensokyo with me and join my Taoist sect.
You’ll pay for your misdeeds Hell Fairy! I will protect the humans of this world!
I can easily see the invisible, touch the untouchable, and break the unbreakable with my Taoist Arts. I could teach you, but I am also the power that you crusade against.
What’s the point of wrapping a sarashi if you wear not a shirt? You would make a poor samurai.
Too bad, it was a fine cape.
There’s no need to speak, Sir Link. For I can sense all the desires within your heart.
Or is “Dude” a term of respect in the modern age?
Finally! I was tired of looking upon his caped figure.
The Lord Chazz, were our families to intermarry, my clan could secure all our needed finances while yours would be afforded true noble lineage and access to fearsome Taoist Sorcery.
Your own Team Skull is much like my Taoist clan. I mean, no one would call my faction a “gang” because I am wealthy and good looking, but it functions much the same.
Looking closer… the sword is more than a common blade. I can recognize a legendary weapon when I see it, and yours almost compares to my own Shichi-Sei Ken.
Oh, so you can remove that thing. Sometimes I wonder about the denizens of Gensokyo.
Toiling as a mere soldier seems like such a waste for a noble hermit with your powers. Us saints should use our gifts to lead our lands to magnificence.
In mortal life my hearing was so acute I could listen to ten men at once. I’ve since learned to hear the desires in people’s speech, and determine their personality, motives, and identity.
I’ve never dealt with a war on the magnitude of yours, Sir Raynor. But, if it’s mortality you’re concerned with …I can help with that.
What I’m getting at, Sir Raynor, is that you could be a valuable teacher. Even if you die, your knowledge can live on and guide the people of your world.
Ha! A pathetic, gormless attempt! Do you think I won my Tojiko’s heart with such empty platitudes, Mister Colt? No! I wrote letters in perfect calligraphy, and recited poetry behind a folding screen!

Even if you are still a novice, Lord Victor, you are lucky to have met me. I so love the arts, I never hesitate to become someone’s patron. In fact, my mentor Seiga says I’m the most patronizing woman she’s ever met!

Oh, but I know so much more than your thoughts, Pri\vate Hi\ji\yama. With my super\human ears, I can hear the ten desires within your heart, and know your past, present, and future. Though, you’re not a difficult one to read.
Certainly you must feel pressured by your family to pursue certain relationships. Your hand in marriage would be quite the political tool.
~Clothing~. I can read your desires, I know it’s going to be your ~clothing~, let’s hurry it up.
~name~, I’ll trade you this Jeweled Pagoda I found if you take off something better.
Oh, are you losing, ~name~? I hadn’t noticed.
Seems you're doing as poorly as I expected if you're already losing your ~clothing~.
You desire removal of your ~clothing~? Funny, so does ~player~.
Might as well throw in the towel now. You can’t win against me.
Something of you reminds me of UFOs, Lord ~name~. And UFOs remind me of Buddhists. Watch your step.
You seem awfully feminine, yet I’ve come to realize you are decidedly male, Lord ~name~. That’s a bit disappointing to me, truthfully.
Forgive me, Lord ~name~, but your hair is awfully disheveled. Shouldn’t a gentlemen take more care in his looks?
I adore your hair, Lord ~name~. It has a sort of composed casualness to it. Though, fools would write it off as messy.
I don’t mean to pry, Lord ~name~, but would you tell us the story of how you got those scars? They remind me of the scars I’ve seen on the knights of long ago.
Oh, what a striking tattoo you have there, Lord ~name~. I think were I ever to get a tattoo, it would need a design as memorable as yours. Oh I know! A tattoo of my face would look so lovely!
Yes, yes, lovely ~clothing~ or whatever. Lord ~name~, did you really think a paltry disguise like that would make us think you were human? Look at your skin!
You want to do what to Zelda? Naughty!
Oh, and did I mention everyone in Gensokyo can fly on their own?
Hold on. You’re not Clownpiece. My mistake, carry on
I can tell you might one day make a worthwhile leader. After all, you wear a cape with such aplomb.
Really though, who gives speeches as they get naked?
By the way, who is "Zelda" and where did you learn of such acts?
If so, then please refer to me as Her Royal Dudeness.
Fear not, The Lord Chazz. Allied with our Clan, you need never worry about foolish Lady Nue’s ability to obfuscate objects.
Those comrades are our family. As Team Skull’s leader, I hope you never forget that.
A spirit inhabiting a legendary sword… I suppose it’s a little like me. No run-of-the-mill youkai would have such a possession. Perhaps I ought to reevaluate you, Lord Dust.
That hat in particular reminded me of… well, no one important. I’m not sad to see it go.
That is a problem with abilities one cannot turn off. I myself wear earmuffs much of the time. It helps quiet the din of voices.
Well, I suppose the politics that comes with governance isn’t for everyone. Better to spend your time in a king’s service than in wickedness like Lady Seiga.
Simple, Sir Raynor. You’ve proven yourself worthy to study the hermetic arts. Join me, and I will teach you how to defeat death itself.
You clearly have the knowledge for it, Sir Raynor. I would be happy to share my methods for guiding my disciples to the truth. As well as how to lesson plan around a hangover.

Allow me to demonstrate, Mister Colt, the sort of words women truly adore:
Within my garden,
nestled deep within the thrush
lies a hidden cave.
My cherished place, my sanctum,
I wish to guide you inside.
Private Hijiyama, I can hear your desire for a peace without cruelty, for security without destruction, for the warm embrace of a young gentleman in a skirt.
But even Japan’s imperial family could not control the entire country by themselves. Certainly other families have something to offer worth forming an alliance?
Oh no! ~name~ has already driven Natsuki to madness with his Dark Clown Arts!
Good choice, ~name~. Though my victory is inevitable, I am in no hurry to see your genitalia.
Remember, surrender is an option.
That is technically stripping, yes.
Your loss only strengthens my hold upon this table.
Not every victory needs to be thrilling, I suppose.
If you want to amass followers, you need to add much more pizzazz to your actions!
Were I still taking care to disguise myself as a man on the modern day, I suppose I might wear such a thing.
Yes, I get so hot and bothered by a man not wearing ~clothing.ifPlural(any ~clothing~|a ~clothing~)~.
~clothing.ifPlural(Those ~clothing~ compliment|That ~clothing~ compliments)~ your bright blue eyes so well, Lord ~name~. And how the light glints in it! Not that like mad gleam of Lady Futo’s.
I feel as though men with dark eyes are thought to be dangerous, but you seem perfectly harmless, Lord ~name~.
You have such gorgeous green eyes, Lord ~name~. I wish I could pluck them out and place them in the sockets of a fair maiden.
Lord ~name~, I’ve seen eyes like yours before… on an umbrella. It’s a long story.
Your eyes are so pale, Lord ~name~. You are not blind, are you? No, I suppose I would have noticed.
To be honest, Lord ~name~, I don’t often see red eyes like yours on human beings. Are you a youkai then? The vampiric Scarlet Sisters possess eyes red as blood, are they relatives?
You needn’t be ashamed of your stature, Lord ~name~. In sixth century Japan, that would have been an average height. It’s the people of this era who are unnecessarily tall.
I’m sure you think yourself tall, Lord ~name~. I however possess the ability of flight, and can soar far above you. So there.
What sensual stocking removal! Oh, right. Small blue-haired servant of the Scarlet Devil’s Mansion!
Oh, and Lady Remilia? I knew the whole time you were not the true descendent of Vlad Tepes Dracul. Mind reading powers and all that.
Lady Florina!
Oh, that isn’t Lady Patchouli? Yet you must admit, she has a similar aura to your librarian. There’s the unmistakable air of a youkai, as well as… purple. She’s very purple.
You two are sailors, correct? Watch out for the ghosts of the drowned. They might be Buddhist.
You are a sailor, correct, Lady Meia? Watch out then for the ghosts of the drowned then. They might be Buddhist.
I can feel your desire, to keep that which shames you secret, reaching a breaking point. Reveal yourself, Kirigiri Kyoko!
Why would removing socks kill you? It's not like it's a hat.
Ah, an heiress, not unlike a princess of sorts. It must be cushy, being the second in line. You reap the rewards, but little is expected of you.
Hmm. Well, the pattern’s rather straightforward, and easy to memorize.
I think your problem, Aimee, is that your danmaku lacks pizzazz. Where’s the multicolored orbs or curvy lasers?
You can’t fool me, Lady Alice! Through careful analysis of your desires, I have determined that you are a youkai!
Hah! If I had boots like that, it would take me only half that time to remove them!
Just so you’re aware, Lady Catria, your armor wouldn’t at all help you were I to unleash my most potent danmaku.
(Were she to turn her power against Gensokyo, I can think of none who could stand to go toe-to-toe against her. It would be the end of the Land of Illusion.)
Nevertheless, it just so happens I was unanimously elected as the First Health President of Gensokyo’s human village.
That is excellent news for me, for I am The State.
Even I cannot be considered eternally perfect. Why, once in the summer of 596 I had a “bad hair day.”
Lady Futaba, are you perchance someone’s underling? I have a minion of my own, known as Mononobe no Futo. She is also shrimpy.
Although she operates on a logic alien to any human or youkai, there is something oddly compelling about it.
Yes, there can be no doubt! The reason I cannot read her desires is because she has risen far above the level of human or youkai! She is that form of true immortal: the Celestial!
I have no doubt both our lands would flourish greater than any others in history with an intermingling of our bloodlines.
Ah! Though, I suppose it would do to keep you virginal until the wedding.
As such, your marriage will necessitate you converting over to Taoism. I trust that shan’t be a problem, considering all other religions pale in comparison.
I too would be loath to relinquish my cape.
Many years ago, youkai all took on monstrous forms. However, in my land of Gensokyo, natural selection has forced them to camouflage themselves as cute girls.
Ack! Tojiko! Where did you come from? And uh, with whom, I should ask.
Were I one of these charming Western brawlers, I suppose my stage name would be Rainbow Miko!
Lady Rarity! That barrier’s preventing us from seeing your nude form!
This barrier must be some sort of insidious youkai trick!
Are you one of the Librarian’s assistants, small girl? Last time I was there, I saw another succubus.
No problems, Miss Nikaidou! I am used to jiang-shi. Obviously, as a corpse, you didn’t bring yourself back to life. So, to whom do you belong to?
Oho, how amusing. A jiang-shi with noble aspirations! Of course, as the Crown Prince Shoutoku, Regent of the Japanese Empire, those aspirations show you to be my rival.
Lady Seiga is always trying to make her jiang-shi, Yoshika, more flexible. How has rigor mortis not yet set in for you?
After all, it seems unlikely any of our living fellows will still hold the same interest when they see what you really are. Either in their hearts, or their, ahem, loins.
Oh! I’m not sure if you’ve noticed, Jiang Shi Number One, but your head’s come off.
Soul gem? Are you perhaps a Taoist hermit, having achieved immortality by casting aside their old body and crafted a new one using an object of great power such as a legendary Chinese jian?
The Witch Byakuren competes with me for the hearts and minds of Gensokyo, and also made fun of my cape once.
ｈｘｐｐｙｔｈｘｕｇｈｔｓ
Where’s all that danmaku coming from anyway?
No, I suppose it isn’t that extraordinary. I wouldn’t at all be surprised to find hordes of girls slavishly devoted to my every move.
I've no fixation on feet. Good thing too, in retrospect.
Are there people enamoured with feet? It's a good thing I'm not, considering...
I too feel the pain of having to relinquish one’s most glamorous cape.
Oh I see. You are this era’s version of a “Lady of the Night.” I suppose such occupations never go out of style.
Well, let it never be said that the almighty Toyosatomimi no Miko would turn a blind eye to the suffering of one of her citizens!

To be a great ruler, you must use all tools at your disposal. You will need to learn to build consensus, communicate your vision, spread prosperity, sometimes do assassinations, and persuade others to your cause.
You may be strong as an Oni, Princess, but your Danmaku is still in its infancy. You seem only capable of producing round, green bullets.
Your maturity and mind have grown as little as your body. Nevertheless, I am confident the first two will one day blossom.
How terrifying. To wrest away man’s free will? Could any creature be more despicable?
I see that you are young, and still must hone your craft. But how wonderful Ladies Reimu and Marisa may one day have a comerade-in-arms.
I’ve heard of your kind. The Spider Youkai, Tsuchigumo. So, what business do you have with humans?
I only say this because the other Tsuchigumo I am aware of purportedly has the power to manipulate infectious disease. I’d hate for there to be an outbreak.
What is your family’s line of work? Are you rice farmers? Fishermen? Those are peasant sort of jobs, yes?
I clearly hear your desire for companionship, Miss Azami, but I’d actually prefer ~player~ to speak as little as possible.
But you also say you work in the study of medicine? Would you be allied with the Town Pharmacist/The Moon’s God of Medicine, Dr.Yagokoro?
I know your troupe has disbanded. But if The Muses desire, you would be welcome to perform in my honor at my palace.
Or, perhaps you realize that by keeping mute, you render me no more foresighted than a mere commoner?
It would certainly be asking too much to expect you to undertake the rigorous training necessary for becoming a hermit. But perhaps a simplified version would do.
Next, you must be introduced to the political sphere. Worry not, politics is easy: simply follow me blindly.
Now, I have no interest in killing Lady Byakuren, that would be far too crass. Instead, I wish for you to place her in an embarrassing situation.
Imagine, an army of soldiers with exceptional skill, strength, and obedience. And best of all, should any fall in battle no one need mourn them!
Youkai fighting other non-humans? That sort of thing happens often in Gensokyo, though pains are taken to ensure the general human populace doesn’t get caught up.
A soldier assembled for nothing but war would hardly need such a figure. Have you… other purposes?
Still, I sense in you the potential for a good soldier. How would you like to serve a Crown Prince and heir to an imperial throne?
Tojiko’s boundless grudge and Taoist training allowed her to return as a vengeful spirit! Now she gives Futo plenty of grief over the vessel. As she should, so I shan’t intervene in their tiffs.
Tojiko may act ill-bred and hot tempered, but in truth she is tender hearted. But you must be wondering, Lady Chara, how all this relates to you?
My religion, Taoism, teaches humans how to control the element, the cosmos, and even life itself!
As much as I appreciate a dedicated soldier, this is a place of leisure, Lady Laevatein. Relax, and find yourself a pretty lass to woo.
Any student of history will recognize my epithet: I am Prince Shoutoku, Regent of Japan, Writer of the Seventeen Article Constitution, and Saint.
Though your magic acumen is without fault, your problem solving approach is. You will never establish yourself as a true Arch Wizard without first mastering the subtle machinations of politics.
You needn’t worry, Lady von Varley. I am a discreet individual. We all have our, shall we say, base desires, and yours are nothing to be ashamed of.

I’m ashamed to admit it, Lady Yuri, but I’m no expert on foreign wines. Thankfully, I expect anything the Scarlet Devil Mansion “donates” to be worthy of your palate. Perhaps we can split a bottle or two, and you can educate me.
I honestly fear I’ve never loved my own progeny so. And, thanks to my immortality, most of my heirs have long passed. All that remains is the youkai of the masks I once crafted, Hata no Kokoro.
Most of my poems were either drivel, or else dry sutras to promote good social order. But I did enjoy writing romantic ballads. Shall I recite one for you now, Lady Yuri?
I don’t believe you’re lying about your parentage, Lady Stella. In any case, you possess the ability to manipulate the border between worlds, similar to a powerful being’s.
People are the same all over, then. I suppose it’s to be expected. Is there a reason you in particular developed such impeccable manners, Lady Pyrrha?
Miss Wikipe, do you have any entries in your library for a “Prince Shoutoku”? That would, of course, be my article. I wish to know what they say of me in this age.
To enjoy traveling means to enjoy seeing and learning new things. Commendable. To enjoy good food and drink is to enjoy life. Also commendable.
I’m surprised, Lady Pyrrha— someone with your beauty and talent should have to fend off armies of men and women suitors. Are there none you are close with?
But I did not allow my hardships to deter me, Lady Luxanna. In secret, I managed to perfect my power over the Tao as well as have plenty of lesbian sex with my covetable wife!
My ears are gifted, Miss Penny, to the point I can hear the desires in men’s hearts— or the metal gears in yours. You said your father built you, is he some sort of creator god?
Youkai are a capricious bunch, but I suppose even they have loved ones. Is there a reason you have chosen Sonic as your betrothed?

I’m a mite confused about your lineage. Are you the daughter of Hecatia Lapislazuli, Goddess of Hell? A progeny of Shinki, God of Makai? Of Satori, overseer of Old Hell? One of the creatures of Yakuza Animal Hell?
What would you wish to do in Gensokyo when you arrive, Lady Stella? There’s usually a party somewhere, with copious drink and snacks.
I’m glad to hear you’re not being treated poorly, Lady Fina. Still, you’re such a refined and charming maiden. I’d hate to see you tainted by swashbucklery.
You are an alchemist, meaning you bend the very cosmos to your will! The natural order sees you at its zenith! Carry yourself as a master of the universe should!
Now that I think about it, I don’t know why the youkai of Gensokyo adopt the form of maidens… but you’d never be able to sneak into human pubs looking like that.
I’m no stranger to combat capable maids, living in Gensokyo, but wouldn’t it be easier to change clothes between jobs? Cleaning while wearing that must be difficult.
It is an arduous task and many fail, but if successful you may wrap yourself in the sheltering shroud of immortality.
So that’s it. You’d gladly consign men to the oblivion of death to make a quick buck. How despicable, I have no words.
Why do I not have a dedicated barmaid? I feel like I deserve a dedicated barmaid.
From your perspective, I suppose you’ve yet to know me, but I can read your heart and know your past, present, and future. You’re a tomboyish princess with large… aspirations. Just my type.
Are you not yet a fully realized hermit? My comrade Futo is in a similar boat. Allow me to invite you to my dojo, so that you may complete your training.
I am sure is is quite the formidable experience. Fire, pits, spikes, pits with spikes, alligators. Or is it crocodiles in that hemisphere? Well, no matter.
Miss Gloria, can you understand me? My name is Miko. Can you say “It’s a pleasure to meet you, Miss Miko,” in your own language?
You’re an immortal alchemist like myself, but not a hermit? You must be a magician then, in the Western tradition. As an Eastern saint, I should very much like to learn from you.
Exceptional cuisine. Fine art. Beautiful women. Those of us who value aesthetics know how these things truly enrich the soul.
You wish to remove something small. Might I get you to reconsider?
Sadly, you only desire to remove your ~clothing~.
I know you only want to remove your ~clothing~. How disappointing.
There's someone here who desires to see you naked. Want to know who it is?
