Since I already know all of you from your desires, shouldn't you simply bare it all?
I can tell you want to settle for just your ~clothing~. Let's negotiate.
Ranking systems via the wearing of hats and feathers may have been necessary in Feudal Japan, but here they serve no purpose.
Your desires don’t fit what I’ve come to expect from humans, Lady ~name~, but I don’t beleive you to be a youkai either. Yet you’re similar to the nue creature of Gensokyo. Her name is Nue.
Your hair needs to be straightened out more, Lady ~name~. Why, even Lady Seiga makes sure her jiang-shi Yoshika is properly groomed.
Don’t hate me for saying this Lady ~name~, but your hair is a mess! Not like mine, which has a carefully controlled arrangement.
Although I am a woman, I prefer Prince to Princess. Old force of habit.
Question Princess ~name~: why don’t you just pretend to be a guy and call yourself prince? No one ever questions it.
I know some Taoist arts that would allow me to heal those scars I see, Lady ~name~. You know what, while we’re at it why don’t I create a whole new body for you?
Your uniform appears similar to those of the Moon Rabbits. Are you their ally?
I’ve seen tattoos on many a warrior from the days of Feudal Japan, but not often on maidens like yourself, Lady ~name~. Does it hold any special meaning for you?
Lady ~name~, I wish not to be rude, but… you have quite possibly the worst disguise I’ve ever seen from a youkai. The skin’s not even the right color!
Please let your mistress know I shall keep mum about her lack of shared blood with Dracula. Mistress Flandre is too sweet a child to burden with such ignominy.

In any case, Lady ~player~, allow me to leave you a guide to the Hourai Pharmacy. You can get checked up “after the fact” there.

Prosecutor von Karma, my first order for you as Crown Prince Shoutoku, Regent of the Japanese Empire: protect my lady parts in this card game!

Or are you some manner of Gremlin?

Oh noble Ai-Sama! Teach me what I need to know to achieve eternal youth and life and enter into Bhava-Agra!
Though the only one I have to offer now by way of heir is a thousand-year-old collection of masks named Hata no Kokoro, I shall see you two wed! When she comes of age, of course.

Oh, and pay no heed to your new Aunt Futo. I would actually prefer you to not burn down the Buddhist’s temple.

You aren’t hiding cat ears under that head fur, are you Lady Borowski? There’s something unmistakably… feline about you.

And Tojiko’s would be… Tojiko.
Hold on. Lady Rarity, judging from your look and nature… there’s no doubt. You must be a youkai!
Or perhaps you work for Miss Meiling, the fetching Chinese gate guardian?

Also, how could we teach Yoshika dance moves? Think of the faith I could gather through a troupe of dancing jiang-shi!
Of course, I could be proven wrong. Perhaps there is a place for jiang-shi in civilized society.
You needn’t worry, our jiang-shi Yoshika has the same often happen to her. Sometimes for play, Lady Seiga will hide her head and have her search for it!
Not that there’s anyone at this table that description necessarily describes. Eheheh.
You mention witches who cause misery. Do you mean the Black and White Ordinary Magician? Did she steal from you something precious?
Well, since you asked me politely to get out of your head, I shall oblige.
Though, I suppose my actual consort doesn’t adhere to those characteristics.
This one doesn’t seem entirely human. A youkai, perhaps? I’d listen closer, but all ten of her desires seem to be for… tentacles?
Crown Prince, she’s been loudly proclaiming that she’s the Monster Lord since before this game even started.
But according to you, you engage not with your patrons directly, but through your “internet” portal? Hmmm…
I… suppose I can teach you how to remove your clothes without messing up your hair as well. Seriously, these young rulers…
Join me and witness my vivacious patterns of twelve ranks and colors!
On that day you decide to study true sorcery, I shall lead you to my dojo. Once you’ve mastered my teachings, all in your land will know you as an almighty Hermit, Arch-Wizard Megumin.
Oh well. Should such a being appear in Gensokyo, I would merely have to assume direct control over the human village to protect against this rogue goddess.
Of course, should you study the Taoist arts under me, even the greatest youkai could do little more than tremble before you. What do you say, Lady Schnee? Become my disciple?
Be warned, Amygdala. Do not try anything disruptive, for I am no ordinary human. Were we to clash, you would be destroyed.
Lady Rin of the Clan Tezuka! Allow me to make use of my Taoist Hermit Arts, and fashion for you a new pair of magnificent arms!
Wait, Young Sumireko tells me the serfs of the modern world all work in “IT Support.” How well supported are the ITs of your family?
Too often my compatriots blather on, but I only need to hear a fraction of a sentence for one’s life story to be laid bare to me. So thank you for not boring me with unnecessary talking, ~player~.
Wait, it is foolish of me to assume those two are mutually exclusive. Surely you must sing of the wonders of a healthy body! I admire your advocacy, Lady Nishikino!
After all, I can hear in your heart you desire nothing more than to sing together once more.
Oh— you changed what you were stripping? I can’t predict your actions, and you’re— you’re flaunting your obfuscation!
The first step to controlling the physical world is to understand it. You must learn all there is to know— even the things so gruesome no ordinary person would dare to contemplate!
A proper citizen helps their fellows to build a flourishing society. And for society to flourish, they must be led by a bold and brilliant leader!
Ooh, how about sneaking into the temple at night, and getting pictures of Byakuren masturbating? Close-ups of the legs spread, dripping cunt, hairy muff! Then give those pictures to me.
However, I don’t see the human village taking kindly to entrusting their protection to an enchanted militia. The idea isn’t worth the political struggle unless I deem it absolutely necessary.
Or perhaps your superiors have not the know-how to wage a proper campaign. Should your organization require an experienced administrator, I would be happy to assume direct control of your operations.
Violence and sex are so often found intertwined. The more death we deliver the more life we seek to create. Being able to offer both… you really are the perfect soldier, Lady Florence.
Whatever house you may reside in now, I assure you it pales in comparison to the Taoist Clan’s: The Purple Owls!
And as the record states, Futo was the wife of Soga no Umako, and Tojiko’s mother. Even I don’t care to pry into that rivalry, Lady Chara.
You needn’t be defined by your grudge, Lady Chara. If you wish, you can strive to lay your vengeance to rest.
Of course, such a philosophy is not suited for the needs of the populace. Instead I pushed a miserable religion known as Buddhism to placate the masses.
If you need permission, take it as an order from Gensokyo’s True Administrator: Crown Prince Toyosatomimi no Miko!
Feel free to ask me anything about my influential and successful reign, Lady Cynthia. It’s not often one gets to meet your historical idols.
Arch Wizard, I can teach you how to use but the deftest touch to unveil the truth of your worldview to your opponents. Then, if they still fail to heed you, you may explode them.
Through my preternatural perception, I detect a streak of anxiety buried in your soul. However, those who ally with my cause have nothing to fear.
I’d love to receive a private lesson in wine from you, Lady Yuri. Perhaps afterwards, I could find something to teach you about.
Your blessing is the real deal, Lady Nagisa. Though darkness may yet swirl about you, never shall it touch you. And without control of it, your neck may as well be underneath a sword.

The mountains I’ve left,
Not from a lack of love, but
My duty lies South.
My hands run through the green grove
And with vigor anew, probe.
I wrote that poem for Tojiko, Lady Yuri.
You are powerful, Lady Stella, even if you still haven’t a perfect handle on your abilities. If I am correct, even Lady Yukari does not have the power to bore into alternate versions of worlds.
So you’re in much the same boat I am, Lady Pyrrha. I too shower others with respect and understanding, as is befitting the nature of my station.

Your knowledge of me is impeccable, Miss Wikipe! Or rather, it sounds like the knowledge of me that my supporters would have disseminated. Flattering, but not totally accurate. Perhaps a re-write is in order?
Travel is relative, Lady Stella. To a Sixth Century Japanese peasant, a trip to the West may as well be a new dimension. In any case, I hope your travels take you one day to Gensokyo.

Lady Pyrrha, I have no doubt most women thought I was “out of their league” too. This is because, as the crown prince, I was. Anyway, my advice is to have the head of your realm’s most powerful clan arrange your marriage to his daughter.
Join me, Lady Luxanna, and I will teach you to harness your potential, demystify the hermit arts, and pleasure the sultriest of women!
“Selfless” isn’t a word I’d apply to any youkai I’ve ever met, but I don’t think you’re lying. I am curious of your tale of recapture by your Sonic, Miss Amy Rose.
Well, your aura proves that you would be a formidable foe… were this not strip poker. I shall be satisfied knowing you cannot link me to any pegasus mafioso bosses, Lady Charlotte.
You seem as well adjusted as one could ask, so I shan’t worry about your well being. …Erm, hello, Sir Cupil. That thing isn’t quite as fetching as you are, Lady Fina.

I have lived for many centuries. I was destined to die, but avoided that through unnatural means. And I hope to teach others to surpass mortality. Don’t you think that’s wonderful, Lady Hu?
Death is the end of all potential, Lady Hu. If ever you leave this Earth with no regrets, you simply set your desires too low.
Madam Syrenne, have you anyone you can recommend I hire as a personal barmaid? She must be organized, efficient, buxom, and familiar with mixology.
Since you’ve already started down the road of the hermetic arts, Lady Monika, I’d skip the basics. You would study natural science and alchemy, since to understand the world is to control it.
Oh, if I were to invite my consort to bed with us, would she need to complete the dungeon herself, or would my trip suffice for us both? Or if it’s easier, I could do it twice.
Forgive me, Lady Kumatora. I’d never pry into the heart of a maiden if I could help it. Sadly, my divine hearing isn’t something I can shut off. My headphones dampen the sound, but only a bit.
Despite my hearing abilities, she doesn’t seem able to respond in any language I can understand. Perhaps the poor wretch is incapable of human speech? I shouldn’t judge her for it.
Oh no! ~name~ has already driven Natsuki to madness with her Dark Clown Arts!
It’s a start. But hopefully, not a finish.
Pah! Sanae took off more than that during last weekend’s drunken revelry!

All of life is a political battle. You won’t get anywhere without some give-and-take.
You’re foolish if you think you can get anywhere in life going it alone.
Lovely ~clothing~. I wish I could have worn something so nice back when I had to disguise myself as a man.

What beautiful blue eyes you have, Lady ~name~. They say eyes are the window into the soul! Must be why Lady Seiga’s feel empty.
It must be nice to have such dark eyes, Lady ~name~. They say black goes with everything, so coordinating an outfit can’t be overly taxing.
Lady ~name~… I noticed your eyes are green… hello.
I’ve seen eyes like yours before on humans, Lord ~name~, but more often on youkai. Be you a Karakasa obake, like… uh, what’s her name? Tachibana Small Umbrella, I believe.
Your eyes are oddly pale, Lady ~name~. I don’t wish to cast aspersions onto you, but you are definitely not a youkai, yes?
Some think red eyes are an ill omen, Lady ~name~. I am not afraid, though. Not even the Lunatic Red Eyes of the Moon Rabbit Inaba could faze me.
If you don’t study properly in school, you will be disadvantaged in the future.
I must say, Lady ~name~, your stature is… Um, I mean, feel free to stand closer to me, Lady ~name~.

My, that's quite the frilly ~clothing~ you have there, ~name~. I'm not even looking at it, I just know the style in Gensokyo.
If all you aspire towards is common soldiery, then live in accordance with the customs of your time. But to be truly great, one must surpass common morality. Do not fear your own potential.
Feel free to surrender at any time, and leave with your honor intact.
Going for the ~clothing~, are you?
Oho! Seeing what you're going to remove... this should be interesting.

Not an insignificant piece, that. Still think you can win, Lord ~name~?
~clothing.ifPlural(~Clothing~ are|A ~clothing~ is)~ better than your last choice, I'll admit.
This had better not be another trinket.
Private Hijiyama, do not accept not being the man you once were. Embrace it. That man was mired in limitations. Limitations you can now shed.

If I read your heart’s desires, there is no need for words. Wouldn’t you like to fight me, and achieve some merit should you defeat me?

You have my respect for not yet abandoning the game. Sadly, you won't have my mercy.

What a splendid choice, Princess Mavis-hime-sama! Servant from the Mansion of the Fake Scarlet Devil! Gaze upon the beautiful future Vampire Queen!

I fully endorse this turn of events, Lady Mavis.

To become one with nature, you should spend an entire day isolated in the wild, deep in contemplation from sunup to sundown.
A weapon of the outside world? This should be fun.

It seems you must remove your blade alongside your tunic, Princess Lucina.
The Lunarians are a great deal more concerned with purity than you. Or perhaps you were named ironically, to torment them?
A tip from a longtime master: you’d be even more convincing with a fake beard. You can see a picture of mine on the Ten Thousand Yen note.
You forgot to bring clothes to a game of strip poker? I guess you’re as dumb as the fairies in Gensokyo too.
Your hair reminds me of clouds… could it be possible?
Being the case you are not the Buddhist Temple’s cloud spirit, I can enjoy your body without worry.

Just… do it out here, in the open, like the rest of us. Are you listening, Youkai?
More barriers!?
Hold on, I want to see more, not less! More body I mean, not more clothing.
By the sounds of it, an insufferable layabout. Sleeps the whole day away, which is why I guess I never see her.
I hear she’s some delinquent who caused a calamity a while back. Purposefully I mean, not like my innocent incident.
Those time manipulation powers are not unlike my Taoist Magic. What say you, Madam Sakuya? Care to serve a most noble prince instead?
Your lower garment has been undone since we started, Miss Revy.
Oh, you’re just getting naked already? I suppose that saves me quite a bit of trouble.

Far more effective are subtle manipulations of politics, machinations that elevate your interests and tear down that which might oppose you.

I myself need not wear makeup, my body is forged to be naturally beautiful.
I am picking up hints that you desire to have panties.
Wait, why would you ever want to remove your cape? I thought you were planning to keep it the whole game!
It doesn’t matter much to me, but why aren’t you bombing before the danmaku hits you?
You can dodge the danmaku. I just want you to lose the card game.
Though the citizenry need their libations, I must uphold myself as a model for all to follow, and as such must refrain from any public intoxication.
Hoho, this simple hex could never hold a candle to the cosmic power of the Taoist Arts.

If you are able to broadcast your body to millions of awaiting viewers, think of what I might do with my sermons!
Very well, I suppose if we must, we may draw in viewers with a little “entertainment.” Fortunately I’ve no doubt Seiga has a Jiang-shi or two she could lend to that front.
Though, I suppose my consort, Soga no Tojiko, has been without legs since dying. And I suppose death, too, is a disability.
Crown Prince, did you forget that I not only lack my legs at this juncture, but also my life? Neither, I feel, is to my detriment.
All eyes are on you, Lady Estelle! Command the moment, as you display your undergarments to the world!
By that I mean, what deeds of yours do you hope live on beyond your mortals days?
That manner of out-of-the-box thinking could surely throw off an adversary less clever than I! Well done, Princess.
I remember I once had a pegasus of my own, back when I was known as Prince Shoutoku. A jet black mare, with strength and speed surpassed by none.
Perhaps it is indeed possible to foster good relationships between humans and youkai. This game may prove a trial for facilitating further bridge building.
Young Sumireko oft tells of a place known as “University” that has abolished the use of rest and sleep. She intends to be exiled to there.
I had been worried that because Buddhism had fallen out of favor in Japan, the populace would not be sufficiently mollified.
If you desire a partner who will always be willing to share their thoughts, I might be of service, Miss Azami. Though I have been known to prattle on at times.
A bold choice, Lady Yakumo. Let’s hope it’s not a mistake to cast off something you so need the support of.
It is annoying I cannot decipher her desires, though. In a friendly game such as this, though, I suppose I can let my guard down.
Shouko Komi. I am not accustomed to being made a fool of by those who exploit what few weaknesses I have. But it’s clear now: you came here to torment me.
If you still remain silent despite my threats, then it is my loss. Perchance I have become over-reliant on my superhuman abilities and, dare I say, a bit arrogant.
Though I hate to admit it, Buddhism is a necessary evil for controlling the population. Someone like you, Miss Tomoko, needs to be chastened by its lifestyle.
You are beautifully carved, Lady Galatea. Your marble is near flawless. Not to mention, you make for some scintillating company.
Since you stand here before me, I assume you managed to keep enough of the faith to continue having power.
That’s rather disappointing, Lady Polina. You see, so far my harem consists of one, my wife. I suppose at the moment it hardly qualifies as a harem. But perhaps you can assist me in expanding?

The land of illusion, Gensokyo, is from where I derive. If he can see such a land, perhaps he has the slimmest chance to salvage your fate. Or she, I’m not really sure but I en\courage non-hetero\norma\tive relation\ships.
After you uttered a single sentence, Lady Nagisa, I knew everything about you— your past, your present, and your future. And from the beginning, I knew exactly how our conversation would unfold.
You’re a good listener, Lady von Braunschbank-\Albrechts\burger. Sometime those who speak little are a bother\some annoy\ance to me, for my ability depends on hearing. But you seem a good sort.
Ah, I understand now, Miss Senko. You are not a base youkai, born from fear, but rather a god, born from faith and worship. Your “pampering” is simply a blessing bestowed upon devotees.
A pity you won’t join me, Miss Wikipe, but I laud your dedication to serving your community. What is it that so draws you to them?
I suppose a variety of personality types would be most pleasing, so long as they are all amenable to me, Lady Polina. If you’ve met Tojiko, you understand submission clearly isn’t a priority for me.
Are those of your home city unable to appreciate a well-spoken woman? You’ve got such skill with the written word, sophistication beyond your years, and breasts the size of melons.
A goal-oriented life partner would suit me best. Though, now I have to ask: is it possible to wield multiple blade ladies?
Er, apologies, but when I was offering to “teach” you I was being flirtatious. I know much about love\making between women. Also govern\mental admin\istration. Up to you which course to take.
I sense a desire to remove your ~clothing~! No wait, that’s from me.
Oho! Seeing what you're going to remove... this should be exciting.
I can hear your desires. This is going to be a good one.
Your ~clothing~? I think our desires match up perfectly this time.
What's it going to be? I already know of course, I just don't want to spoil it for the rest.
Whatever you want to remove, I'll be satisfied so long as you're wearing less.
Nyeheheheh! Actually, I knew fully well you were Remilia so-called Scarlet all along. I just thought you might want to hide from Crown Princess Mavis, whose identity you pilfered!
Well I suppose you needn’t leave. Unless her money turns out to be as counterfeit as her family tree.
No doubt you are the true Queen of the Night, which such… meat on your bones. Quite unlike some spindly and scrawny vampires I could name.
You look like quite the healthy princess. The vampires in my home of Gensokyo seem sadly underfed.
Miss Nikaidou, did you just steal someone's beach toy? How shall we make sandcastles now?
That's supposed to be for watering the plants, Miss Nikaidou! Do you want them to wither?
It’s fine, it’s fine. Just remember not to overindulge.
And of course, we must burn those possessions of your which might lead you astray, such as Buddhist scrolls or ero games.
A simple display compared to the danmaku in Gensokyo.
Lady Catria, you truly thought that was fully dressed?
(Impossible! Her power surpasses the gods… the sages… even ME!)
Impossible, you read my mind again! I don’t care about your boots in the slightest!
Now, attempt to outspeed a Taoist Sorcerer to the finish line! Except the opposite, because the finish line is nudity.
Crown Prince, I know you well enough to know what you’re thinking. You shall devise no spell to partition your legs from your body, and that is that.
Take my pleasant hospitality, for instance. I am kind to my fellows, and for a very good reason: you catch more flies with honey than vinegar.
Oh, I needn’t worry about revealing sordid tidbits of my past. After all, I possess… what was it called? Diplomatic Immunity! Have you heard of it?
A banana? Is that a tool of her clown magic? Perhaps I should ask the mansion’s librarian.
Don’t look at the banana! It’s how she drives you to insanity!
And you take off your shirt much too quickly! That one’s not so much a complaint, just surprising.
This girl who knows not the state of her undergarments! What an imbecilic youkai!
My condolences, Princess Lucina. Though your Falchion is not the Seven-Star Sword’s equal, we both feel as if our weapons are extensions of ourselves.
Lady Misato. My consort lost her legs, and is also a ghost. Something as minor as a scar would never faze me.
You needn’t worry about me being disturbed at the sight of a scar. Yoshika has those all over her body!
Indeed, it would be quite in line with the humor of the one known as Junko to name a being as impure as you "Moon."
Still, it’s much more liberating to show yourself as you are, is it not?
So you desire to hide your undergarments? Brilliant! Too bad it is not working.
A pity you can’t magic yourself up a few more brain cells along with that dress.
Though it is doubtful I would be able to enjoy Unzan’s body regardless, seeing as he is an old man.
Well, at least the result was worth it. Next time though, allow us to see your disrobing.
Did you truly have to put up a barrier for this? Not that I am disappointed with the results, mind.
Ahahaha! Oh I jest. I recognize you, Lady Remilia. The weaker Scarlet Sister, right?
Ohohoho! My apologies, that was too rich to pass up. I knew the whole time you were Rumia— I mean, Remilia Scarlet.

If you ever change your mind, Madam Sakuya, you know where to find me. I’ll be in your library reading the collection of that wonderful Machiavelli chap.
I mean, we could see your panties since the beginning. This ends up being a bit of a let down.
Oh I see, you’ve casted a transformation spell on your clothes. I’m not sure if this is within the spirit of strip poker’s rules, but I’ll allow it.
Hm, in Gensokyo, Tsukumogami as powerful as your dress have a human form they can manifest. Your dress doesn’t turn into a girl, does it?
And if that doesn’t work, go to war.

That’s supposed to be used to clean the flooring afterwards, Miss Nikaidou! How shall the janitorial staff mop now?
How foolish to agree to become the thrall of a magical creature without first checking the dress code, let alone the “fine print.”
Well, at least try not to fall into despair when you lose this game. It would be troublesome for the others.
